Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chelherts
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to book this. Amazing location, you can pop back to hotel easily when you get tired and set off again. Tea in rooms which is really nice for a break too. Definitely worth paying the extra for a room over the canal as there is much to see from the window. Noisy if the window is left open but that's all part of the atmosphere. Room lovely and bathroom really clean - fab shower. i would say the worst thing is the breakfasst. Everyday scrabbled egg and bacon swimming in water. croissants filled with jam or cream and ot labelled so youdon't know which you're getting. This really was a disappointment but overall I would still go back and recommend the hotel. Ask for a late check-out too if you need one they are happy to accomodate.

Reviews.Title: “Another top rating for this Venice property”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at the Splendid. Checked in on a Thursday just before noon and was pleased to be upgraded to a junior suite without even asking. Room 274 had a nice view on the narrow side canal where there was always something interesting going on. The suite itself was very nice and spotlessly maintained. Large marble bathroom with one of those funny European shower systems--be careful or you will flood the floor. Middle room for seating and TV. Also included was a complete coffee-tea kettle and even better, one of those fancy iperespresso machines which produced an amazing cup of espresso. The bedroom was separate and included a very comfortable bed with luxury linens. Though it is included in the price, I did not try the morning breakfast. I did however order room service several nights. There are actually two room service menus, one available 24 hours and one available from their own restaurant during hours the restaurant is open. I ordered from the 24 hour menu and the service was prompt but there was a language problem upon ordering that resulted in one of my dinners not being what I ordered. Not a big deal and what was delivered was tasty enough. As others have mentioned, the location of this hotel is ideal in my opinion. In addition, if you take a water taxi from the airport and return, the hotel has its own little dock which is very convenient. The hotel staff will order your taxi in advance if you wish. Overall, a wonderful stay at the Splendid and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy'sgirl
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews on trip advisor and I am really glad I did, because it was just great. I couldn't fault anything about the hotel. Rooms were nice, staff were friendly and helpful, lovely bar area to sit in and chat, breakfast was good. Whilst we were in Venice we did lots, I hadn't really known what to expect, but I just loved Venice. We went to the islands of Murano and Burano. We eat in a lovely restaurant in Burano called Al Gatto Nero, would definitely recommend it. We. Went to Harry's bar off of St Mark's square. They served the best Bellini's we had, but also the most expensive at â‚¬16 each. We had a ride in a Gondola, which we felt we had to do and couldn't back from Venice having not been in a Gondola. We paid â‚¬120 for the 6 of us. One Gondolier tried to charge us â‚¬150.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: renlinglasgow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, easy access to the main tourist spots (San Marco Square and Rialto bridge); and an easy walk or vaparetto ride to others. The room was quite small, but perfectly functional. A proper double bed and a really big bathroom. The breakfasts (included if you book direct with the hotel) are really good and I wasn't expecting that to be honest, because other hotel reviews led me to believe most hotels in Venice only offer a few pastries and coffee. This was what they called an 'American breakfast'. A really nice touch was they knew it was my birthday and left a small gift and a personal note - those chocolates were delicious!! Another really sweet thing was that they provided a weather forecast for the following morning with the turn down service. The room overlooked the restaurant (rather than the canal) so we could hear the piano player in the evening, but there was no noticeable issue noise at breakfast time (so sleep ins were still possible). As others have said the check-out is a bit slow, but it was really busy being a public holiday (bank holiday) weekend. All in all, a great base and fair value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in everyway”
Reviews.Author: linzc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my partners birthday and absolutely loved it . The service from all the staff was excellent and they were always friendly. The breakfasts were lovely and not over facing like many other hotels. The hotel is situated 2 min walk from St Markâ€™s square with lots of restaurants and shops around it. The rooms are lovely and spacious and very well equipped with all the amenities you require. They have a small mini bar in the room that is re stocked every day. The decor of the hotel and bedrooms is lovely. Very traditional and welcoming. I will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in amazing setting”
Reviews.Author: SwindonBubsie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from celebrating my husband's 40th birthday in Venice and stayed at this hotel. Booked after extensive research and reading reviews on TA, and happy I did. I don't think the hotel plays enough on its great location. It's in the heart of beautiful, traditional Venice, and away from the hustle and bustle and commercialness of The Grand Canal and St Mark's. The reception and concierge staff were very welcoming and friendly - in fact, the people of Venice were very friendly, and we didn't expect that. I payed a bit extra and stayed in a superior room with canal view. I did expect the room to be bigger than it was though... and did phone and ask that I had the right room type (as it was meant to be bigger than the deluxe rooms) as I couldn't imagine the room could be an awful lot smaller. But apart from that, couldn't fault the room - it was beautifully furnished and the bed, linen, bathroom were all immaculate. The coffee was rubbish though - get tea and grab coffee on the go! It didn't taste like proper coffee to me - more an improvised instant :-( And you expect a good coffee in Italy! A bit put out that the couple in front of me had been upgraded to my room type and hadn't paid for it... but I wouldn't have been complaining had I been upgraded! All in all, a super stay, and I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel... and a meal at http://www.algiubagio.net/ - another TA review recommendation - amazing and great value for a special meal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: VassilyMoscow
Reviews.Content: While planning the short vacation with friends in Venice I discovered the very attractive boutique hotel near San Marco square. The hotel exceeded all our expectations. Lately renovated with boutique style design and furniture, perfect location on the small channel in the heart of the tourist area,wonderful rooms,trendy restaurant and bar,very helpful and friendly staff. Strongly recommend as a place to stay and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, better hotel than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Europe in 20 years, and this was my first hotel. It exceeded my expectations. People were friendly, rooms were clean and functional, and the breakdfast was great. It was so easy to walk to the great places in Venice from here. Compared to the prices I saw for other hotels, this was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Panzerbear
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was excellent, and would definitely consider staying here again if we return to Venice. The staff were exceptionally polite, the breakfast was great and the restaurant was incredible on the one occasion we ate there. The location was perfect, almost exactly half way between Rialto bridge and Piazza San Marco, so in a city where it is very easy to get lost we could always find our way back to the hotel by following the plentiful signs to either. The room was spotless, with a nice view over the canal. If I had one complaint it was that the "double" bed was actually two singles pushed together, and on a very polished floor they kept sliding apart very easily. Hardly a major complaint though! We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice. I can't, however, comment on the price, as our stay was paid for by Airmiles so I don't know the normal prices.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: gramargot
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel after many trips to venice.. If I return there I would definitely stay there again.. Wonderful location, on a small canal.. Lovely rooms and great helpful staff.. A real winner!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Seutonious
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but praise for this hotel. My partner and I spent three nights here whilst visiting Venice. The staff are very helpful, we had a first class room which overlooked a little canal and gave limited views of the city. It's location was just two small blocks from St Marks Square in one direction and the Rialto Bridge in the other. We had a really nice meal in the restaurant which is warmly decorated, and has attentive staff. The hotel itself is very stylishly decorated without being overdone. We were constantly getting lost in Venice which we suppose is part of it's charm. The whole place is a maze of little alleys and canal bridges which all look very similar. We caught a Vaporetto from the airport which dropped us off at the Rialto Bridge . From there it is just a few minutes to the hotel, when you manage to find it .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2aspen
Reviews.Content: 19 of us stayed for 1 night. The hotel is clean and the rooms spacious. We used the bar and had a lovely breakfast. Good value for money and well located. Friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Saint Valentine's Day”
Reviews.Author: Yulia M
Reviews.Content: It was the most romantic place I ever could imagine. The hotel is full of beautiful details, style, design, everything is excellent! You just feel very relaxing there, what else do we need for romantic weekend? And ... very comfortable pillows :)

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in whole Italy for family”
Reviews.Author: Corbellini
Reviews.Content: This hotel is much more than 5 stars considering the location that he is in Venice, the size of the room for family (one small living room, one room with two beds for the kids and one room with a double bed for us). The location is between the Rialto bridge and the San Marco Piazza (5 min for each attraction). Beside of that an amazing restaurant and a service outstanding. The kids loved their exclusive room with a TV just for them. For sure this is the best hotel that we stayed during our whole vacation in Italy (Rome, Florence and Venice).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - would return”
Reviews.Author: Pudgina
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel by a private water taxi â‚¬120 there and â‚¬110 on the way back - certainly a great way to arrive at the hotel even if a little pricey. Lovely hotel in a great location, perfectly central to everywhere. Check in was easy after a small wait in the queue, reception staff were OK, I can't say I felt a warm welcome but too be honest I didn't expect one and its not a 5* hotel. I know previous reviews have been negative about the reception staff but not sure what people do expect? Room was small but suited our needs, only use the room to sleep and shower! Our room over looked the atrium so at times was very noisey. Breakfast - was very simple and basic not sure how often it gets very busy at this hotel but had to wait one morning for 20 minutes to get seated - I should imagine in high season this happening every morning. Lovely bar and get barman (Marco) very friendly and helpful. Having said that I would return to this hotel, perfect location and suited our needs for our long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 times, a great location,very modern rooms & very good restaurant. Rooms vary greatly in size. Best rooms are in front of hotel facing canal. Very modern marble bathrooms, good beds, on demand English speaking movies on TV..free wi-fi in lobby. Do not open windows because mosquitos get in rooms. Air conditioning good. Only transportation to hotel from airport or train station is private boat & very expensive. Better to take vaporetto to Rialto Bridge and walk a few blocks, but get a map because it can be very confusing. One small bridge with a few stairs on each side to cross.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first visit to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: EssexAngelDelight
Reviews.Content: I planned a surprise trip to Venice for 4 nights to celebrate my husbands 40th birthday. I did a lot of research when choosing a hotel and thought the Splendid gave affordable luxury and the location was great for a first visit to Venice. We arrived by water taxi from the airport and even though â‚¬120 it was well worth it for a fast, fun treat. When arriving I did wonder how the hell would we have found our way! Hotel has its own landing area on the side canal. I booked a standard room but when we arrived we were shown room 511 which was on the top floor and had a lovely terrace with a table and 2 chairs with a view of the tower in the square. Below was a side canal. The room was not massive but I had read that Venice rooms are small. It was perfect for us and we thought very smart. Stunning! Lucky us! It was an upgrade so thank you Splendid/Citalia! The bed was amazing and very comfy. The pillow menu we did not use as we found our pillows were lovely. I want the bed and pillows/duvet for home! Breakfast was nice, we found it tasty and the selection was plenty enough. I never got a chocolate croissant despite going very early a few days. :-( never mind, there are lst of other yummy things to have. We always managed to sit in the conservatory which was lovely. The staff in the hotel were very nice. The bar men were very good. Location was really good and so central. The map they gave us on arrival was really useful. We still got lost but half the fun! One tip, if you get lost and are near the Ferrari shop, the take the alley next to it which has Splendid in tiles in the floor follow it and you will come out right inbetween the main building and reception door - ditto to following the alley to the Ferrari shop which is what we did on day 3 and could have saved getting lost a few times. Didn't eat in the hotel for dinner but perhaps we should have. Had a horrid meal at the restaurant opposite so please avoid! Had a wonderful time and so glad I chose this hotel. My only negative comment is that on day 4 a very large group arrived (an American jewellery company). I felt that the way they took over the Lobby and set up tables as "their area" was very off and unfair for the other guests and they took over. They all met for dinner and the meeting place was this area. 40 + people all standing blocking the small area for everybody else to try and get past was horrid, it was impossible to get out of the lift to either go to the bar or walk in/out of the hotel. They (the hotel or the organisers of the group) did not leave an area for other guests to be able to get past. The hotel should have placed these tables either in the very back of the restaurant so they had their own area, or in the corner by the downstairs toilets (and still leaving a pathway for anybody who still needed the facilities). Just felt it needed a mention as I did feel our peace was shattered just due to the way it was organised/done and there were quite a few other guests there (couples like myself) so our holiday should have been considered. Also I was happy with the room temperature but my husband felt hot. There was no way to control the temperature/turn the heat off. Luckily he could have to door open when he needed/at night due to our room being high. I feel I would like to go back to Venice in the future. Would I stay at the Splendid? Yes. Also I would pick Starhotels again in the future at other destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, cosy and elegant!”
Reviews.Author: ABandJH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of Feb so 3 days and 2 nights (perfect amount of time). Very good location, just slightly away from the hustle and bustle of the endless shops. You don't travel to venice for the hotels or rooms as you are barely in them. But our room was very cosy and clean. The bathroom was clean and the shower easy to use. The room had a view of a street light and ally but it didn't matter. Except that people do get to work early so you can hear them, no matter what room you're in I expect. The breakfast was nice but basic, eggs and bacon, cereal, croissants and fruit. Most people would like to go out an explore and have it somewhere else. Wifi was only available on the ground floor and you had to get a code printed out for 30mins access, also the tv channels are all Italian apart from MTV. We didn't eat dinner at the hotel restaurant because we wanted to venture into town. Some of the hotels we passed nearer the grand canal looks a bit more run down and in a noisy area so we were pleased with ours. tips- -get a private ski boat from the airport to your hotel - (100euros, 30mins) pricey but worth it! Get the airport taxi on the way back (15 euros 1hr) - do not eat close to Basilica di San Marco as it's pricey, get lost, have a walk and find somewhere unexpected, we found Hosteria Al vecio Bragosso which had fresh tasty food. -don't get desserts - have a walk with all the ice cream available and see the town at night -take a gondola in the daytime, just as romantic and you get a bit of a history lesson with all the famous locations -ask about the museum passes in detail, we couldn't find some of the galleries and museums we bought tickets for - get a caricature by the grand canal

Reviews.Title: “Clean central hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonymous52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March, the hotel was in a great location and very central in between Rialto bridge and Piazza San Marco. The room was quite small ( we booked a superior room) but comfortable enough for 2 nights, if we were staying longer I would have tried to change to a larger room. Breakfast was fine with a selection of bread/pastries, cold cuts etc and eggs and bacon. The staff were helpful and extended our checkout time for another couple of hours since our departure time was later than the usual check out time. All in all a good hotel to have as a base to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: buck0123
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated between St marks and the Rialto bridge. On arrival we checked in quickly and shown to our room. The room was spacious clean with all the extras you expect from a 4 star hotel.We ate in the restaurant on the first night and was impressed with the service and food,prices were reasonably. Breakfast was to a high standard with a good selection of food. i would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lacking the finer points”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller089
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a superb location, which makes this a benefit. The warm interior is also something that makes this hotel special, especially the very warm and cosy bar. On some levels this hotel is special as the candles, sofas, cushions create a home from home. The barman doesn't just serve drinks, he is amusing and full of charisma. However, on another this attention to a home environment needs work. Whilst the restaurant is superb, it is over-priced compared to the other restauants nearby, The rooms are furnished nicely, the bed is very comfortable especially after a long days sightseeing, but there are distinct lack of power sockets. There is a lack of information given out by reception regarding breakfast: to eat in the beautiful conservatory style court yard you need to book in advance. The breakfast needs work; if you want continental then you will love the hotel's menu but the American breakfast is somewhat lacking. Also, the signage needs to be clearer as you can easily pass by the hotel completely late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and superbly decorated”
Reviews.Author: charliesangel02
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Marco Polo airport you can choose to travel to the hotel by land bus, water bus, or water taxi. We chose water bus. It costs â‚¬25 for a return trip (â‚¬15 one way) and it took an hour and a quarter to reach St Mark's Square. From what I understand, a water taxi costs about â‚¬70 (one way) but takes less time and will take you directly to your hotel. It's a ten minute walk from the water bus stop at St Mark's to the hotel. The hotel is five minute walk from both St Mark's Sq and the Rialto Bridge so makes an excellent base for exploring. It has been recently renovated and it certainly shows. The decor is absolutely beautiful. Even the toilets in the lobby are worth a mention they are so swanky! We stayed in a lovely deluxe room on the fourth floor (411) that had a canal view. The room wasn't particularly big, but was perfectly fine for a two night stay. The only problem we had with a canal view room was the noise. The Gondola's with the music, the power boats making their deliveries and not to mention the occasional building work that went on in the area. They don't have double glazing so you hear everything! The restaurant in the hotel is excellent and reasonably priced. We honestly didn't know what to choose for lunch, it all looked good! Breakfast was buffet style. The only hot food to choose from was lightly cooked bacon and scambled egg. The rest was continental. We ordered breakfast in our room on the second day and we were given just one plate of bacon and eggs to share along with the cereals and bread. We called down for a second plate, but just got a grumpy waiter that came to the room, looked at the tray and then left! It just made us laugh rather than annoy us. The lobby and bar have a very relaxing atmosphere and you could happily lounge around for ages. Internet is free in the lobby (not in the rooms) but you have to ask for a voucher code and it only works for 30 minutes. The reception staff are worth a mention, they were very friendly and helpful :-)

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but good base for first time visitors to Venice”
Reviews.Author: wavesBondi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently during a 3 day visit to Venice, was lucky that I was able to get a combined flight/hotel deal from expedia which reduced the cost. The hotel is in a good position for the main tourist attractions and therefore in the middle of the venetian tourism and shopping district! It's a short walk from the Rialto water bus stop which is easy to get to from the airport and makes it hard to get lost as can always follow the signs back to Rialto. The hotel is expensive, has a nice bar area but charges 10 euros for a beer, states it has free wi-fi in the lobby but to get this you have to get a voucher from reception everytime you want to use it and then is around 10 euros to use the wi-fi in the rooms. The rooms were comfortable, with great beds and linen but not very spacious, the furnishing of the superior room I stayed in looked nothing like the web photos. Seemed to be alot of large groups staying at the hotel when I was there, I would only recommend if for people for first time visits to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blackholer
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a short break to celebrate her 50th birthday and we were not disappointed. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a luxury suite, free of charge, with a view looking over the small canal 4 floors below The interior has been renovated extensively and our room was very comfortable with a king size bed. The bathroom was beautifully furnished with marble with his and hers slippers and dressing gowns provided adding a touch of finesse. The lounge bar area of the hotel is very relaxing and gondalas can be seen cruising along the canal whilst sipping bellini cocktails served with delicious canapes. The restaurant area has been built around an atrium with a glass roof. Breakfasts consist of croissants, fruit salad as well as the usual hot buffet fayre. We had a wonderful meal one evening and the candlelit dining area added to the ambience of the setting. The wine list is reasonably extensive as well. The location is superb as you are 5 minutes either way from the Rialto and St Marks Square with excellent shopping thrown in for good measure just outside the hotel. The receptionists were helpful to us in locating the Venice Jazz club and a small deli "Alle Arco"

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days during the recent Carnevale. Although it's well located between the two craziest places in Venice, Piazza San Marco and Rialto, the hotel is situated next to a serene and tranquil canal - quite lovely really. It's a little tricky to find coming from Rialto but much easier when approaching from San Marco. The hotel is modern and the lounge area is very nice indeed. My deluxe room with a canal view was reasonably spacious by Venetian standards. I enjoyed the spotless modern feel to it. Internet access in the room is charged but free wifi is available in the public areas. The hot breakfast was quite good by Italian standards (remember locals don't do the hot bacon and eggs stuff) and apart from the cheese and cold meats, bacon and eggs were also served in the buffet. The concierge was helpful in arranging dinner reservations. My main criticism is that the in-room dining prices were more steep than I had expected. Overall a strong recommendation in Venice, especially for those looking for a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Carnival Weekend Stay at Starhotel Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: CinziaVancouver
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was just that ... Splendid! I booked a double superior room for the carnival weekend. I arrived February 16 and stayed for 3 nights. My room overlooked a narrow street which was not noisy. The music from the tv was piped into the marble bathroom ...I loved the bathroom. There were complimentary toiletries i.e. lotion, shampoo and bath gel.. The hotel staff were wonderful. My room was so comfortable and of course being that I live in Rome and have only a shower, the bathtub was heavenly. The bed was super comfortable... and I also had a kettle with complimentary coffee... nice touch for first thing in the a.m. I loved the lounge. It over looks the small canal and the seating is really plush and full of pillows. I discovered this hotel the weekend prior when a friend had taken me there for cocktails. It is a very romantic setting and something I will never forget...the Gondola's stream by slowly like some sort of Discovery video. The bartender Marco is courteous and professional and the staff in the restaurant went out of their way to make me comfortable when I had dinner...I've never had so many men waiting on me. The hotel room was pretty quiet the only time I noticed noise was on my last evening when a Japanese tourist was yelling from his bathtub to another family member (for heaven's sake). For those that are particular with hotel room details I will provide the following information: the hotel room floor was a bit beaten up and there was a large crack on the mirror frame that surrounds the flat screen tv. The doors on either side of the hotel room I was in slammed shut quite loudly and it would shake my room as I am sure mine did although I would try to stop it from slamming. I am only mentioning this to give an honest review. I slept really well ... LOVED the bed. One morning I had breakfast in my room...amazing...they brought it right on time, the lady was courteous.. they had put an orchid in a small glass and I had ample food. I would definitely stay here again!!!... Location CENTRAL. Do not hesitate to contact me if you would like more info or photos.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Istanbulgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to enjoy Carnivale in Venice. We were given a room upgrade on arrival and treated wonderfully. The hotel is on a canal and our room overlooked another canal. The staff were wonderful, our room was beautiful and the breakfast was also excellent. It was a splurge for a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgie_UK_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in November 2011, hotel was clean and modern and in a perfect location would recommend. The hotel was easy to find and positioned between St Marks square and the Rialto bridge. Lovely hotel bar which overlooks the canal. Would recommend a trip on the gondolas.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: barcaranger
Reviews.Content: Firstly like all venice hotels you either have to take the vaporretto from the airport or Roma station or you have to take a private water taxi which is 120 euros each way. So why not take the vaporetto which is 20 something return? Well before you decide that is the best idea have a look on google map because you are going to be wheeling your luggage quite a long way from st marks where you will get off. Now the private taxi will take you right there to the hotel doors . So make your decision based on how fit you are and whether you have three kids a baby and luggage for a round the world trip. This advice applies to pretty much all hotels in Venice. Secondly my room was small, but to be honest so what it was in a nice hotel very close to st marks. If you want a scenic view or a big room pay extra, you can. Venice is old and hotels are higgledy piggledy and rooms will not all be the same. My room only had a shower my friend who paid the same price had a bigger room with a bath. The price during carnival was like 140 including breakfast which was a steal. The place has good service and the staff were pretty helpful which is standard for Venice Breakfast was good, fresh fruit , bacon etc no issue there at all. One final tip eat at trattoria San basilio the best place in Venice a brisk 30 minute walk away. Real food served by real people well off the tourist track. A few more final tips Do not anywhere where the menu is in Russian, in fact anywhere the menu is in 4 or more languages Head way from the crowds and the guides there is loads to see off the beaten track and why there are hundreds of people in one church not the other I have no idea. All of Venice is great it's safe and it's impossible to get really lost Finally finally use your feet you see more but the public transport is all good value and fun

Reviews.Title: “A very splendid experience at the splendid!”
Reviews.Author: englishrose1981
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, location couldn't be better - perfectly positioned between St Marks square and the Rialto bridge. Great bar where you can sit in the window and overlook the canal and watch the boats go by. We had a deluxe double with a canal view, it was lovely to open the window and see the tranquil canals all around. The breakfast room is beautiful, and there was a great choice of food for breakfast. The only criticism I would make would be that the central heating was on very high (it was freezing temperatures outside) so we had to switch it off at night and open the bedroom window to get some fresh air. There was alot of street noise going on which then made it hard to sleep. But overall a really great hotel and I will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: My friend and I shared a double room for three nights on a girlie trip. The hotel was ideally located between St Marc's Square and the Rialto bridge and was easy to find from the Vaporetto with our wheelie cases (I printed directions from the hotel website). The hotel was clean and bright with friendly, helpful staff and comfortable beds. The shower (over a bath) was excellent and quite reviving after a hard days sightseeing! Shampoo and body wash were provided plus there was a safe and ampl clothes hangers. The reception staff helped with banks and restuarants and they even have a "pillow menu" with a choice of neck pillows. Free WiFi in the lobby or I paid for 24hours for 5.50 euro. Breakfast was served 7-10.30 am with juices, cereal, cakes, ham, cheese etc, plus scrambled eggs and bacon as part of the buffet. Extras were available to order. Marco in the bar is fab. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Splendid Venetian Experience !”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJaneGlos
Reviews.Content: My husband & I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - from the outset we found the email contact all very helpful, friendly and informative and the hotel more than lived up to our expectations on arrival - easy to find from the Rialto Bridge and literally a matter of minutes to San Marco - perfectly positioned and a beautiful room - we were on 3rd floor with a Canal View, truly Splendid indeed - clean, spacious and very nice and light - perfect. We were so lucky with the weather and the whole trip was excellent. We found the desk staff and the guest relations lady very helpful and when (not if) we return to Venice we would not hesitate to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well named! Absolutely Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: kirstywoo
Reviews.Content: Had a glorious 2 nights stay at this beautiful hotel, and wished it could have been longer! We were warmly welcomed to Venice and the hotel by the staff. Our room was ready earlier than expected for us, which was excellent. The room itself was very modern in both decor and fixtures. Thi is not common in Venice, as majority of hotels are decorated in a more traditional style. We had a triple share room booked and I was slept onthe rollaway bed. The bed was as comfortable as a normal bed, so I was well rested to explore the city. Breakfast was included in our room rate. The breakfast area was bright and welcoming. The buffet style was mainly continental style with a small selection of hot items too. All was beautifully presented and fresh. Location wise this hotel is perfect! You are a short distance on foot from the vaporetto station and you are almost on Piazza San Marco. Like I said, perfect! Have already recommended this hotel to my parents for their stay later on this year. And they are fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ? YES !”
Reviews.Author: a-french-aloha
Reviews.Content: It is a must to write this review, even if it is to repeat what others wrote before ! This is an exceptionnal hotel, especially if you compare the price you have to pay for the other hotels in the same location and during winter. Before our arrival, I called to be sure they have for us a non smoking twin bedded room. It was confirmed on the spot, IN FRENCH, and without asking for, the Reception started to give me lots of info concerning the transfer from the airport to the hotel. As recommended, we arrived at St. Marks Square with the regular vaporetto (15 euros per pax instead of 120 euros for a private water-taxi) and we reached the hotel within 5 mns walk. It's Venice and believe me, the hotel is in an exceptionnal location. About 2 or 3 mns to arrive to St Mark Square or tho the Rialto, when you are without luggages. Our room - 414 - was with a canal view ! Very modern, clean, nothing missing to please a tourist. Even a small TV in the bath room. First evening, we were walking around the hotel to find a nice place for our dinner. On the way to the Rialto, a lots of little restaurants, with all the same menu for 18 up to 20 euros, written in 6 different languages ! Afraid to fall into a tourist trap, we have decided to choose a nice restaurant but prices were absolutly crazy ! After having a real very good breakfast at the hotel -(classic buffet breakfast with eggs and fresh fruits, we wanted to come back for a dinner. It was a real good solution = italian delicious food, restaurant is very elegant, the service is kind and relax, and prices are more than reasonnable. We came back every evening, with the same pleasure. Don't forget you are in Venice, the most expensive city in Italy. And, enjoy Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Great with a baby”
Reviews.Author: Piccolinabambino
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and decent sized room. Excellent location. Breakfast very good and evening meal delicious. The staff at the hotel were friendly, attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: lhul
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect I loved it the service is really good and the breakfast too all foods were delicious the room was big very clean perfect the consierges were very healpfull this hotel is wonderfull !

Reviews.Title: “Splendid indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Lovefoodlovetravel75
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking I feared the worst. I wanted to book a room online but had a question before booking. I called the hotel (it was midnight) from abroad on a mobile phone and was greeted with a rather impolite member of staff. When I said I had a question he said that it was too late; that there was no reception staff. I clarified, saying it wasn't a technical question. He asked me to call back in 5-10 minutes without even asking what my question was (I just wanted to know if they had baby cots at the hotel) as he was alone and with a customer!!! My husband and I stayed at the hotel with our 10-month old baby for one night. Our room was not ready upon arrival but that was ok. We were able to heat up a meal for our baby at the bar. We got an upgrade and the room was beautiful. It was modern and cosy but still managed to have a Venetian feel to it. We didn't have a view from the room but that was ok as the room was so nice! The bed was massive and really comfortable. The pillows were really comfy too. We were worried at first as there was no mattress in the baby cot but housekeeping were quick to arrive with additional bedding. The restaurant at the hotel seemed really good, yet a tad on the expensive side. Unfortunately we weren't able to dine at the restaurant itself as such is the life of being parents to a baby who's asleep in his bed by 7.30pm but the room service was good. The food was delicious and still hot when delivered. The meal was delivered with a gentle knock as not to wake up the baby... The bar area was really nice and cosy too with comfy sofas. The hotel was ideally located. The reception staff seemed stressed but overall the staff were very polite. Despite the unpleasant initial contact with the hotel, we adored the hotel and our stay. It was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mistykerry8015
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a special offer from expedia and whilst the hotel was being refurbished. Our room overlooked the canal, it was lovely and quiet. The room was great, really comfy and warm. The hotel is in a great location right in the centre of main Venice. The staff on reception were really helpful and helped us to find the best places to eat around the hotel. Great stay and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “"Starhotel was almost Splendid"”
Reviews.Author: Tracy N
Reviews.Content: My sweetheart and I went to Italy for Christmas and New Years. Fourth stop, Splendid Venice. Upon arrival and granted it was New Years Eve, we were one of two parties checking in, first impression was not the best. Having prepaid paid $$$$ to be there, I don't think asking for excellent customer service is too much. I don't want to feel like I'm bothering you and I just got there. Front Desk Staff may need a refresher, but we didn't let it ruin our night. The hotel is perfectly located, as others have stated. Convenient to San Marco Square with restaurants and shopping all around. Our canal view room was breathtaking and worth every penny! To say the hotel is beautifully decorated throughout would be an understatement. Just gorgeous. Loved, loved, the decor!! Did I say how beautiful it was?? Anyway, the matre'd and bartender know a whole lot about customer service as I found out the next evening. Starving and wanting something to eat at 5pm, there was no dinner or room service before 7pm, not good. The bartender was kind enough after being told by the matre'd how hungry I was and supplied me with all the bar snacks I could eat until then. Small kindness goes a long way in my book. Not saying we won't return to Splendid Venice in the future, let's just say I want to see if there is anything better out there. Overall, a nice stay at a beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Touch in Old World surroundings”
Reviews.Author: yyz2mbj
Reviews.Content: Great location if a little hard to find. (but then just about everything is hard to find in Venice.) Very modern beautifully furnished rooms. Nice breakfast and Water Taxi access. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “the best location”
Reviews.Author: BEKAMODA
Reviews.Content: We stayed fro 2 nights at this wonderful hotel. First of all the location of the hotel is perfect. Really in the middle between St Marco and Rialto, both takes 5 minutes, even less than 5. The breakfast is very good, omlette, bacon, cakes, italien cookies, cereals, orange juices, croissants, butter and jams, diffrent types of fruits, very digestive. the rooms are spotless clean, very modernly decorated. the only negative point for me and my husband was that the bed in the rooms is not comfortable and may be the hotel neds to check each bed in every room. the staff of the hotel is very helpful and problem solving. the first night we stayed at another room and was dissapointed by the noise coming from the service elevator and we asked to change our room the next morning. the lady from the reception was very helpful and immediately changed our room and upgraded us complementary to a canal view room which was wonderful. But the bed in this room was also uncomfortable unfortunately. one night we took dinner at the hotel restaurant with live piano music and next to the chimney fire which was very romantic and the prices are reasonable for a hotel restaurant and the food and the service was really good. Overall Ä± would recommend this hotel to all my friends and will definetly stay at this hotel again the next time I vist Venice..

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel- Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Denisp
Reviews.Content: I highly reccomend the Splendid hotel not only for its excellent location but also for the beautiful and spatious rooms. Upon our arrival, the receptionist was kind enough to upgrade our room to Canal view, which was really very impressive. If you can afford the Deluxe room just go for it. It's really worthwhile! If only the breakfast was better, I would have rated the Splendid Hotel as excellent...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrionKT
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. A few minutes walk to either the Rialto or San Marco. The staff were good, the bathrooms and amenities were fantastic, very clean rooms, and the breakfast wasn't bad either. The suites are very pricey for the space you get, but it is Venice. And we enjoyed our stay very much. We had to ask twice to get one of the rooms made up into a double, but it was taken care of. We only had an afternoon in Venice as we were passing through, but we managed to fit a lot in. Gondola ride, ice skating, shopping, lost in alleyways, dinner etc. Good stuff. Great city. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Big NoNo”
Reviews.Author: sammytina
Reviews.Content: Our experience was woeful! We had booked a superior room with a view, were given a tiny room on ground floor with a window onto a wall, requested to change, staff extremely unhelpful but eventually given the better room we had booked, until the smell in the bathroom hit us at about 8 pm. Staff still very unhelpful, our only remedy was to put wet bath towels against the cracks in door, next morning they said cleaners would fix it , room was sprayed with a perfume? same time next night same thing, we couldn't even use the bathroom with out a gag reflex. The smell was nowhere else in the hotel, at midnight we were reluctantly given another room. I really don't have a good word about this place, especially as we were robbed of our passports and money in the hotel foyer as we were leaving! If the staff had been at all nice to us it would have been easier, but hats off the to airport police who were absolutely charming and courteous to us.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and great location”
Reviews.Author: chokie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night at the end of a cruise. The location is just a short distance from San Marco and not much further to the water taxi station. We were upgraded to a junior suite and the room was lovely. The breakfast buffet was also nice. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: wallybazoom
Reviews.Content: It's easy to say, but this is one of the best hotel experiences i have had. From the charming, chasrismatic Alessandro at check-in to the attention to detail such as complimentary pre-dinner Belini's, this was a lesson in first class hospitality. Staying here between Christmas and New Year, the trip was planned with a view to my proposal to my partner. I could not have wished for a better setting. Asking at the time of booking for a room with Canal Views, we were allocated a balcony room on the second floor with just that. Spacious, spotless and beatifully finished with the most comfortable bed i have ever led on. We dined in the first night. And then again on the second night, such was the atmosphere, service and quality of food of the courtyard restaurant. 2 minutes walk from San Marco, and five minutes from the Rialto, the location cannot be beaten. I would wholly recommend this hotel to anyone, and would love to return again.

Reviews.Title: “magical”
Reviews.Author: marilias
Reviews.Content: Me and my husbent stayed there for 3 nights. It was the best choise we could make. Because i was pregnant i couldn't walk to much but everything was very close to the hotel. The room was big and with nice view. The breakfast was very nice but i would like something different some days. And the best was the restaurant with the piano. I would defently go back again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: LTAN72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the Rialto Bridge & St Marks Square. Breakfast (sit down, buffet/continental) was included. The room are pretty large and clean. I guess the only gripe is the surrounding area was always filled with people, but when you're that close to all the sights that's to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Wonderful Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Nipun R
Reviews.Content: The hotel has really a "splendid" location- Hardly a 5 minute distance from Piazza San Marco and Rialto Bridge. Our double bed room was neat and cozy with a well appointed minibar in place. The breakfast spread was excellent. The front desk staff was helpful with the map and directions (I just wish we could have got a smile at the time of checkout though). Overall, the expecience at Starhotel Splendid Venice was Excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Delsey2010
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great - a short walk from St Mark's square and the Rialto bridge. Room was nicely decorated and modern, however, some paint had come off the wall. The bathroom was clean but the shower could have been better. Overall the room was modern and good though. Staff were efficient but it was not the friendly and smiley service you get in many hotels. The breakfast was poor. The grapefruit juice was in fact squash (watered down - not fresh juice - or at least that's what it tasted like), the scrambled egg had pieces of egg shell in it, they only had white rolls for bread and a small selection of cheese cut to sticks. The fruitsallad tasted of nothing. The best part of the breakfast were the slovenian yoghurts and the pineapple juice. In general a good hotel though (can always go somewhere else for breakfast) and would probably stay here again. Would recommend eating in the nice cozy restaurant called Ostaria al Diavo'lo L'Aquasanta which is accross the Rialto bridge, only a short walk from the hotel. Very good food and great friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: nsv_sv
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed here for 3nights in mid- november 2011 for our 1yr anniversary. my husband had emailed them to ask if they could do anything to make it an extra special anniversary and they upgraded us! they couldnt have been more friendly. our room was gorgeous and the maids cleaned the room every day and turned down the room in the evenings. the front desk staff were very helpful with advice on where to go and transport. wifi was free in the lobby. breakfast was average - its def not an american buffet, but it was ok and the staff were very nice. the hotel has its own port for water taxis, but we didnt use the water taxi due to the price (120 euros one way!) . i would definately recommend this hotel to all. its location is absolutely perfect, close to the rialto bridge and st marks piazza. it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in mid-November. The only real critical thing I have to say is that the Front Desk staff were not very friendly (which I find hard to accept when you are in the Hospitality business). They never smiled when we walked by. Check in was the same frosty reception, so not the best way to start the stay. We had one question at check in and the gentleman said he would call us in our room to give us the answer. He never called. But the rest of the stay was great. The rooms are very nice - good size (we were not in a suite) and nice furnishings. The beds were basically comfortable, but one problem - ours seemed to have indentations on either side of the mattress. Housekeeping did a nice job each day, and the housekeepers were very friendly in the hallways. Bathrooms are great - our's had a nice tub/shower. The wi-fi was not very reliable - I ended up going down to the lobby to use the free wi-fi there (you need to get the code from the front desk). Location of this place was great - especially for your first stay in Venice. It's right in the middle of everything, and easy to get anywhere. We arrived by AliLaguna boat at St. Marks and walked to the hotel. It was fine - not a far walk, and no stairs. But you had to make a few turns that were not on the hotel's website directions. We still found it - no big deal. We ate in the hotel restuarant the first night because we were too tired to go out. It was good, and the service was friendly. The breakfast was fine. Overall, I would recommmend this hotel, but I still think the front desk staff need to warm up.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, newly refurbished hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location and has recently been refurbished to a very high standard. THe rooms are lovely, though a bit on the small side (hey, it's Europe) Limited number of English language television channels but that's just an aside. The mattress was VERY firm but the pillows were perfect - and they have a pillow menu if you'd rather change types. Wifi is free in the lobby but about $15 a day in the room (How annoying !) We know Venice fairly well, so didn't have a lot of interaction with the staff, though they seemed pleasant enough. Breakfast was included in our room rate and included eggs and bacon choices, which was nice. Would definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “stop looking, you've found the perfect one!”
Reviews.Author: DIZZYDOLLYDAYDREAM
Reviews.Content: Like you probably, I trawled the tripadviser & lastminute.com websites looking for that perfect hotel. This one will not disappoint. It has been fully renovated very recently, and our room was lovely & spotlessly clean, with fab toiletries. I am very picky too. We booked a luxury double with canal view. The room was no bigger than a standard modern hotel room in England, but the decor had a luxury feel, small but perfectly formed, with lots of lovely mirrors giving a airy feel. We were above the hotel private docking station(room 411), and it was great fun watching the Gondolers, private taxis and general boats going up and down. I didn't find it noisy at all, just fascinating. The breakfast was fine, fresh fruit, cereals, ham, cheese bread, pastries, cakes & yogurts. The public spaces are wonderful (check out the loos near the reading area/restaurant) The staff were very polite, and helpful. WE used the luggage room on our last day, as we didn't need to leave until 5pm, very easy, and all free. We flew into Marco Polo Airport, then took the water bus, (all sign posted, turn left as you leave the baggage hall, and the ticket office is just there inside) NOT water taxi, to st marks square (San Marco) we arrived at 11.30pm. It took 1hr 20, but felt much shorter, and it was very magical & relaxing arriving at that time . It cost 13 Euro per person. They go every hour at night. The private water taxis are about 100 Euro i think, but they look fantastic, very james bond, if you can afford it, i should think its brilliant. The hotel is 5 mins from there. How to find it? Easy when you know how! I got very anxious about all this before i went, i did my research and asked the questions and it was so simple in the end, so let me share it with you. When you get off the water bus (alilaguna lines is the official operator) take a left over the bridges, here you can take in 'The Bridge of Sighs' then you can't miss st marks square (san Marco) as you walk in you will see the campomile on your left (huge bell tower) and St Marks Basillaca on your right, walk straight ahead to the end, can you see 'American Snack bar'? (the water should be behind you) take that street, walk right to the top (2 mins), see the farrari shop? take the street to the right of it, this is technically an alley i suppose, but most importantly, it is flat, with no steps or bridges and if you have your luggage, thats important. You will come to the canal at the end, and either side is the hotel . On the right should be reception. Easy! Ask for a map when you check in too (there free). I found Venice very safe at night, and we walked all over. San marco is heaving with day trippers, so doing the sights there is best at around 4.30 when the q's have eased. Does it smell????? NO! it was 80 degrees when we were there, and it didn't smell or flood. You get the odd smell of a drain, but no more than any other hot country. We went for my 40th birthday without our children, and it was just the most amazing place. It was full of really nice people just like you and me, adoring the the spendour and uniqueness of the place. We were there for 3 full days. Yes, the food is expensive, and on balance, you probably wont go far wrong eating in the hotel, we didn't. Bottles of wine are probably a better bet than a glass, as the measures are very small and are about 4 euro a glass. Oh, i forgo to say, the location is excellent, its the kind of place you would walk past and say, "oh, i wish we had stayed there". Also, when we booked it with lastminute.com, on check out, it said they were painting the facade this summer, they are not, it was all done last year, so don't panic.! If you don't book this place, be carefull about booking on the Grande Canal, especially around rialto or san marco as these places are very noisy day & night. Rialto is good and buzzy on a night for bars etc. though. Enjoy, if you want to ask any questions please email me at lisa@thechapman.plus.com. I'm more than happy help if i can.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff unfriendly and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: divapp
Reviews.Content: The Splendid Venice is located right off the Rialto bridge and is walking distance to St. Mark's Square, so is in a fantastic location and you can walk to pretty much anywhere. The staff however, are not particularly helpful. If you ever ask them a question regarding how to get from place A to place B, they will ALWAYS recommend a water taxi. They don't even offer alternative solutions like public boats etc. unless you specifically ask for them. The breakfast which was included in our stay was a pretty decent spread, our rooms although big and spacious were plagued by mosquitoes. We spent our first night very uncomfortably only to ask for some sort of mosquito repellant the next day. The company staff tried to find one for us (they couldn't quite believe we were plagued by mosquitoes) and once they did find it, it was of practically no use. The room was overheated, we tried to cool it down to no avail, the air conditioning didn't seem to kick-in at all. All in all except for the location, the decent breakfast and the spacious rooms this hotel doesn't have much to recommend itself for the price they charge. Tip: If you are looking for transportation from the Venice Train Station to the hotel, just take the public boats, its a quick 5 minute walk from Rialto bridge to the hotel and only costs 6 euros as opposed to the 90+ euros that they water taxi will charge. Tip: There are also public boats starting at 7 AM from the Rialto bridge to the airport which cost 15 euro, again significantly cheaper than 130 euro that a water taxi will charge. In addition, the water taxis don't guarantee that they will be able to pick you from the hotel since the canal is so narrow and it is not always safe for them to enter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soraya S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location was amazing, inbetween Rialto and San Marco Square. The entire hotel was renovated and the lounge area was lovely to relax in. We had the classic room, the room itself was a little small, but it was entirely renovated and the bathroom was fantastic. We did notice that they seemed to have a lot of guests from tour buses but didn't find it a problem in regards to checkin and checkout. In fact we met a couple of really great people at this hotel. If you are looking for a renovated room and a great location, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms but aloof staff”
Reviews.Author: BradandJanet
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Venice so I really researched hard about where to stay and used Trip Advisor and I think most of the comments are spot on - the hotel is in a fantastic location on a small canal, close to St Marks square and is modern and well appointed. But with this comes a lot of guests!! We had a Superior suite on a canal which I would recommend. The bathroom was nice and well appointed and the space was welcomed. Whilst I liked the window open my husband complained about mosquitos! I found the room very stuffy and couldn't seem to reduce the temparature. As it is a modern well located hotel it is a busy hotel with lots of tour groups and tourists so time your check out well as it can feel like an airport departure lounge at times which is why the guy on front desk is grumpy and aloof. Indeed we found all the staff a bit 'off hand' which was not at all like the rest of italy and we toured for three weeks. The bar lounge is very nice and comfortable with velvet lounges and nice quiet spaces as well. The full length windows are a wonderful way to watch the activity on the small canal. The Barman is also a bit grumpy as well and was quite rude to my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: wixpix
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in Venice helped by a good location for our hotel. We were upgraded to a suite which was great. Really good to be right on the canal and be able to watch boats go past the windows in the downstairs lounges. I would have liked a bit more choice at breakfast and I particuarly did not like the coffee although my husband thought it was fine. Some of the corridors on the way to our room seemed a bit shabby but our rooms and the downatairs communal areas were great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DawnRHermanns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was an excellent location! The hotel itself was very nice! The staff were very helpful. The restaurant was great for both breakfast (which was included) as well as dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYdodger31
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent centrally located hotel. It's in the middle of San Marco Square and Rialto bridge if you're into the tourist parts of Venice. It also is in a good location to try and find areas of Venice that aren't so touristy. The staff was always helpful with recommendations and directions. Pro's: location, very clean 4 start property, free breakfast & Wifi, nice lounge area and staff. Con's: Very expensive, we paid almost 500 pounds for Sunday night and I have no idea why. The drinks at the hotel are expensive too, but overall Venice is expesnive, so if you're looking for a budget holiday, don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money but...”
Reviews.Author: davidsds
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 2 nights. Upon arrival i told the reception staff I wanted a quiet room and didn't mind about the view so I was assigned room 264. Room was ok, clean and nicely furnished but the bed was hard and on one side the matress had taken the shape of the bodies , it was engraved, and so I had to sleep on the opposite side only. on the positive side the hotel has a free service where it's possible to choose from six different types of pillows. the breakfast was ok with a good choice of fresh home made cakes (crostate ) and i had dinner @ the restaurant le maschere inside the hotel where I found the quality of the food excellent, the service professional and the staff very friendly. Internet is available for free only in the lobby and for 30 minutes only. The speed is awful, I could go faster with my 14.400 bps modem I had back in 1994, moreover there's a limit to of 50 mb in download. Totally unacceptable, hotel must improve the quality of the connection and it must be free with no limit in the time. Overall a pleasant experience, I had to point out to a person of the staff about the bed so they can improve their score.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: TobyK123
Reviews.Content: The location and look of this hotel is great. The rooms are modern, including the bathroom. Breakfast was okay; more choices were available at our other Italian hotels. The staff was unfriendly and especially unhelpful. When I asked questions at the desk I was sent to someone else. If they were busy on the phone another staff member was never around, I had to wait. There are lots of tour groups here and perhaps that causes the problem. It is quite expensive and i was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Splendid...”
Reviews.Author: JWJ1981
Reviews.Content: We were incredibly pleased by Starhotel's beauty, service, breakfast, and location. While the hotel was very expensive, the rooms were larger than typical, boutique, recently updated, and beautifully maintained. The bathroom was particularly beautiful. The hotel is centrally located. Breakfast was nicely prepared in a beautiful room. The hotel offered various common rooms on the first floor (all with wifi). One warning... through no fault of the hotel's, when the water experiences high tide, taxi's cannot approach the dock. In our case, we had to have a porter take our bags to the central canal. Just be attentive and allow extra time when checking in / out.

Reviews.Title: “great location if you don't have luggage”
Reviews.Author: Kinsie
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was definitely great as it was right between Ponte Rialto and St Marks Square. However, if you were carrying luggage from the train station, for example, you definitely have work cut out for you. We took the #1 water bus from the train station and got lost for quite a bit before we found the hotel. Nothing to do with the hotel but roads are poorly marked so it was pretty hard to find. Even if we didn't get lost, there are quite a few bridges with stairs to go over so it was tough with luggage. Other than that, the hotel was great. The room was spacious and clean. Not that I watch that much tv but it could be a TAD bit bigger (I believe it was close to a 24 inch?). The washrooms were clean and the linens were fresh. The complementary breakfast was ok: scrambled eggs and "bacon", salami and cheese, fresh fruits, cereal, and granola. Service from the maid, bell boy, guest services, and bar was great. Very knowledgable and polite. However, the front desk staff was a little rude (when we were checking in and when we asked for another pillow). The pillows are AWFUL. They were flat as paper with no support so definitely ask for pillows if you like a supportive pillow like me. There is also free Wi-Fi in the lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: catzilla27
Reviews.Content: I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat. We stayed for a long weekend and took in a lot of the Venice sights, but I was just as happy to go back to the hotel and sit in the downstairs lounge. At night it was a lovely relaxed and romantic setting. The restaurant was reasonably priced and the food was very good! Breakfast was great. Everything you needed to set you up for a day. Coffee, tea, juices or if you were like us, hot chocolate! The food was good. Cakes and bread. Bacon and eggs. Fruits and yogurts. Croissants. Cold meats and cheese. There was a very good choice. The staff were very attentive. Our room was gorgeous. We paid for a standard room but we got upgraded to a suite. It was clean with a well stocked minibar. Slippers and robes in the wardrobe. Nice toiletries if you had forgotten any of yours. I slept really well in the large bed! The location really is perfect. You're right in the centre of all the sights. St Marks Square, Rialto Bridge. Also plenty of shops! Although they are full of the touristy things that you may or may not want to buy. Probably over priced too! We did what you're meant to do and got actually lost in Venice. Although it was dark and on our first night and I was a bit scared lol. If you do do the getting lost thing, do it in the day. That said a very nice local woman who spoke very little English, was really helpful in walking us a good portion of the way back in the right direction. All in all, if you get the chance to stay at this hotel I would bet that you wouldn't be disappointed. A very romantic setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mh290362
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times. On the last trip we had a suite. The room was laid out nice, but kind of dated. I would have asked for a different suite, but we were with others on the same floor so we kept it for convenience. We had 2 issues with the lady at the front desk...she was rude at check-in, though her attitude changed midway through. The other issue was that we were suppose to have a crib for our infant in the room, but instead we had 2 roller beds setup. When we called about this minor detail too have it addressed, we were rudely told by the lady that she would have to check our reservation. Not very long after she called and said it would be right up. All other service interactions were good which included maids, bell boy, restaurant staff & bartenders. The breakfast is more Americanized than other hotels we have stayed at in Italy. There are scrambled eggs, so-called bacon, fruit, cereal, etc. Location is great, between the Rialto & St Mark's square. Very easy walk to either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Osker17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a near perfect location if your on your first trip to Venice or have limited time, as it is almost equi-distant from the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. The hotel is very good, room are spacious and extremely comfortable, but it's the service that makes it exceptional. The staff are first rate throughout, and as an added bonus the restaurant is very good too, certainly better than the majority of restaurants we tried in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Location!”
Reviews.Author: htp1
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Venice this hotel was an excellent base from which to explore the city. Situated almost slap bang between the Ponte Rialto & Piazza San Marco we were within easy reach of Venice's main attractions or at least walking distance to the various vaporetto stops which allow you to get around easily. Location is absolutely perfect for the first time visitor and we basically walked everywhere occasionally resting with a glass of prosecco at the many bars and cafes. We decided to splash out and arrive at the hotel by water taxi. Arriving at the hotel's jetty via canal is definitely worth spending extra on and gets rid of the hassle of negotiating luggage through busy, narrow streets and over numerous bridges. The hotel itself is modern, clean and staff were very helpful especially to recommend restaurants or make bookings on your behalf. As it was our first wedding anniversary, I had contacted the hotel prior to arrival requesting a canal view. We did get one but it was at the side of the hotel overlooking a back street where many deliveries were made so if you're after a more pleasing, quieter canal outlook, request a room at the front of the hotel, the view is much better. The room itself wasn't overly spacious but was perfect for our requirements, modern, clean and well maintained although the bathroom shower required a little maintenance, the shower was a tad temperamental. Our stay included breakfast which was pretty basic with a few cereals, breads, cheese and cold meats. The cooked option consisted of bacon and scrambled egg so not really much choice although their cappucinos were great. If it hadn't been included, I certainly wouldn't have paid extra for it, particularly with the many cafes nearby offering much more appetising wares for less. We didn't have an evening meal at the hotel but it was certainly very busy most nights, perhaps a little on the expensive side though. On the night of our anniversary we dined at a very romantic restaurant next to the Teatro La Fenice hidden away in a courtyard that was a lot nicer and less pricey so don't feel you must eat in the hotel. We don't tend to stay in the same hotel more than once as we always like to try something different but I would thoroughly recommend this hotel particularly if it's your first visit to Venice as it really is the perfect starting point. Ooooh and there is an amazing gelato shop out of reception and to the right at the end of the street, staff very polite and helpful and they sell gorgeous ice cream!! Just talking about it makes me want to go back, ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Benvinda R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for our 1st wedding anniversary. I emailed the hotel for a room facing the canal, which they accommodated despite being almost full. It was on the 4th floor so you had to look out of the window to see the canal below, but you don't need to see the canal constantly from the room. The room was spacious and excellent standard, the AC after walking around in the very hot late Aug weather was great and just what we needed if wanted a break in the afternoon. It even had tea/coffee facilities in the room, which is rare in European hotels. The staff were really friendly, the only issue was that check in took a while when we arrived, as this was when lots were also checking out. We didn't face this problem on check out, so maybe it was a particularly busy day when we arrived. The hotel is in a great location, just off a busy street, yet its off to the side and we never heard any noise from our room. It is ideally located between St Marks Sq and Rialto bridge, so perfect as a base to walk around and explore the city. Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Venice was quite expensive but such a beautiful and unique city, definitely worth seeing and exploring!

Reviews.Title: “Splendide Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Manihi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendide during our visit to Venice this summer. The hotel is located on one of the smaller canal which is perfect. It is an excellent location, sort of in the middle of Venice. After getting out of the train station, take a water taxi to Rialto station. Buy a day pass which will allow you to use the water taxi for 24 hours. This will come in handy to do a night tour of Venice which is totally worth it. The hardest part was to find the hotel when we first got off the Rialto station. Venice is a maze of small streets and canals so instead of spending time dragging our suitcases along the streets, over the many steps and bridges, stressing for nothing, we hired a luggage porter (Marco) right outside of the Rialto station for about 10 euro and he took all our suitcases directly to the hotel front desk. All we had to do is follow and observe the scenery. As to the hotel, check in was smooth and professional. Although it was not a room overlooking the canal but for us, thats fine since we didn't spend too much time in the room. However, the room is well decorated, clean, the bed is amazingly comfortable, and the bathroom is clean and modern. They also have a great breakfast included in the room price which is a great way to start the day. After checking in, we went out to explore and we found the location of the hotel amazing. Its very close to San Marco Square, less than five minutes walking distance. We spent a lot of time at night in San Marco just to have a coffee, a gelato listening to the three different classical band playing nightly, They played music until midnight every night. Its super romantic to be in San Marco late at night when there are less people, so you can sit and talk with your love one under the moonlight. Venice is a very romantic and surprising city so don't be afraid to explore. We spent hours walking around, exploring the city, and with every turn into a seemingly lost alley, you'll find a church, an exclusive five stars hotel, a great restaurant or simply a small place to sit and absorb the feel of the city. It is sad to know that Venice is slowly sinking and one day will disappear. We loved our stay and the only regret is not staying longer. We will definitely be back and will love to stay at the Spendide again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: HurricaneKat23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as year on our trip through on our trip through Italy. It was the first hotel along the way and it was absolutely amazing. The rooms were huge in comparison to your typical European hotels. It was the most expensive stay of the trip but the views of the canal and the quality of the furniture/bathrooms made it worth it. We had complimentary breakfast with our stay. It was the perfect blend of what you would consider an â€œAmericanâ€� breakfast and a â€œEuropeanâ€� breakfast. We sat out on the atrium most mornings and the service was always attentive. We also received complimentary champagne upon arrival. It was a nice touch and was something given because of the package we purchased through Costco Travel. The hotel location is excellent for sightseeing and if you have the opportunity to splurge on a hotel I highly recommend Starhotels Splendid Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: AshleyLaurens
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite, it was clean and cozy. We had the ac on the whole time since it was so hot outside. The staff held our bags as checkout was five hours earlier then we needed to leave. The bar was cozy and HUGE! Very central location and easy to find. Would stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and recommend to others.”
Reviews.Author: Mars2611
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor, very comfortable rooms and fabulous location in between the Rialto and St. Marks Square. Buffet breakfast was superb and very well run. Would definately stay with Star Hotels again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: cfreeman21
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Restaurant, Excellent Staff, made my vacation in Venice memorable and will definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and couldn't have asked for more. The rooms are a very nice size, clean and very well decorated. The bathroom was large and also very clean. The hotel has a brilliant location, which made it really easy to get back and cool off or for an afternoon nap in the heat of the day. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel has an appointed member of staff near the bar to help with any questions you have. Although we didn't use this as the bed was more than comfortable, we also saw a sign by our bed offering six different types of pillows to help you sleep! Overall we loved Venice and our stay at this hotel played a very large part in this. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be staying in other Starhotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: annanhotel1
Reviews.Content: Stayed In august for special occasion great spot ideal for getting around water taxi straight to door, breakfast was good, and having tried several retaraunts in the city the Hotel food was probably the best we had and at a fair price considering everything here is so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful respite in a busy city!”
Reviews.Author: ciaobella1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid Hotel in Venice for two nights following a two week cruise. We booked two rooms and both were wonderful. The rooms were large, clean and tastefully decorated. Both rooms had beautiful marble bathrooms. The hotel is ideally located between St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge and is close to restaurants, shopping and the vaparetto. We thought the breakfast buffet, which offered a variety of breads, pastries, cereals, yogurt, cold ham and cheese and scrambled eggs was delicious. If we are lucky enough to visit Venice in the future, we will definitely stay at the Starhotels Splendid Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking and amazing hotel - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jet34
Reviews.Content: Arriving by boat is so unique. Reception was very slow. The hotel decor is beautiful and stylish. Very Chic! Our room was amazing with a view over the canal which was breathtaking. The room was of a high standard. No wi-fi, an extra to be paid for. I would definitely go back to Venice and stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a great location, noise is an issue”
Reviews.Author: francetraveller2007
