Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Starhotels Splendid in August 2011. The hotel is well located between Rialto and St. Mark's. A water taxi can be arranged in advance and took us from the airport directly to the hotel for a reasonable fare. The taxi holds up to 10 people and it is a fixed fare, so this works great for a group. The rooms are comfortable and modern and have a boutique feel. The hotel serves a reasonable breakfast buffet which is included in the room price. My only two issues are: that upon arrival by water taxi there is no sign indicating where the reception area is located. It is located across the laneway through an unmarked black door. Secondly (not the fault of the hotel) Venice is very loud because sound travels in the narrow corridors between buildings. As a result we were kept up most of the night by noise. I am not sure if the hotel has quieter rooms but if noise is an issue I would recommend that you ask before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: travelfun16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2011 for 1 night. Nice looking hotel in central area. Room was average size for Venice but looked clean and well appointed. Had been travelling around italy for 2 weeks including a few days in Venice 2 weeks before at another hotel. Woke up early in the morning to find myself covered in multiple small red itchy bites. Thought maybe they were mosquito bites from walking around town the night before, but thought it was a bit strange since I had not had a single bite anywhere in Italy during the 2 week stay before this night. Left the next morning and boarded Vaporetto at Rialto station. While standing beside my luggage, I saw a small red-brown bug crawling on my suitcase. I then realized that my bites were not mosquito bites so I searched the web on my cell phone and found a picture of a bedbug that exactly matched the bug on my suitcase. Ended up having to either heat wash or throw away every piece of clothing I had and buy a new suitcase. Ruined several days of the vacation. Have since seen another recent report complaining of bed bugs at Starhotels Splendid Venice on trip advisor -clearly the problem has not been rectified- i should have checked trip advisor earlier!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LudwigMartin
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Accomodations, Delicious Breakfast, Very good Location, not in the Grand Canal, but Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ctroianos
Reviews.Content: We couldn't be more pleased with this hotel. Centrally located near all the action in Venice, including a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square and to the Grand Canal. Breakfast every morning was included in our price and well worth it. Rooms are modern and chic. Staff is helpful and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again. Buy a 3 day pass for the water bus as soon as you arrive, and you can use the water bus to and from parking garage, and unlimited use in the city. Nice for doing your own sight seeing, and for travel to and from the garage, saving lots of transportation costs.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - Will go back soon ... Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: helen_pickford1
Reviews.Content: Arrived home after a 5 nights stay on Thursday 21st July. This hotel is in a great location, centrally placed between the Rialto Bridge and Saint Markâ€™s Square. We had a canal view, which was lovely as we could always hear the Gondola men singing alongside the Cathedral Bells. Hotel was exceptionally clean and of a very high standard. Fresh bedding every day and towels were changed twice daily as were the bins emptied. Not a dirty corner insight. There was a â€˜Pillowâ€™ menu and beds were very comfortable. Air conditioning was quiet and efficient too. We even had a T.V. in the bathroom. Lots of lovely little touches. Breakfast was Americano, only scrambled egg and bacon (hot food) on offer but there were lots of bread, croissants, cakes and pastries to choose from. There was muesli and corn flakes and fresh cheeses, cold meats and ham. Not my kind of holiday breakfast but hey what was on offer was of a high standard. You could order from the menu for breakfast but this was at an extra cost. I think a fried egg was 6 Euros! Staff were very helpful, friendly yet professional. Venice superb, so romantic but eating in restaurants proved to be very expensive. If you like a lot of good food then you will need to eat multiple courses, which proves to become costly. The cheapest bottle of red wine was 20 Euros in the restaurants, a bottle of beer 6 Euros. Shopping in and around Venice is fantastic especially as the sales are on at the moment. Places to visit â€“ Burano and Murano ... not to be missed! Will definitely go back and would highly recommend the Star Hotel, Splendid Venice for its location and cleanliness / high standards. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: cbusfamily101
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 kids stayed in connecting rooms and we absolutely loved it! The 'connecting rooms' were really more like our own suite in a private wing at the end of a hall. We could leave our room doors open and just close the main door leading out to the hallway. One room had a great view of a canal while the other room had a walk-out balcony. The hotel is beautifully decorated with top-notch finishes. Feels like a high-end city condo in the bedrooms, and the old charm of Venice in the public spaces. Beds are extremely comfortable. Private water taxi from the airport dropped us off right at the front door. We were told the free wi-fi would only work in the lobby, but we were able to connect from our rooms. I'm sure there are cheaper hotels in Venice, but this one is worth the splurge!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Splendid”
Reviews.Author: medat
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, modern. 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. Excellent buffet breakfast. Lots of shops and restaurants in the area. Staff is helpful. I think the hotel is easier to find from St. Mark's Square rather than the Rialto Bridge. The checkout process could be quicker and easier. (But who wants to check out?) Would I return? In a heartbeat. Venice: a great city. Transportation is expensive. Vaporetto passes are a waste of money because no one ever checks for tickets. Allow for lots of time when returning to the train station or airport. After dinner (around 10:30), go to St. Mark's Square and have a drink at one of the outdoor bars. Listen to the music and watch the people.

Reviews.Title: “It was almost perfect on every level ................”
Reviews.Author: IDSUFFOLK
Reviews.Content: With very special friends we booked last week to enjoy some tickets for the JAMES TAYLOR concert in St Marks Square - oh my ... where do we begin?? Let's just park the concert as wet yet so wonderfully sublime. As for the Splendid Venice - I just cant decide if staying here is cheating! Should we have been struggling with alleys, stairs and damp rooms? This hotel is a slice of heaven amongst the jostling lanes - the buildings are traditional - (reception sits in one like a glamorous indoor tunnel like the door way to a private club) The staff are VERY Italian - handsome/attractive, polished, polite, knowledgeable and attentive. The hotel is a deliciously affordable treat of an experience and smells of good flowers - warm, usable public spaces, with guests chilling late into the evening .. groovy music and ipads, feet tucked into sofas with guide books and maps ... relaxed guests planning their tomorrows and chatting with ease .. the barman made great drinks whilst we watched the world go by and the final gondolas pass the window. Beds - delish - firm with great linen Rooms - goodsize (Venice is generally piccolo!!) - and quiet, but for the early morning work boats that bring fresh supplies & your breakfast ... Breakfast - fresh and tasty buffet (rather busy, however well staffed) Late morning check out ......... with Reception - being the best Left luggage - no charge - no big deal ... so slip back and get it later - yeah!! We did have a teensy problem with one bedroom - just a small 'house keeping' issue Clearly over looked by the chamber made - once Management knew we were air lifted by wonderful room service staff to yet another gorgeous room ... painlessly ... how very very clever ....... So Return? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pearlyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid Starhotel last week, and wish we were back their. Although we found it hard to find, but I think that is usual in a city like Venice. We were stopped in one of the streets by a local who offered to show us where the hotel was. We were reluctant to let this chap show us for a euro, but after walking around for hours, felt we didn't have a choice. On entering the hotel, we had a quick check in and waiting for the porter to show us to our room (303), not with a view of the canal but the street, but we were happy with the room. Lovely comfortable bed and a spacious room. The bathroom was lovely and had a tv in the bathroom which I have never seen before. There was coffee making facilities in the room and a mini bar which we didn't use, as it was rather expensive. The breakfast was lovely and was seated very quickly. There was scramble eggs and bacon. Cereals, fruit juice, fresh fruit salad, baked apples, prunes, pastries, cakes, cheese and hams, so lots of choice. This hotel is a 4 star hotels and very worthy of it. In a very convenient location not far from St Marks Square, so convenient, to get around Venice. Got the bus from the Airport 5 EUROs for a single ticket. Then got the vaporetto boat to St marks Square which was 6.90. Very easy to get around Venice, either by boat or on foot. The sights are fantastic and reasonably priced, although the queues ccan be rather long in the burning sun. We loved our four days in Venice for our Silver Wedding and will always remember the Gondola ride on our last morning. 100 Euros, but managed to share the fare with another couple.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: Disgusted1
Reviews.Content: We visited the Splendid for five days beginning 7th July. The hotel is situated absolutely perfectly just behind St Mark's Square allowing easy access to all the sights. Our room was lovely and provided an air conditioned retreat when the heat became too much to bear! We found it quite easy and cheap to eat out at lunchtime whilst sightseeing and in the evening we ate in the hotel restaurant before walking the five minutes back onto the waterfront to watch the gondolas bobbing on the water and listen to the music until midnight it was heaven! As we had never been out of the UK before we were quite nervous and the one thing that will make us return to the Splendid was the staff. The restaurant staff were so nice, they put up with my fledgling itialian and were so pleasant and helpful that they made our holiday. On the odd occasion when I panicked about having to confirm a booking all I had to do was ask Claudia on the desk and she fixed it with a smile and when I mentioned that it was my husband's birthday she passed the information on and it was celebrated with a box of jellies which were left in our room and in the restaurant in the evening. This hotel really is Splendid!

Reviews.Title: “Not the canal view”
Reviews.Author: Meinhandy
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but nice. My wife and I were disappointed after paying extra for a canal view. If we leaned out of our first floor window, we could see the service canal below. The noise from unloading and loading woke us early each morning and the view was non-existent. I understand we were never going to see the Grand Canal from our room but we would have been better off just about anywhere else in the hotel. No milk supplied in our room for tea or coffeee and it cost 6 Euros to get a get a small bucket of ice sent up. Breakfast was pretty average. My wife is allergic to eggs so it was cold meat, cheese and fruit for her. She didn't bother going down to the meal we'd paid for one morning. The juice was room temperature juice and there was no toaster! Non Europeans westerners love toast. They especially like it for breakfast. It can't be that difficult or costly to put a toaster in the breakfast area. Half an hour free wifi access in the lobby doesn't cut it. Most other hotels we stayed at had unlimited access. On the positive side, the staff were generally friendly and helpful and the lobby lounge areas were comfortable and looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Suzi90
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through Airmiles as it looked to be in a good location - we arrived in Venice on a Cruise ship and arrived around 11am at the hotel and to our surprise our room ( a double superior) was ready which was great - it had no view but was a modern, clean room with a comfortable bed and had a safe - as other reviewers have said it is no more than 5 minutes walk to either the Rialto Bridge or St Marks Square and is very near the shops- it was perfect for us - we only had breakfast at the hotel which is a buffet and there is plenty of choice - coffee or tea were served by friendly staff direct to the table- we also had a drink at the bar and is was no more expensive than any other bar we visited in Venice - whilst in Venice we used the water buses to go all over the place and we got a 36 hour ticket for 52 euros (for 2) - much cheaper than using the water taxis - we also had a ride in a gondala which cost 100 euros for 30 minutes which is expensive but something we just had to do ! We also used the 30 minutes free wifi in the hotel lobby which is on offer until September. We had a wonderful stay in Venice and would stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kengkla
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights during our vacation in Italy The location is great, in the middle between rialto bridge and san macro square. The room is a quite small, but comfortable and modern. Breakfast is also nice. Although the rate is quite expensive compare to other cities in Italy, but this is Venice where we feel that we are happy with the quality we get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: laimin728
Reviews.Content: Loved the room and the shower. The room was bright, clean and tidy. The bed was very comfy. It's within walking distance to major tourist attraction. Staff were friendly and helpful. 30 min Free Wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice..totally recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia042
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on june 10, 2011. It was our first stop in Europe, and I have to say that we were very pleased with everything in this hotel. The staff was very friendly and since we traveled with two children, we stayed in a very nice well decorated suite, the bathroom was not only very modern , marble style, but very spacious. Hotel is very well located, 4 to 5 minutes waltk to St Mark Square, and very close to Rialto Bridge. Hotel is located in a canal and the lobby is beautiful! Although is a little pricey, it's worth every penny you pay. I totally recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “All that Venice has to offer at your doorstep!!!”
Reviews.Author: SandiandGlenn
Reviews.Content: This really is a wonderful place to stay if you want a modern room with exceptional facilities, the room was spacious with a pillow menu to choose from. Totally renovated, clean marble bathrooms and the jetty to allow the water taxis and gondolas to drop you off at the doorstep. Staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast which was included was full of wonderful fresh fruit, pastries and of course bacon and eggs. Its a little pricey and we were there over a public holiday so it was even more expensive. However I can say that you have to stay on the island at least once in a lifetime. Shops are literally on the door step and there is so many wonderful experiences to have on the island and this is the place to stay if you want modern luxury

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthiez
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I got bitten by bug-bites from their beds and when I reported it to management I was given an apology but was not compensated for the room as a result of the bugs being in their mattress. Poor customer service and not worth the $300 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthk7777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a central location between Rialto bridge and San Marco Square. Very nice rooms and ammenities. Lobby is beautiful and hotel sits on a canal. Would go back him again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will definitely recommend to everyone .....”
Reviews.Author: Faisal333
Reviews.Content: When we checked in , to our pleasant surprise , we got upgraded to the Suite and the room is nice and big and very well appointed. I am still staying in the Hotel and thought of writing this review so that more people come to this lovely preperty ------------ this hotel has the best service in Venice - I did visit other Hotels like Bauer , Gritti and Danieli for dinner but other than the location/view, The staff and service at Splendid Venice is far more hospitable and very very friendly. Take a water taxi straight to the hotel - should cost Euo 60. 3 minutes walk to St Marks Square. This has been a great start to our vacation in Europe ........... will whole heartedly recommend to all ................ 5 STARS ALL THE WAY ............ Keep it up. All the best.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: SenoritaL
Reviews.Content: **Location** Very central - 7 minutes walk to Rialto Bridge and 5 minutes walk to San Marco Square. The hotel has its own water taxi dock, hence it's very convenient if you arrive or depart by taxi. As the hotel is located in the centre of action, there is no shortage of shops surrounding the hotel. **Room** The rooms are decorated in contemporary style and comfortable, albeit small (which is pretty much the same for all Venetian hotels). The rooms have been renovated with updated fixtures, such as flat screen TV, tea/coffee maker, safe, and even a small LCD TV in the bathroom (although we could never get it to work!). The window looks out to a small canal where you can see the gliding gondolas. While the window is not doble glaze, once it's closed it actually blocks out the street noise. The marble bathroom has all the amenities including a hair dryer. **Service** The staff in general displayed an indifferent attitude toward guests. They were not particularly warm but were not rude either. When asked directions, they immediately provided a map and clearly explained the best routes to get to our destination. We had some trouble with the private airport transfer service, and the front desk staff was kind enough to make a phone call for us to confirm our booking, but did not offer any further assistance when our taxi failed to arrive on time. As we left very early in the morning and had to miss the buffet breakfast (which was included in our room rate), the hotel prepared two breakfast packs for us. There was little to fancy inside the pack, however, with only two cold bread rolls, one scone, some small jars of jam, one apple, and one bottle of juice. **Hotel as a whole** The hotel's public area, including a small library, restaurant with glass roof, bar, and TV lounge, exudes a cosy atmosphere. It was decorated with velvet drapes, plush cushions, and soft lighting. Actually, the public area is so beautiful that it is a more comfortable and atmospheric place to linger than the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Brilliant position!”
Reviews.Author: KandSSurrey
Reviews.Content: We went for my birthday. The position of the hotel would be hard to beat. Close to St Mark's square and the Grand Canal. This is a smart hotel, good decor. Yes, it can be a little dark in the bedrooms but that's down to the nature of the way Venice is built/ the layout! You are going there to see narrow, quaint little lanes and burrows with all the waterways throughout, so it only takes a pinch of common sense to realise that it may shut out some light coming into bedroom windows - Come on guys! - Be reasonable. The gondolas cost approx' Â£70-80 for a 20 min trip and no, most do not sing to you! The food in Venice is fairly expensive as they know they have a captive audience...However, we ate in the hotel twice and out down the back lanes rather than in St Mark's sq. As a rough guide we paid approx Â£30 a head without drink. We walked 6 hours a day for 4 days. I would say 3 days is enough to see the place. It's amazing and well worth going but small and probably best as a stop over to somewhere else for another 4 days or so. I was also told it could be smelly, in April it was hot while we were there. 80 degrees. Very occasionally we got a small pocket of drain smell momentarily but on the whole it was not a smelly place at that time. It was not any issue at all. We would happily stay in this hotel again. The only 2 small gripes are that the staff never smile and not very friendly and also the reception of the hotel is really hard to locate as it's is a building next door!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ruby616275
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, good for all the main sites, St Marks Square, Realto, just a short distance away. We found the hotel very clean and well presented, well worth the four stars, however we were let down badly when we decided to try the resturant for our evening meal. After taking our order and receiving our first course we were kept waiting 3/4 of an hour before any further service. When challanging the resturant manager about what was going on and when we were to receive our main course we were told that they were rather busy with a large party and that our order had not been taken to the kitchen. We decided this was not good enough and left. (Without Paying). The occasion was to cellabrate our 42nd wedding aniversary - we will not try them again !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amiamit
Reviews.Content: My parents were in Venice 2010 and while they enjoyed the city the complained about the match box sized rooms. I arrived at Venice expecting the same ... and was very pleasantly surprised. The Starhotels Splendid Venice (we stayed in rooms one above from base category - free upgrade) rooms were very nicely appointed. The bathroom was large. My room even had a little balcony (great for a smoker - but not all rooms have balconies). The location is terrific. In between the St Mark sq and the Rialto. Breakfast here was a preprepared bfast (no hot eggs, etc) but was very tasty and more than adequate. The hot chocolate was very good! Getting here from the station we took the water bus, got off at Rialto and were lucky to find a porter service (Fabio porter service)! I did not expect that at all :-) We had 13 bags - quite large and Fabio easily handles about 9 of them to the hotel. I also thought his rate was a fair one - Euro 30/-. On our return we took a water taxi from the hotel direct to the station. E 110/-. Location is great - lots of bars, restaurants, walking distance from the square as well as the Rialto. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ScottAHenry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here without our children for a couples weekend. Loads to do and see nearby and very clean and nice hotel. Breakfast was ok, but the coffee not so good. Go to a cafe near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Venice from.”
Reviews.Author: DES113
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for our 2nd wedding anniversary and it was a great find. It's really well located between San Marco and Rialto Bridge, two popular areas, and we enjoyed exploring Venice from this base. We got a water taxi from the airport (recommended) although he didn't drop us at the hotel door (I think he could have), he did walk us from the drop off point to the hotel. Nice clean hotel, very friendly front desk staff to help with booking nice restaurants and all round good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: PBrown99
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at very short notice based on the mostly good reviews on the site. Overall, we were really pleased with the hotel. It was expensive, but the location was great; just a few minutes walk to both the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco. Even though you could be in the thrum of the main tourist areas, you could within moments turn off the main drag and be in quiet back streets with amazing restaurants. We were upgraded to a deluxe canal view room; I think my advice would be to get the superior or deluxe rooms but don't bother paying extra for the canal views; you are really not missing anything and you'll have plenty of time to see much more lovely canals as you walk the streets. The rooms are not large, but more than big enough. Bathrooms also small but well appointed and clean. Breakfast was so-so; standard Continental fare, but not of a particularly high standard. Coffee plush; bread nice; meat and cheese ok-ish. Still, a free meal to start the day is a good way to start! Staff were generally nice and friendly. Bar area was well stocked and we enjoyed coming home after a delicious meal for a nice nightcap. Be warned though that the bar is not cheap; most drinks/wine were â‚¬10 a go... There was no free wifi in the room, and it cost â‚¬5.50 for 24 hours. Seemed to work ok but connection speed wasn't brilliant. I must say that we both thought that the bed was amazingly comfortable! So overall, a lovely hotel, but not cheap. If you want somewhere central and are willing to pay a bit more then I would recommend this hotel. If you are on a budget then perhaps not; you'll be paying through the nose for everything else so get a cheaper hotel and save your money for good food and wine! On a final note I would certainly urge you to book a private water taxi to and from the airport. It really is an amazing way to arrive, even at â‚¬110 each way. Getting to the hotel from the public vaperetto (water bus) was complicated if you didn't know the way, and the thought of lugging suitcases down those streets through the throng of tourists in the heat of the day didn't sound a nice way to start our holiday. The hotel has it's own dock, so you pull up right outside the hotel; perfect! We rang the hotel and they booked the taxi for us so that when we arrived at the airport, they were expecting us. So thank you Spendid Venice for a great first trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: Gourmetgirl71
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved everything about this hotel, the location was perfect, the bedrooms and public areas all stunning, the breakfast was great and the view from our window was amazing as we had a canalside room. It was excellent value, five star quality without the five star price tag. The guest relations desk were really helpful and efficient, I had sent various emails requesting them to book our water taxi and restaurants and all the arrangements were perfectly in place when we arrived. Our only negative was that the service in the bar was quite slow and they did not stock Creme de Menthe!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, lacks personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: andyfox42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. The room was spacious and the location was great. Breakfast was lovely too, although we were getting a bit tired of it by day 4 when we were moving on to our next destination. The only thing that was lacking was personal service. We couldn't check in until 5pm, when it should be 2pm. We had a couple of problems with the room - the bath leaked, a bulb flickered in the bathroom and the lock didn't work on the room door. We reported it to the hotel but it was never resolved. They aren't massive problems, but when you're paying Â£200+ per night for a room I thought the customer service should have been better. Having said that, we loved our room - it was clean, comfy and spacious - and we thought Venice was fabulous. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SDowkes
Reviews.Content: Really loved our stay in the Splendid hotel in Venice. Room was not large, but the standard was good, which is more important to us than the size itself. We did not have canal view, and we were given a room with a view over the restaurant - which worked out very well. The location of the hotel is great, right in the middle of everything. We also got a taxi boat from the airport- very comfortabel and easy, though it costs. Still worth it we thought! Great views of the grand canal on arrival, and charming ride into the canals where the hotel was situated. Decent breakfast too. Would definetly stay here again. Beware of all the masses of people in Venice though, and do go outside the tourist trail!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the very center of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Anja_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot. Just recently renovated, it looked very fresh, clean and stylish. I found the bed (and especially the pillows!!!) extremely comfortable. The hotel is just 5 min walk from San Marco square and even less than that from Rialto bridge. Lots of shops and nice restaurants in the area as well. The staff was very helpful. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and can definitely recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent-Excelente-Everything!”
Reviews.Author: rodsant039
Reviews.Content: Excellent location-easy to walk south to St. Marco and/or north to Rialto-since it is in the middle of everything; clean, nice room and bathroom; great breakfast; great staff; highly recommended; only very small item/suggestion is to have hair conditioner on bathrooms; also this hotel should advertise fact it has 110v (USA voltage)-I originally purchase electricity converter and found out I donâ€™t need it (to charge camera batteries, cellular phones). Una localizaciÃ³n insuperable; fÃ¡cil de llegar caminando a Rialto y a San Marcos; cuarto bonito, limpio y agradable; el desayuno es buenÃ­simo-tiene huevos, bacon, frutas, cereales, panecillos, mermeladas, jugos, cafe, etc. Muy recomendable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: jimandbiz
Reviews.Content: Went for this hotel because it was recommended. Was not disappointed. Only downside was the Internet connection but apart from that lived up to its reviews. Excellent location and beautifully decorated next to a quiet canal. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “good location but very expensive for these rooms..”
Reviews.Author: misayin
Reviews.Content: my advice that not booked room with canal view..we paid extra for view but never see the canal or any nice view on the fourth floor..

Reviews.Title: “Unbearable heat and humidity in rooms in April”
Reviews.Author: waybee
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay in this hotel and, unlike the previous ones, it was terrible. In early spring, A/C is not switched on for technical reasons. (Apparently, they switch from heating to A/C at a specific moment in the year.). Temperature in the rooms rises to 25 / 30 Â°C [80Â°F] which becomes unbearable with the humidity of the canals. I had to sleep with open windows, so as not to suffocate. As a result, I was badly bitten by ferocious mosquitoes and had to endure the loud noise of the TV in the appartement accross the very narrow street. A discount on my room rate after I complained (as did many others) helped me come down, but did not help me sleep at night. The buffet breakfast is well below average for a **** hotel : low quality juice, cheese, ham and salami. Coffee is good. This is Italy ! Staff friendliness is Okay for Italy, but well below international standards. They are good at foreign languages though. My recommendation : do call them in advance to make sure that A/C is working when you plan to stay. Otherwise, avoid the place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: slk431
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here. Took public water bus to San Marco and walked to hotel. The staff gave easy to follow, detailed, directions, so we didn't get lost. The room was lovely, very elegant and soothing design, with nice bed linens and a feather pillow. The marble bathroom was gorgeous, with very good lighting. There was decent storage. I find in general that European hotels just don't offer the clothing storage areas you find in American lodging. The staff were very helpful; we arrived early, before 11, and they let us check in to our room since it was ready. They were also helpful in getting crushed ice for my daughter's twisted ankle. One annoyance, and seems to be typical for a lot of European hotels--there is free wifi only in the lobby, and you have to keep logging in with a really complicated password. The breakfast buffet was perfectly adequate and delicious. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Stay at Splendid Venice”
Reviews.Author: briebw
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its excellent reviews on trip advisor and we were extremely pleased with our choice. We stayed for 3 nights. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. We arrived a bit before check in and our room was not ready, so the hotel stored our luggage and recommended a very nice restaurant for lunch close by. The rooms are a bit small, but that is to be expected all throughout Italy. However the room was very nicely decorated and furnished. The bathroom was completed in marble with a combined tub and shower, very nice and spacious vanity, and a television to pass the time while reading the newspaper (lol). The view we just faced another hotel, with a main street below. It was not noisy at night and we were able to get a good night sleep. However in the wee hours of the morning we did hear the hustle and bustle of shops opening for business. The breakfast was fantastic. They served fresh eggs and bacon, variety of ripe fruits, freshly squeezed juices, assortment of cheese, sliced deli meats, and pastries. You were given your choice of coffee, cappuccino, or tea as well. The tables were very nicely covered with tablecloths and fine linen at every meal. The service was impeccable and consistent throughout our stay. We took a private water taxi from the airport directly to the hotel, somewhat expensive (110 Euro), but made our traveling very convenient. The concierge was able to recommend and book tours. We chose the Grand Canal Tour which was very nice and I would recommend for anyone new to Venice. The Internet was not very accessible, we tried several times to connect from our room and the lobby and were unsuccessful. However the hotel does provide a computer with internet access and printer for its guests to use for a low price. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it for anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect apart from one small thing!”
Reviews.Author: Richash85
Reviews.Content: Have literally just got back from 3 nights at Starhotel Splendid Venice. We had a fantastic time here and the hotel was great. Can't beat the location and the staff were generally very helpful. Everything was easy to find from the hotel making it a good base. Breakfast was good as was the bar! The only downside was the air conditioning unit was not working. When I asked at reception I was told they do not turn them on at this time of the year. The room was very stuffy and even with the windows open most nights sleep were disrupted by the heat. What made this worse was the amount of Mosquitos that came in every night...I must have 30 bites over me!! I would definitely recommend this hotel but please sort out the air conditioning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AEHLondon
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel on advice from previous Trip Advisor travellers and were very pleased with it. It is hard to locate, so many thanks to the thoughtful person on trip advisor for really good directions. The staff were friendly and helpful and we especially liked the informal atmosphere in the lounge areas - great for sitting and relaxing after a whole day sightseeing. Buffet breakfast comprised a good selection of cereals, crossiants and ham and eggs all included in the price. Our only slight criticism was we had a very small room - the bathroom was almost as big as our bedroom - but speaking to a few other couples it seemed we were just unlucky. The whole hotel though was spotlessly clean. This was a first time trip to Venice for me and I thought it was a truly magical palace, full of character and charm - Enjoy your visit !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, excelent rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BuenosAiresCarolina1
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our daughters and booked 2 rooms. They are not big but really nice furnished and had really good bathrooms. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The only thing I would suggest is offering free internet. it was quite expensive. Carolina from Buenos Aires.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob B
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel from previous reviews - Not dissappointed. Don't mess about finding your own way and splash out for a private water taxi from the airport - email the hotel and they will arrange for you - it's a great trip in and they take you to the private dock at the hotel, you could be sight seeing in an hour or like us sitting in St marks square sipping a very expensive beer enjoying the people watching. The Hotel is halfway between the square and the Rialto bridge possibly the best located Hotel in Venice. We stayed in a deluxe balcony room which was great plenty of room, quiet and well equipped after plenty of walking arounfd Venice. The Hotel restaurant and bar are good if you fed up of guessing the standard of tourist restaurants and not too expensive. One thing Venice IS EXPENSIVE get a mortgage before you arrive!!! Staff at the Hotel couldn't do enough for us and were happy to offer advice when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: harrisment
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because have stayed in Star Hotels in Milan and Rome and were very pleased with them. Took advice from previous reviewer and got directions from the hotel. Arrived by alilaguna to San Marco the hotel is just across the square underneath the archway under the clock tower to the left of the american bar. This is Mercerie although I didn't see it signposted anywhere. If you follow the street for 150 metres you will see the ferrari store in front of you the hotel is up the alley to the right of the store. The hotel is made up of two buildings with the reception on the right hand side.We were given a canal side room which was light and airy and very clean with a lovely bathroom. The hotel is in a great location and the buffet breakfast was very good. If I were being super critical there were a couple of things that could be improved, we returned one afternoon for coffee in the lovely lounge but had to hunt around for a member of staff to serve us. We intended to eat in the restaurant on our last night but when we went downstairs the restaurant and bar area were both deserted with no details on opening hours and no one available to ask. However these were only minor niggles and I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location once you find it- nice inside”
Reviews.Author: Sadiren
Reviews.Content: On our honeymoon my husband and I stayed here for two nights. Finding the hotel was tricky, I suggest knowing exactly how to get there before arriving to venice. Once you find it, you realize what a good location it is. The building itself is much like the others but inside it was nicely updated. The room they brought us to had a bad smell and over the night while sleeping the smell got worse due to the vents in the room bringing in smoke from the other rooms. By morning, it was horrible and we had the hotel give us a new room that truely was non-smoking. They updated us into a better room which we were happy about and the rest of our time there was easy going. FYI the places to eat around venice for dinner were nothing great, in fact, bad. We wished we did more research on places to eat rather than asking the hotel to suggest a place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Niazis
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Venice staying at the Star Hotels Splendid Venice and the name describes it perfectly! The hotel is in a fantastic location close to everything and you can arrive in style by water taxi or gondola if you wish. We were checked in immediately despite being earlier than the specified check in time and shown straight to our room which was spacious, clean and more than comfortable. The hotel itself has a lovely modern venetian style and is elegantly furnished. In the evening the restaurant looks beautiful with all tables lit by candle light and the pianist plays each evening which creates a lovely atmosphere. It was lovely to sit in the lounge areas and enjoy a prosecco or two! This is the second year we have been to Venice and we will no doubt return again and when we do it will be to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: NadineDJM
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying at Splendid and our stay was just as great as our first stay. We arrived in the evening and our three superior rooms were upgraded to three rooms with views of the canal that runs along the front of the hotel. The rooms were large and comfortable with everything we needed for our stay. The hotel is in a great location between Ponte di Rialto (closest) and Piazza San Marco with nice shops along the way. It's convenient to all the things you would want to see. Both times we were in Venice were during the winter which in my opinion is a great time to visit (fewer tourist). The rooms are warm at night so we had to open our windows to let in some cool air. This allows you to hear at the sounds of the city (church bells) and the canal traffic. But we got used to the sounds and slept well. Our only regret is that we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: LoveHolibags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Starhotels Splendid Venice from 10th - 15th February 2011, the hotel is in a great location right in the centre of San Marco, and all the attractions of Venice are right on it's doorstep. Our check-in was painless, the staff were courteous and attentive, our room was lovely and clean - and although we did not have a canal view this was not a problem. The decor in both the public areas and the rooms is lovely - all quality furnishings and clean crisp towels and sheets. Our bathroom was lovely too. Breakfast was included in the price - which was great value - a lovely buffet with lots of juices, pastries, breads and some hot options. The bar area is great for relaxing with comfortable sofas and a good variety of drinks on offer. If you want to get off the tourist trail, its a 10 minute walk either way - and you can find yourself ambling through the quiet alleys, streets and squares of Venice - take a good pair of comfortable shoes as there is loads to see, and some great little cafes and patisserie shops away from the usual tourist haunts around San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back in a Heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkercynic
Reviews.Content: A wonderful location on a quiet canal steps from botth Piazza San Marco and the Ponte Vecchio. Although housed in four historic palazzios, inside all is sleek and of contemporary design. A good breakfast buffetand very helpful staff. Rooms are smallish and could benefit from better lighting, but the bathrooms are luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT-WOULD STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: cleanconscioustravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, between rialto bridge & st marks square. We found it really hard to find so we should have gotten directions from the hotel first (not easy to wander the streets looking for it when 20kg of luggage!). close to the ferry stop so we could get back to the train station withing about 10 minutes. Room was really clean, only thing we noticed that the hotel had a strange kind of vinegar smell. but definetely not dirty. Modern furnishings, tastefully decorated, comfortable beds, great views. Breakast was good too. No public computer to use :( and you have to pay for wi-fi. overall would definetely recommend this hotel,,,just make sure you bring directions of how to walk there from the ferry stop (the hotel has its own private water taxi dock but for us to get to the train station would have been really expensive...cheaper just to walk and get the public ferry service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Tastefully Decorated Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: cinreds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are seasoned travelers. We were looking for a hotel that offered an upscale feel along with a great location. We are extremely satisfied with our choice. I use Tripadvisor for every hotel that we book. We felt this hotel was a good value for the amenities and location. I especially loved the breakfast that was served each morning. There is no better way of starting your day as to looking out the windows and watching the gondolas go by. We are used to traveling in Europe and having smaller rooms. European rooms are not as large as your typical American room. I felt that these rooms were very tastefully decorated and they offered the comfort that we were looking for. As for lumpy beds, I truly did not get that from the room that I had stayed in. I actually found the beds very nice after walking around all day in Venice. Staff was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS ROMANTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dschornack
Reviews.Content: Seriously... forget any other negative reviews... This chain of hotels is incredible! Hot breakfast (which is hard to find), Friendly staff, always a fantastic location for travelers, and BEAUTIFUL rooms! This was the most romantic trip we have ever taken! We have traveled all over Europe, but my husband and I enjoy Venice the most. I couldn't have even imagined staying at another hotel! This was our 4th time to Venice, and we have only stayed here. I have heard HORROR stories from other travelers that have stayed elsewhere. Don't think... just book! Starhotels is AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kennegogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband as a long weekend away without the kids. We got a water taxi to the hotel from the airport which is a fantastic way to arrive in Venice. The hotel has its own taxi stand so it is perfect! Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, we were given a map with directions to the various sights. The room was very nice, maybe on the smaller side but I didn't expect much bigger anyway. We didn't have much of a view, one window looked over the central courtyard restaurant and the other window looked over an alley but that was fine for me as we were out exploring most of the time. Breakfast was very nice, the usual continental breads and pastries, cereals, and cooked breakfast items which were lovely. The location of this hotel was perfect, right in the middle of St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. I would stay again if I went back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller007Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend , and what a great hotel! After being dropped off near the Rialto initially finding the hotel wasn't exactly easy but once we got our bearings the hotel turned out to in a great location beteen the Rialto and St Marks Square. Rooms were great , a good size and well furnished. The restaurant served excellent breakfasts and the lounge / bar area very comfortable and tasteful with large windows onto the canal where you can watch the gondolas passing while you enjoy a drink.Staff couldn't be more helpful! Definitely go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and very well located, but the room are TOO small!”
Reviews.Author: Fernanda10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, absolutly very well located and charming. The only problem is that the room was very very small, I had to open my bag in the toilet vase to have espace! But is a good place to stay if you are traveling with few bags. This is a perfect hotel for lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not so clean and pretty expensive”
Reviews.Author: PetraZagreb_Croatia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to it's location mostly, but also wanted classier hotel. Location is truly amazing, but for that kind of money I honestly expected more. Rooms are OK, but corridors smell funny. Also, rooms weren't cleaned properly. I found numerous black long hairs throughout both bedroom and bathroom. Since we were on a busy schedule, I did not complain the first day, waiting to see what will happen next day. And again, cleaning was very poor. Also, my side of bed had a huge concavity which made sleeping not so pleasant experience. Staff was otherwise friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November '10 with my husband. We decided to book a deluxe room as the hotel website stated they had a canal view. When we arrived we were shown to a room at the back of the hotel and had been given a small suite but no canal view. The room was so nice we decided to stay put. The furnishings were beautiful, lots of Venetian glass mirrors, silver fittings and muted colours. Bed and pillows were really comfortable (I'm very fussy about bed comfort!) and although the bedroom itself was not large, having the sitting area more than compensated. We had three flat screen TV's, in the bedroom, sitting area and a small one in the bathroom, not that we watched much TV as there is so much to do and out of the 4 days we stayed, the weather was fabulous for November on three of them. Toiletries were really nice, an Italian Brand, Etro, and plenty of them. The bathroom was compact but had quite luxurious fittings and large, fluffy towels. We ate evening meals in the hotel restaurant twice and the standard of food was good. The breakfasts were pretty ok, given it was the usual buffet type breakfast, but there was plenty of variety and the bakery goods were nice. The evening service in the restaurant was good on our first visit but on our second visit they got our order wrong and at first, their attitude was so what? Ater having a strop, the service improved and we got several apologies. They have an excellent pianist in the evenings who obviously loves his job and is very versatile. We sat down for quite a while after dinner just enjoying his playing. This really contributed to the ambience and we enjoyed both visits. I definitely recommend having at least one meal here but it is best to make a reservation as the weekends seem to be busy. The hotel is is a great position, just few minutes from San Marco and Rialto but the address on their website doesn't exist - it just refers to the general area. Other people have mentioned this on TA, it is situated on Manzana St Zulian which is about a 10 to 15 minute walk from Piazzale Roma and about 5 minutes from San Marco. Venice is very expensive but I think the hotel was pretty good value for money overall although I'd advise anyone to beware of the mini-bar! I expect to pay well over the odds but a (very) small pack of peanuts was 7 euros which seemed steep! Shopping in Venice is not a cheap experience, but having said that, Furla, the Italian leather goods company have a couple of shops in the Mercerie and their handbags seemed much cheaper than in the UK! We loved Venice and would definitely go again. My advice is to wear very comfortable shoes as you will do a lot of walking, buy a multi day ticket for the boats, and ensure you take at least one trip up the Grand Canal and visit some of the nearby islands which are well worth a trip. Just wandering around was a great pleasure. November is one of the months when flooding is a real risk and there was some flooding in the San Marco area on a couple of days. A flood warning siren sounds across Venice very early in the morning to alert everyone. The Venetians are well used to coping and raised walkways (tables) appear as it by magic and everyone gets around by using these. Seeing the Piazza flooded is a strange experience but all the water recedes by early afternoon and things return to normal. We had fun watching some of the boats trying to navigate under bridges on some of the smaller canals - some made it, one didn't! The flooding didn't cause us any inconvenience at all and it is certainly something to see! We'll definitely be going back again and will probably choose to stay here as the Hilton is situated on Giudecca which is across the Lagoon. It is a lovely hotel but does entail getting on a boat every time you want to go back and forth, whereas Starhotel Spendid, although a 4*, is really central. All in all, a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, a little impersonal, serves its purpose well”
Reviews.Author: SlepStar
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay here despite the cold, rainy weather typical of Venice in November. We were upgraded to a deluxe room and our room was still teeny, so I'm glad we never experienced the size of a standard room. Location is excellent - it's situated between Rialto and St Mark's Square. It's quite a large hotel and thus the service was a bit impersonal but we only spent the weekend in Venice and thus hardly spent time at the hotel so it hardly mattered. Have no problem staying here again but would probably opt for something a bit smaller - we only booked this because it was very last minute and it was one of the few places still available. In typical Italian style, double beds are two single beds pushed together. Not a fan of this but we have learned to expect this by now. Additionally, highly recommend splurging on a water taxi if it's within budget. We did this on the way in and took the water bus on the way back and regret not spending the extra 75 euros to take the taxi back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: JY521
Reviews.Content: The room is luxurious with its charming design, comfortable bed and very beautiful lamps in the room. The toilet /bathroom was clean and spacious. Our room window has a canal view with great scenery of Venice. The hotel itself is within walking distance from St Marco Square. The breakfast is great as well with lots of fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Love-the-sun-1991
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi (which i'd recommend doing because I doubt you'd be able to find the hotel if you don't already know Venice!) it was 70 euros from Pizzale Roma (the bus stop). Check in was quick and easy and a friendly porter took our bags to our room. The room was beautifully decorated, the bed was comfy and there was even a TV in the bathroom! Service was very good... I asked for crisps while I was waiting at the hotel for our flight and was given free crisps and peanuts. Breakfast had everything you need, juices, pastries, cereal, fruit etc The hotel is five minutes from St Marks square and five minutes from the Rialto Bridge. The review before mine commented on how they payed 200 euros for a room per night. We found our holiday online and payed 300 euros for two of us, for two nights and with flights included! Couldn't be more of a bargain! So search around and dont just book through the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- But Somewhat Pricey”
Reviews.Author: SEETHEBEST
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice last weekend, and stayed at the Starhotels Splendid Venice. It is in a great location, in a central shopping area, close to the Rialto Bridge and the vaporetto stop, making it easy to reach by public transportation from the airport without a lot of walking. But, it is a little difficult to find initially. Upon arrival, I was given a room that was not suitable. Fortunately, the front desk staff were able to provide another, which was satisfactory. Also, they did allow early check-in. The room was on the third floor, clean and updated, on the small side. The bathroom was roomy, and also clean, in white marble, with a bidet. The linens seemed to be changed everyday, which is becoming a rarity at some hotels. There was a buffet breakfast, which had a good assortment of items to choose, but not very impressive. The price, a little over 200 Euros per night, including breakfast and tax, was too much for this hotel. There is wireless internet for a charge- I was even charged for 15 minutes to check in online with their computer. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for its cleanliness and location. By the way, if you decide to splurge on a water-taxi- there is a private landing.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: nithu
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Starhotels Splendid Venice, was very Zen like setting. Very clean and comfortable. Beds were very nice. Bathroom was small but good. Loved the room, was decorated with clean lines. This hotel had its own Dock, so you could take a water taxi to the hotel lobby. The location is great. Everything is within walking distance. They have a great breakfast buffet and the room is beautiful too. Loved everything about it ! Great start hotel with good friendly staff and service

Reviews.Title: “At last, a perfect hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: JohnandAnnikki
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th trip to Venice, and this was the best hotel we have stayed in so far. A decent sized room, beautifully decorated and with a lovely modern bathroom. Breakfast and dinner both excellent., too. We also liked the lounges and communal areas. Don't use the address as a means of finding it though, as we did, and found no such sreet as San Marco Mercerie! Ask for detailed directions. It's actually on the Marzaria San Zulian where it crosses a canal!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: baj
Reviews.Content: If you cant do the Dianelle and the really expensive hotels facing Grand Canal off San Marco then the Splendid gives all 4 star quality with a excellent location on a small canal between Rialto and San Marco, actually the main route between the two places and with lots of shopping!. The hotel has recently been renovated with style and has lovely bar/coffee lounge along the canal. The rooms have also be re furbished, we got a large enough one for 3 ( with an extra bed) and did not feel cramped. Breakfast is a buffet and more than adequate though they don't do freshly made eggs ( that's extra). Staff is very helpful Location is great for getting the ferry from Railto and doing a hop on hop off on the grand canal ( tickets about 18 euro for 24 hours ) and more importantly is easy to get back to if you want a break from the walking. There is a lovely wine bar on the other side of Rialto bridge in a old market ( corner shop) and my cousin tells me Bancogiro is a great fish place for lunch. Osteria Santa Maria (Campo Santa Marina ) is expensive but has some good food. Similalry Bistrot de Venise, close to the Spendid) is a bit pretensious but they were very helpful in making stuff that did not trigger our allergies. Service was great. Finally, please leave your big bags at the railway station. Makes it easy to take the ferry ( 3.50 Euro) and navigate the small lanes to your hotel....especially the steps on some bridges! Went to Harry's Bar because it was a have to do...ok for one expensive drink and then move on.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: haydn2407
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. Don't normally write reviews, but feel compelled to do so this time. Slight problem with the room to begin with, but this was dealt with promptly and with professionalism. The hotel is located in a very central and convenient area. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Starhotel Splendid surpassed my expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: julesy6
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 of us from Adelaide, South Australia stayed at the Starhotel Splendid from 8-11 Oct 2010 after our 12 night cruise on the Ruby Princess. We were all extremely happy with our stay and could not fault it in any way. The staff were helpful and courteous, the rooms were comfortable and very clean, breakfast was good and the location was fantastic. We stayed in 3 hotels within europe but this was by far the best of them all. I cannot wait to visit Venice again, and I know my hotel of choice will be Starhotel Splendid! Thanks for a great stay. PS - a special thank you to "Marco" the barman - he looked after us very well after long days of sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and extremely convenient”
Reviews.Author: skippo_10
Reviews.Content: This is a proper four star hotel, with good public rooms, comfortable, clean bedrooms and helpful staff. It is located a short walk from either St Marks or the Rialto bridge. Our food was fine - not top restaurant quality but quite good enough. It was a nice surprise to have sky sports too! We would certainly use this hotel again without hesitation. The one downside was that there was nowhere outside where we could relax - not surprising in the middle of Venice. But I understand that a roof terrace is planned: that would be wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: expat-en-Suisse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a definite 4+ star. Location, style, cleanliness all excellent. Water taxi access. Our room overlooked a canal. There is an abundant breakfast buffet. We were very close to St. Mark's square. Venice is still very crowded in mid-September. This hotel was a great place to rest at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 1LousyCook
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 teenage boys - had to get 2 rooms because rooms are small. But it was worth every penny! Wonderfully helpful staff, CLEAN rooms, comfortable beds and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TraceyS2010
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with Starhotels Splendid in Venice, such a great location, helpful and friendly staff, and lovely rooms, clean and spacious ( for Europe ) with beautiful marble bathrooms. The hotel's location in St. Marco suburb made it easy to access, even with our luggage traipsing through the cobbled streets of Venice. We booked 6 months in advance and received a great rate. Highly recommended and will definitely stay there again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ARIMAYA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a superior room at this hotel for three nights. The room was still small; however, I was told that one should not expect a lot of space in a room in Venice. The location is just great, yet kind of tricky to find with the address provided. Only couple of minutes distance from San Marco square. The rooms are clean with comfortable pillows. The breakfast could have been better (not many choices).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!!”
Reviews.Author: simonthedude
Reviews.Content: If you want a good 4 star Hotel right in the heart of Venice, then this is the hotel for you. It is slap bang in middle of Venice, and no more than 5 minute walk one way for St Marks Square and 5 minutes walk the other way for the Rialto Bridge, and it is on the main walkway between the two. Service was good, especially from Marco, the Barman, who was excellent. If I could make just one small improvement it would be for a slightly more varied buffet breakfast. We arrived by Water Taxi from the airport (115 Euros) and as the hotel has it's own moorings, we felt like VIPs!!! Definately recommended!! As for Venice, it's an amazing place. A couple of tips: try Bacaro Jazz bar on Salizzada Fontego dei Tedeschi (5 mins away), walk a little further for Rizzo Pasta store (Salizzada S Giovanni Grisotomo) and stock up little italian food bits and bobs, stop at the bars and stand up and order a Spritz then move on to another bar, check out Rialto Market in the day for the atmosphere, and return there at night for the 5 or so bars there. You will feel like a local. Dont bother with Harrys Bar, overpriced and zero atmosphere, get a Vaporetti to Murano and see the glass being made and take a wander around this beautiful island, and most importantly, take a Gondala ride at night. Quietly swishing around at 10 pm it feels as though you are the only ones on the water, and Venice belongs to just you.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hoteland had fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: jacsMaryland
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 4 nights with my husband for my 50th birthday. we had a lovely room with a view right on the canal. the bed was one of the comfiest and the pillows were great.the room was quiet at night due to the big shutters and each evening the towels were replaced and the shutters drawn. the staff were good and although we dint eat an evening meal at the hotel the restaraunt looked good. could improve on the coffee though!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel equipped not that great staff”
Reviews.Author: bruce_cku
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers mentioned, this hotel has excellent location and room facility. We slept quite well and shower is very comfortable. Although breakfast can not compete with full house style, the restaurant is doing a good job (and making good coffee). They hotel can easily be ranked top 10 and top five in venice, why it's not? 1. slow check in/out: very slow, slowest ever I have been. people squeezed in the check in desk and there is absolute no order. people jump in the queue.... they definitely need to improve the process and spped 2. staff 2.1 I asked for plate/knife/folks to be delivered to the room as i wanted to prepare a fruit salad myself. guess what, here is exact words they replied me over the phone: you have to pay for room service charge. or you come down to collect them and it's free. 2.2 we went to the glass factory the next day (never shop in that glass factory, guess the price has been inflated by 1000% or more...) a local venitian came to pick us. between the hotel and pier (about 15mins walk), he is always on phone and only managed to speak to us once: where are you from? again it's the peole who made the difference, this is even more important in such touristic and commercial venice! we want to spend but dont want to nakedly to be treated as the hotel's commodity and money printing machine

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel in heart of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: sunhshine
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel a couple of mins walk from St Marks Sq and a few mins walk to the Rialto bridge. We arrived at St marks by alilaguna from Marco Polo airport and within a few mins we had crossed the square and we were at the hotel very quickly. it is tucked down a quiet lane at one side and on a lovely canal. It has a landing dock for gondolas/water taxis. The reception area is amnned by porters who give directions/umberellas(if needed)/help with luggage - nothing is too much trouble. The lounge/bar areas are really nice with loads of comfy couches - you can watch the odd gondola float by! We had a lovely room with the most comfortable bed!! We had 2 sets of french doors overlooking a very busy shopping street - great for prople watching. The bathroom was lovely - totally marble - loads of lovely toiletries/gowns/purple slippers!! There was tea/coffee making in the room - unusual in italy - but lovely! The restuarant (we only had breakfast) was very nice - there was a great range of hot/cold items/juices/good coffee. Part of the area has a glass roof so it it lovely and light. The staff are very efficient throughout the hotel - nothing is too much trouble for them. The location of the hotel is fantastic - I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: olliebaba
Reviews.Content: We were extremely satisfied with our stay at Starhotels Splendid. The hotel is clean and nicely decorated, the breakfast was very good and the location can not be beat. Take a water taxi from the airport- it is worth every penny! Also, we booked our stay well in advance through expedia and had a terrific rate. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location. Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: WindyCity_Injuin
Reviews.Content: We had a great time during our 3 day stay in August 2010. We had two rooms. Rooms are beautifully appointed. The location of the property is great. It is in the middle of everything and everywhere. We were well taken care of by the staff. They had a american style breakfast in the morning. Great way to begin your day. They have a very good bar with canal views. The room size were comparable to what we get in the US. Bathrooms are little bit smaller. However both very well appointed. All in all, will stay here again. Highly recommended. Used the concierge's recommendation for dinner. Had a good time in both the recommended locations. I would recommend future travelers to use Rick Steves as a guide book, but use this hotel for comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee33
Reviews.Content: Booked the Splendid Hotel based on reviews from this site. The value was good and the room comfortable. Front desk staff was a bit "chilly", however, not a deal breaker. We were expecting our luggage which was delayed from another flight. After advising the concierge of the expectation from the airlines and leaving our number, we returned after hours to be informed the airline called and would not be sending it. They chose to forward it on to our cruise line the following evening. The concierge made no attempt to contact us and when asked whom from the airlines had called, he had no idea. Also had no suggestions on where to retrieve a telephone number for the airline.This left us without some toiletries and extra clothing. The concierge seemed unphased by our inconvenience and offered no assistance whatsoever. Other hotels might have at least offered a sample of tooth paste! (I did ask and was told they had none) None the less, we were determined to make the most of our vacation and go with the temporary loss. Our room was very clean and pretty much average. The location was very good and in close proximity to most sight seeing. The overall value was good for what we paid and the buffet breakfast was also very good. I will also give kudos to the bell man who was very helpful. However, I would probably elect to try another locale on a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our trip to Venice. The city was enchanting. The Splendid was a very good hotel. Rooms were immaculent. Location was excellent. 5 minutes from the Rialto Bridge and 5 minutes from San Marco Plaza. Thanks to the information desk at the Santa Lucia train station, we were able to easily find the hotel. The only reason I am not giving this hotel a 5 is the customer service. The customer service wasn't bad, but it wasn't consistent. It was almost as if the guest relations desk was unfamiliar with the city. When asked for a recommendation for lunch, she told me she could print our a list and give it to me. However, when I went to the front desk, the person there gave me an excellent recommendation, right off the top of his head and he was right on the money. When asking how to get to the airport, one person was very clear on the different modes of transportation while another was clueless when we went back to the desk to some more information that we forgot to ask the first time (ie: what time does the vaporetti start running in the morning). I must say, there was a young lady who checked us in that was most excellent. She was quite efficient and asked us if we had any futher questiosn. Other than the inconsistent customer service, the hotel is a winner and I will deifnitely stay again when we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: turner_and_hooch
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a weekend in Venice and stayed at the Splendid hotel (star hotels). The location of the hotel is really good however given the layout and nature of Venice it is not the easy to find if you have never visited before. The check-in is not till 2pm so if you arrive early you will have to drop off your bags and wonder around this stunning city. If your travelling a long distance this may be a little frustrating but the bar area will be open and you can simpley look straight outside and watch the Gondolas go past. The hotel is very clean and decorated to a high standard. We stayed in a superior room which was equiped with a large bathroom with shower toilet and bidet. Our view was of an alleyway but to be honest we didnt spend much time in the room anyway. There was a flat panel tv, tea and coffee mini bar. Room service available and reception are on hand should need anything at all extra. We only had breakfast at the hotel which does offer evening meal in the restaurant which looked reasonable and smelt great. the breakfast was a good range of pastries and breads fruits juices bacon and egg. The staff were pleaseant and well presented. I would recommend this hotel. some tips for venice itself... If your a first time visitor be aware you will need to get to Venice from Marco Polo airport the most direct way is by water taxi or public water bus. water taxi is E100 one way so if you find a few couples to get one with you it will make it cheaper. (same price regardless of how many travelling). the water bus is much cheaper however it will likely to be very crowded and like a normal bus stop and numerous other places dropping off and picking up. Gondolas at present are E100 for 40 minutes and this is not negotiable even if there are 6 of you its set price. If you just want a picture on one then opt for the crossing Gondola these are dotted throughout the main canal and baisally cross one side to the other for 50 cent. Venice is very expensive to eat and drink around and about. if you fancy a drink in saint marcs square then buy your drinks in one go depending how long you want to be there for as you are charged 12% service charge plus a charge of around E6 for the orchestra that will be playing each time you order! Its a shoppers haven with numerous big name shops including prada chanel gucci etc so bring your credit cards! make sure you take your camera as it is one of the most stunning places to visit enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my wishes”
Reviews.Author: g3300
Reviews.Content: Great location, big room (for Venice standards), clean, good breakfast. Good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel top class facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: eenymeeny
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for a 1 night stay before picking up a cruise in Venice. It was lovely, an oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of a crowded city. Perfect location, comfortable room, lovely bed, nice breakfast. Air con nice and cool. Our only slight niggle was a very noisy start to the day. There appeared to be some sort of cleaning barge on the canal beneath our window which made such a din from 7am on Saturday morning also loud thudding music until quite late on the Friday night, possibly a club nearby. Shame really because apart from the noise everything was perfect especially watching the gondoliers under the bedroom window would go there again but possibly request a quiet room we were on the corner of 2 canals.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cathyw44
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Splendid in Venice. The rooms were beautiful and clean and the staff were always accomodating and helpful. The breakfast buffet and service were fantastic (and I'm a picky eater!). We definately recommend this hotel and give it 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “What a 'Splendid' Birthday surprise!”
Reviews.Author: sexysuzy
Reviews.Content: My Husband surprised me on my birthday that we were going to Venice the next day..... We arrived in style via water taxi, to stay at the Splendid hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is in a perfect location, clean and very comfortable. They told us at reception on check in that they had upgraded our room to a suite, lots of space, with beautiful marble bathroom, TV in the living room and TV in the bedroom, tea and coffee making facilities, in room safe and views of the canals. Breakfast was included in the price we also ate at the hotel restaurant 2 of the nights we stayed....... Highly recommend. The hotel bar/lounge was excellent for before or after dinner drinks, never too busy and good looking out of the windows at the gondolas going by. If you like shopping?............Well Venice is a shoppers pardise!! Every turning are more and more shops. As you can imagine lots of historical places to visit also. It's quite easy to travel on the water buses, we even did a trip to the beach one day, which took about 20mins. I would love to return to Venice one day. A 50th Birthday I will never ever forget..... :-) Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Hidden away but when found a real gem”
Reviews.Author: Bazbell
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi from the airport and disembarked at the hotel's own mooring. Expensive (100 Euros but really worth it) The hotel is hard to find the first time, the streets behind St. Marks are a maze until you get to know your routes. The hotel is a real gem. It is well maintained with suprisingly spacious rooms. The beds are huge and mine was very comfy. Rooms at the back of the hotel get a little noise from a service canal but it did not start till about 7.45 am. Breakfast is classic continental fare with a daily serving of scrambled eggs and bacon. Fresh linen was provided every day. You simply cannot neat the location. Five minutes from St. Marks one way and ten minues to the Rialto Bridge the other. There are plenty of places to eat locally but be prepared to pay appoximately 20 Euros a main course in the locality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aaron_woolf
Reviews.Content: My parter and I stayed for 3 nights over the bank holiday weekend and had a fantastic time! Venice is amazing but because of the volume of people and the constant "no thanks" you say to Gondaliers and restaurant owners, you want a nice relaxing hotel to come back to. We were not disappointed! Although difficult to find (no point even looking at a map unless it is GPS as NONE of the street names are mentioned) the hotel is in a perfect location for shopping, food, sights and bars! Not cheap, however, and the breakfast does not really do the other 4-star ameneties (dressing gowns, porters, slick bar, marble etc) justice. On the whole the hotel was very nice, but overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “splendid”
Reviews.Author: jayeeta
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, exotic location and absolute value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: JollyJR
