Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel largely on the recommendations from trip advisor and we were not dissapointed. We were travelling with our daughter and had booked a triple room. We received a free upgrade to the Junior suite which gave us a lot more room and a few extras (including jacuzzi bath, dressing gowns and slippers ) ! We have no hesitation in recommending thie hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my wishes”
Reviews.Author: 30redtaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 'Splendid Hotel' for 3 days for our 10th wedding anniversary, i'd spent days looking into which hotel and this was the only one I'd found that suited both out tastes and when we arrived we were not disapointed it was beyond everything I'd imagined. We had a room overlooking a canal. The room was just gorgeous-exactly what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel, I kept taking lots of photo's. We slept so well as the wonderful curtains kept out the sun and the bed was so comfy and there was a wonderful plasma with a mirror frame. The decor is so sumptious and luxurious-Take a look inside the toilets in the main hotel, they're so elegant and clean!! The location is spot on, just a 5 min walk to st marks square and a 5 min walk the other way to Riaoto Bridge. Great service but once we did return to the hotel in a quiet period of the day around 3ish and had a problem to find a member of staff to order a coffee, we eventually found 1 and ordered a drink, 20 mins later the waiter had still not returned with out coffees, think we'd caught him at a busy time changing over all the tables in the restaurant, but this was our only grumble. Late at night when we went to the bar we had prompt service every night. The reception staff are so friendly and look up weather reports etc for you and hand out brolleys when it is raining and arrange for porters to carry your bags to your room. This is the most elegant hotel I have stayed in and we have travelled alot! Shop around for the best price as on Expedia we got 2 nights for Â£580 but in Thomas cook branch and Co OP they could only offer Â£870 for the same deal. Worth every penny and if we ever returned I would definately stay in the this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrollKent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Splendid the first week in July. As everyone says, the location is excellent for all major sights and shopping, and an easy walk from them all. The rooms are nicely decorated and a good size, but tight on clothes space. The beds are comfortable and we slept well, it was quiet. The bathroom is a good size and well equipped, but we had bugs in the bath a couple of times, must have come up the drain. TV is a dead loss, with not so much as an English news channel, so gave that a miss. Tried to check our bill on the â€œInteractive TVâ€�, but it occasionally displayed the bills for other rooms. So much for privacy. The room supplied a kettle and tea/coffee, but the plug on the kettle didnâ€™t fit any of the room sockets. A stroke of genius by the hotel to limit the free tea/coffee consumed?. However it fitted with an adaptor we had with us, so not a complete loss. The morning breakfast was fine, and we had no notable complaints on quality, quantity or service. We had a morning with a power cut and no hot food or drinks, but it was a one-off. We went to the Murano Glass Factory on a one-way trip courtesy of the Hotel. Came back by water taxi. They only show one small section of the factory, then take you straight to the showroom. Tourist trap or what, but the showroom is impressive. The Hotel lounge bar is comfortable, and the service was efficient. Overall we had a pleasant stay, but Iâ€™d certainly consider a different Hotel if we go to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scotlandrobbo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Splendid Venice Hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of August 2010. If you want a good clean hotel with a nice room in a central location this is the one!............ The room was cleaned to a very high standard, the sheets and towels were changed as required (the bedlinen was of a very high quality with a pillow menu and the towels were lovely - fluffy and white). The lounge area is very relaxing (you could sit and watch the Gondolas going past on the canal) and the bar staff could not do enough for you. Continental Breakfast was included (a good idea as there did not appear to be many places where you could go out to and sit to have breakfast) - there was not a huge choice but it was sufficient for our needs. All in all an excellent hotel for a short break in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christo59
Reviews.Content: For a 4* hotel this is in an ideal location between Rialto and St Mark's Square, right in the heart of a busy shopping district - but in spite of this it is remarkably quiet. It feels more like a 5* but doesn't have a spa etc; the rooms are spacious, well decorated and clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. On the downside, there are no English TV stations - not even news channels - and to watch a pay-movie costs over 15 euros! Even satellite TV costs 10 euros per night, which is absurd. internet access is 11 euros per day. Would definitely recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice summer break”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Laura030
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in Venice during the middle of July, staying at the Splendid. On arrival, the hotel was very difficult to find, however I feel this would be the case for the majority of the hotels in Venice. Dont even bother trying to use a Map- it just doesnt work! After a while we eventually stumbled across the hotel. The hotel itself is in the perfect location, midway between st marks square and the Rialto bridge. The hotel is done up very nicely- looked very clean and well kept, and looks like it has been refurbed very recently. The rooms are much the same, and very comfortable, if somewhat on the small side. On the down side, the sevice at breakfast was not always great- it was usual in the mornings that they would forget to ask if we wanted coffee/tea, and the would also forget to bring it out when we eventually did order. Also, they have a communal computer station, but have to pay for the use of the internet. However, overall these are small gripes, and we both thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very good value for money, and I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: JakobHagman
Reviews.Content: Starhotel Venice is a great hotel just a minute away from the Piazza san Marco. We stayed in this hotel for three nights and it was the perfect vantage point from where to experience Venice. It's an oasis in the middle of the hectic streets of Venice. Room 511 has a view to die for and a terrace to go with it. We got this as a complementary upgrade. Sweet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: e_amnesiac
Reviews.Content: The first and most important asset of the hotel is the location. It is midway between Rialto bridge and Piazza San Marco, thus giving the opportunity to hit the main tourist attractions on foot. The room was nice, it had the kind of decor you expect from a hotel in Venice (meaning it's not very modern, or minimal), and although this wasn't to my true liking, it was very clean, had a nice view over a quiet canal and had nothing to complain about. Breakfast was served in a very nice dining room, and all the public areas of the hotel are very tastefully decorated. Don't hesitate to book it, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, elegant, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Maisy-Boops
Reviews.Content: Location is wonderful. A bit of a pain to get to, but once we were here it was a great central location. There many shops and restaurants in the area. My teenage daughters enjoyed being able to explore the shops on their own. We often found ourselves in the vincinity of the hotel during our explorations, so it was nice to be able to use the bathroom, drop off packages ,change shoes or just relax for a half hour, before heading back out. The rooms were very clean and quiet. Our room was right out side the elevator on the third floor. We never heard anyone in the halls, nor did we hear any noise from outside. The beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel staff were wonderful, especially Alex at the front desk. He arranged a water taxi for us to go to Murano at no charge, as well as one to take us to the cruise terminal. The latter was a godsend (it met us right at the hotel), since we had 4 adults (one senior) , 2 teens and a child plus luggage. Negotiating the streets to catch the water bus would have been horrible, and the extra cost ( about 20 euro ) was negligible. Sooo worth the money. The breakfast were not anything special, but it was enough to start the day. Tere were cereals, baked goods, juices, fruits, meats and yogur. there were eggs, but they looked odd, and we never tasted them. Great hotel. Price was much better than many other hotels I looked at in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Manfica
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location 5 mins either way to the Rialto Bridge or St Mark's square. The hotel rooms were clean and air-conditioned, a must if you're going in July ! Its also on the gondola path if you start at the Rialto Bridge. Not the biggest rooms but thats nothing new in Europe. All in all, in its price bracket a good hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Judybop
Reviews.Content: Splendid Hotel was in a great location a few blocks between Piazza San Marco and Rialto bridge. Local to shopping, shopping, shopping! Great spot for sights and sounds of Venice...and on a small canal. Rooms were upscale but Euro-sized; comfy beds, very clean, and great bath. Staff was very accomodating. Local to fun but quiet for a good night's rest. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in whole of Italy”
Reviews.Author: xclusiveDubai
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, bang in the center of everything i.e san marco, rialto etc. Hotel provides one way free trip to murano which is a must! Breakfast is average but is in a nice setting. The usuals are laid out such as eggs bread assortments, bacon, canned juices Room is quaint and extremely comfortable with canal views. The bed is very soft and will defenitely get u snoozing immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: rebz6999
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as part of our honeymoon around Italy and it was absolutely beautiful. Gorgeous decoration and very stylish inside and out. The bathroom was very nice and modern. The staff were lovely and the location was great. we just got a water taxi to it straight from the train station but it's very central to shops and bars so it would be easy to get there using the public ferry. Would recommend to anyone -although it's true, venice does smell, but dont let that put you off. What a gem!

Reviews.Title: “If a mistake wouldn't disturb, go here”
Reviews.Author: Trankkis
Reviews.Content: We were here for our honeymoon. After a wonderful stay in the stalhotel anderson in Milan a couple of days before we expected similar service and were disappointed. The room was small, the toilet door didn't work, no fresh vegetables for breakfast (they had tomatoes but refused to give some to us!) but excellent location. The personnel didn't seem to be working in the right business - they behaved more like hot dog vendors than personnel of a four-star hotel. Nothing wrong with that, but we won't stay here again unless they change to more service-minded people.

Reviews.Title: “Not so friendly staffs but good location”
Reviews.Author: missylee28
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on the 2nd week of May. The plus point is the good location- in between Rialto pier and San Marco. Decent size room and bathroom (very clean too ). Breakfast choice is average and for the 2 days we were there it is crowded.. And oh.. the guy at the reception ( 40ish , with spectacle) was not that friendly and so is their porter..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larry0524
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel right in the heart of Venice. Convenient to the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks Square. Clean, good food, and the place to be in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for a Venice break”
Reviews.Author: Coolonela
Reviews.Content: Excellent location between the Rialto Bridge & San Marco, so the key sites are easy to walk to, Vaporetto stops are close for the rest. The web site brags about the comfort of the beds & they deliver, probably the most comfortable hotel bed we've ever slept in. Spotlessly clean with helpful staff. Slight mark downs on value as the meals in the hotel are very expensive & also we had one late breakfast & the staff seemed a bit overwhelmed with the number of people & were a bit slow. Pretty minor points in an otherwise perfect stay. Would recommend this hotel & stay here again. Quick tip, meals are very expensive here & in most of the tourist hot spots, but you can find reasonable offers if you go a little "off track" & don't want silver service. For example we found Osteria da Luca in Marzaria del capitello which had a 3 course menu for 18 Euros including coffee. A detailed map is also worth every penny/cent.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: garybons
Reviews.Content: Five minutes from St Mark's in one direction and the same from the Rialto in the other, this peaceful and well appointed hotel is ideally situated for getting all around Venice. Our canal-view room was modern, spacious and comfortable with an excellent bathroom. The breakfast buffet was very good and the waiting staff delightful. Impossible to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Indeed”
Reviews.Author: PJOC_10
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It was clean. Our room was spotless, spacious,modern and we were upgraded to a room with a canal view. The bed was sensational as were the pillows. The bathroom was also spacious and we had ample luggage and wardrobe room. Breakfast was delicious and the staff were exceptionally helpful and obliging. Internet access was a little expensive but that was the only (minor) downside of our 3 day stay. The location (between San Marco and Rialto) was sensational,. Look forward to returning. Ended our trip at Starhotel in Rome and that was also fantastic. Will happily try them all!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: alantayloruk
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed with our five day stay in a superior room. Air conditioning not working in the room at 26 degrees C. Reception told us to open the windows which resulted in being attacked each night by mosquitos. No milk in the room to make tea or coffee. Refrigerator light works but no cooling. Rooms not made up on some occasions until mid afternoon. TV will not get BBC or CNN. Breakfast, bacon luke warm and scrambled eggs looked like warm ups. Very limited choice of bread. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable international chain with the best hotel beds anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: carolanne60
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a chain, and rather lacking in Venetian, or even Italian, touches. Rooms are small: ours was supposed to be for 3 adults but was a regular (small) double with an extra bed, so we couldn't even open the windows without moving furniture. It was well decorated and generally well appointed (except no milk for coffee) with fantastically comfortable beds - I wanted to take mine home! No satellite TV, only one (pay as you surf) desktop in a lobby area and no wireless access for mobile phone. Our room was overlooking an alley, which was noisy with pedestrians' voices echoing at all hours, especially around 5am. We were woken at 7am every morning by the booming church bells nearby, which was strangely comforting. The buffet breakfast is good, but the dining room only seats about 1/2 of guests at any time, so is very busy - be prepared to wait for a table, and the staff, although they try very hard, struggle to keep the buffet stocked and bring tea/coffee and clear tables. We had very little interaction with the staff, other than at breakfast, but our request to leave bags until the evening after our checkout was no problem. The hotel location is great, if a little awkward to find the first time - buy a detailed map and get directions from both the Rialto and St Marks waterbus stops before you go. Overall the experience was fine, but we did get a last minute discount - not sure I'd have wanted to pay full whack.

Reviews.Title: “A dream comes true!”
Reviews.Author: rancer
Reviews.Content: After waiting a lifetime to visit Venice I was nervous about choosing a hotel. I am very happy I chose this hotel. We were in Venice for our honeymoon. The room was fantastic. We had a nice view of the canal below. The room was sharp and the bathroom was comfortable. The staff was very helpful and polite. Another plus for this hotel is the daily breakfast which was provided. It was a nice way to start off the day. Another huge plus is the location. Just minutes from San Marco Square and the Rialto Bridge. Just be prepared to be awake at 7 am every morning since that is when Venice wakes up!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean and stylish”
Reviews.Author: JulieMartinSurrey
Reviews.Content: We could not fault our superior room booked through ebookers at the last minute. We stayed 3 nights and in a busy city enjoyed 3 nights peaceful sleep in a huge bed made up with beautifully soft white sheets and the most comfortable pillows I have ever found in a hotel anywhere. The bathroom was perfect with a superb shower and bath, white marble and gleaming chrome fittings with varied lighting options and loads of mirrors with a good magnifying mirror too - a thoughtful touch. We enjoyed the view from the room of the gondoliers antics down below, the clatter of the people in the narrow alleyways nearby and the interesting old buildings opposite, but when we wanted peace all we had to do was close the double glazed windows and the shutters and then we were cocooned from it all and able to relax completely watching the flat screen TV. A small hospitality tray was appreciated. Although compact, the room was very well planned and equipped with good quality modern light oak furniture. We particularly liked the dressing area with its full length mirror and plenty of storage space and - a rarity - some well placed hooks and proper hangers! Two comfortable armchairs, a footstool and a dressing table stool in the bathroom gave us all the options we needed for a very comfortable stay. We would not hesitate to return to this sanctuary of peace, cleanliness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Best place on venice...”
Reviews.Author: Ronp09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the splendid hotel in venice... room was fantastic... romantic atmohsphere... classy and nice hotel... nice staff... a few steps from san marco square... me and my wife we loved it... breakfast was good... food at the restaurant was great... with a huy playing the piano it was just perfect for a fantastic venetian night... I DEFINITLY RECOMEND THIS HOTEL FOR HONEYMOONERS...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mdrrar
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is located along a small canal, half way between the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks Square. We had a Jr. Suite which had a comfortably sized bed room, sitting room and bathroom with a shower/tub combination. The entire suite was nicely done. There were two English speaking channels on the TV's for anyone that needed to keep updated. All of the staff spoke English and were helpful when I needed directions. Our package include breakfast so we took our breakfasts at the hotel. It was excellent, with scrambled eggs and bacon accompanied by fresh fruit and a variety of cold cuts and cheeses. We also ate dinner at the restaurant one night and we both had a delicious meal with courteous service. The only drawback was the internet. It is supplied by an outside, independant provider. The charge was not that much, but it only worked sporadically for us. The hotel offered a "free tour" of a Murano glass factory. We were delivered by boat to the Signoretti factory. Unfortunately, we did not get to spend that much time watching the artists at work. Most of the time was spent in the show room. If you get Vana as your guide, be warned that she is funny, charming and relentless. Needless to say, I no longer have to by my wife gifts for several holidays, birthdays and anniversaries. Despite our experience, we really liked this hotel and it would be my first consideration when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: jamrhy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we left we were made to feel welcome and the staff could not do enough for us.Centrally located and close to all major attractions . Located on the canal ,breakfrast and dinner were both great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: artistexplorer
Reviews.Content: I took my 13 year old son (who is a seasoned, easy traveler) to Venice for fun. We stayed here for 3 nights and arrived and left by the dock via water taxi. The rooms were clean, comfortable and nicely fit out, bathroom was large and luxurious. The common areas of the hotel were very nice as well with a lovely view of the canal. There was a full breakfast buffet in an interior glass roof courtyard. The hotel is a short walk from St. Mark's Square and the Rialto, at the edge of the shopping district. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GammelMont
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Splendid for 3 nights with my husband. Nice location close to St Marc's place and the Rialto bridge. Rooms are nicely furnished and clean though the view was crappy, basically a wall. But for 3 nights and considering most of the day was spent outside no big deal. The place was quiet. Breakfast was OK, nothing special. However regarding the complimentary trip to Murano, I'd asked the previous evening and was told no problem, come in the morning, the boats run every half an hour. The next day I stopped at the reception and was asked to come back in half an hour, they needed to check with the company running it if they had a group. We show up half an hour later and the receptionist calls a few places and apparently, it's not possible. It was really no big deal but I don't particularly like to waste 30 mins of my time. They could have just said the previous evening, we can't guarantee anything but will try and let you know. OK hotel all in all but I wouldn't rate it great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and stuff”
Reviews.Author: HCABraz
Reviews.Content: In one sentence: excellent rooms, stuff and location. The breakfast is not so good, specially because the hotel creates an awesome expectation about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, right in the heart of Venice. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lupifamily
Reviews.Content: It was perfect for us. Great location, clean rooms, comfortable beds. They upgraded our room when we got there without asking, so we ended up with a canal view. The hotel included a good breakfast, and the staff was helpful. I loved it here, and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Venice! Don't miss the Doge's Palace, most beautiful building we saw in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for a Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: nickoula
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 3 days in mid November as the middle leg of a 3 city trip and it was absolutely perfect! A very affordable,charming hotel with an adequate breakfast buffet, clean modern rooms, large comfortable bed, immaculate oversized bathroom, convenient central location and decent staff. The room and hotel was exactly as depicted on their website! We were upgraded to a spacious corner room overlooking 2 canals and enjoyed waking up to the sounds of St. Marks bells each morning. Was it the best hotel in Venice? Certainly Not! But for the money it far exceeded our expectations. The only downside was that we couldn't find any decent restaurants nearby and it was so crowded in the vicinity, but that was a minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when in venice”
Reviews.Author: RUSH2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in terms of location, rooms are very spacious and well equipped with all luxuries. Design was the greatest pull for me, but hotel turned out to be very comfy and friendly too. Wouldn't look for anywhere else to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel (for Venice) and great location !”
Reviews.Author: FrancoisMontreal
Reviews.Content: The Splendid is a good hotel in a city with tiny rooms in general. The location is perfect being two minutes away from the Piazza San Marco. The rooms are modern and fresh (if you don't enjoy mostured rooms, it's a plus). The bathroom is clean, functionnal and all in marble. The room is not large but for Venice, it's not that bad. The breakfast is included which is a nice surprise and the business center is cozy and inviting. The service is so-so but again, you're in Venice where space is limited. And like other reviews, I would say that my room was not quiet. But on the second night, I was used to it and slept well. So I think the Splendid is a wise choice

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Service, skip the 'Canal view' upgrade”
Reviews.Author: BiancaB74
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were nice/clean. We were told when we arrived that we had been upgraded to the 'canal view' room - my advice is to skip the upgrade! It's a tiny little canal which is not worth it especially when you have to put up with the noise outside at 6:30am each day where there are boats outside and rubbish being emptied (very loud and disturbing). The food in the hotel restaurant was nice. We found the room to be hot though and we opened the windows to get some air in - that was a mistake! Have arrived back to London with large mosquito bites! The hotel is in the middle of the shops so I found it to be a good location. It is a very busy/touristy area though but I still found it a perfect spot to easily get to, very central and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatiion....Great restaurant staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelersofOZ
Reviews.Content: Starhotels Splendid is an excellent hotel in Venice. Lovely areas where guests can sit. Beautifully decorated. Our room was excellent. Breakfast was great. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner in the Restaurant. . Located between St Marco and Rialto it is a great base to explore from. Top marks to the great staff in the restaurant, they were friendly, professional and exceptional service. Well Done!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful & polite staff”
Reviews.Author: Luksus
Reviews.Content: We came to Starhotels Splendid Venice, we had ordered a superior room. At the arriva we asked for a room with tub. There was no room with tub ready for some hours they said at the reception, so we asked if we could see the room with "only" the shower. We saw, and did not like it because it was small and the floor had some marks of cigarette (?) burning. Disappointed! Yes. Then they upgraded us to a relaxe room which was much cosier and nice! Good service! Its was quiet, clean, and has coffee/tea facilities. Nice bathroom in marble. Its near to everything. We missed free internet. We had an amazing trip! It is smart to ask if you can see the room before you decide to have it or not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Gleikit
Reviews.Content: Not cheap, but if you only have a few days in Venice then the Splendid really cannot be faulted for location and service. Situated between the Rialot bridge and St Mark's Square, on its own small canal, the public areas and bedrooms have a lovely modern feel in a sympathetically restored building. The self-service breakfast is good, though the coffee was a bit weak. Also the bedroom smelt a little of cigarette smoke when we first arrived. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located close to Plaza San Marco and the taxi boat ride to it is charming (count 75 to 90EUR depending on luggage and day of the week). The restaurant staff was really great (and so was dinner), which was not the case of the reception who took ages to check us in and out. The rooms are probably quite small (our deluxe triple was half the size of the double we had in Trieste at the same chain) and quite pricey. The canal view is another 70ish EUR on top of the regular rate, which is clearly not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: ronniejts
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on our first trip to Venice. Service was very good and we ate in the hotel restaurant 1 night which was good. The location of the hotel is great. We took the #2 vaporetto line and got off at the Rialto stop. Although hard to find at first, we realized during our stay that it is very close close to the Rialto stop, we just didn't take the most direct route the first time. Room was very large, modern and clean, and the bed was by far the most comfortable of the 3 cities we visited in Italy. Bathroom was beautiful and the shower/tub was very close to what we are used to having in the US. We took the free boat ride to Murano which the hotel easily arranged. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Venice- very modern feel”
Reviews.Author: travelangelista
Reviews.Content: I travel to explore the charm of other cultures, but I am not willing to sacrifice a good night sleep for a rickity old bed. That's why I fell in love with this hotel this summer. I found it on TripAdvisor (thankfully). It was reasonably-priced compared to the other luxury chain I usually frequent and felt like an upscale W Hotel. Very sleek, modern furnishings, but with a definite Venetian touch. Our room was overlooking the convergence of 2 canals and a small footbridge- nothing exciting- but it was extremely comfortable, clean and modern. The location was absolutely ideal for exploring Venice. I plan to return next year and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mroadster
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to Rialto water bus stop, easy to get to from train station (13 EU, as opposed to $150 eu private transport)! Only a few blocks from station. Staff was very accomodating, the room was fantastic and comfortable. Best bed we had while in Italy! Breakfast was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- clean- excellent location- rooms were spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: 02Lexus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first 4 days of our honeymoon and was very pleasantly surprised at how clean the rooms were. The location is perfectly located! It was hard to find after getting off the ferry but overall- I would highly recommend it! The breakfast buffet was awesome- great service!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Daniela79
Reviews.Content: Very nice, trendy hotel located right behind San Marco Plazza, priced right, very good buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Starhotels Splendid Venice is an amazing little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerinNY
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not huge but tastefully decorated. It is right by a small canal so you can arrive by water taxi. It also has a free excursion to Murano but this should be scheduled ahead of time. We reserved a canal view room which costs a little extra. Although the room was a little small, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was huge with marble tiles. Complimentary breakfast buffet was very filling. This hotel is conveniently located to shops and restaurants. Overall, I really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: januarytheking
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice (well, first trip to Italy), and this hotel was just lovely. The staff was very friendly, they spoke English well and were always willing to lead us to a fabulous restaurant or to great shopping or pretty much whatever we wanted! The location to St. Mark's Square is great - close to shopping, close to catching the vaporetto (water buses) and the hotel sits right on a canal where you can catch a lovely (and pricey) gondola ride. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Romantic Venice”
Reviews.Author: 5LolaBeans
Reviews.Content: This hotel was central to all we wanted to see. The free breakfast was quite good and in a large dinning area. Our room was modern in style and had a great little alcove for our luggage for easy access. The clean lines were a welcome change after a long day of sightseeing. They have their own dock but walking with our luggage from the ferry on the grand canal was super easy and cheap. They had nice lounge areas to relax in too. Our room over looked a small side canal but was still quiet. The bathroom was very sleek but their little half shower wall did not keep in the water well. A small price to pay for such a great hotel. It was right in the middle of great shopping and wonderful food.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: RobbK
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on several websites I finally made a decision to book a room for 3 nights at the Splendid Venice. I proposed to my fiance in Piazza San Marco and was looking for a nice hotel. All of the Grand Canal hotels with views were booked already so I was looking for something with a more intimate feel but wanted to be sure there were contemporary accommodations...i.e decent bathroom...a large bed and enough room. Definitely lucked out with room 512. After looking at the building several times I realized we were in only one of a few rooms with a balcony. Although we didn't spend much time in the room, it was nice to have a moment on a balcony big enough for a couple of chairs and a table so we could relax for a few minutes before and after dinner. it overlooked a very small canal and had a view of the Campanile in San Marco. Top floor room with a great view of the Venice roof tops. I am from the states and decided to bring a box of chocolate for the front desk (See's candy). I did mention to the staff that the chocolate from the states is not even close in comparison to chocolate in Italy but wanted to show my appreciation for their service. generally a nice gesture since the front desk probably doesn't get treated too often....this may have had something to do with the great room selection we got. Venice is definitely a special place when compared to my somewhat limited exposure to Italy and other parts of Europe. We went to Milan to spend the weekend after so we could go to the F1 race. When we had to catch our flight late late the following day out of Venice, we hurried back from Milan so we could walk the streets of Venice briefly to enjoy again. We both decided that we would love to come back to the Splendid because of the very cool boutique contemporary feel and excellent location. After getting over the initial sticker shock of Venice hotels in general, I was really happy and will be back as soon as i can afford another trip to Italy. BTW, I did win some points with my fiance by proposing in Italian and English.....definitely made it a hard act to follow amongst our friends. Also, the Bistro D Venice (sp?) was an incredible place for dinner....originally recommended by the hotel, I had forgot the name and ended up having dinner there anyway because of the great vibe when walking by....expensive but our best dinner in Italy. I know it sounds very promotional but I used to wait tables a long time ago and the service was awesome. Robb Newport beach, CA, USA

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: FabulousMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely worth its price. From the outside, there is really nothing much to see but once you get in, you know you are in for a treat. The rooms were more than adequate, the sheets were immaculate and the toilet was divine. The location was likewise excellent since we only had to walk less than 5 minutes and we were right in the middle of St. Mark's Square and getting back was not a problem. The array of shops near the hotel also made the area more interesting. Service was very good and the selection for breakfast was more than enough. It was the first time I got to eat bacon and eggs for breakfast in Europe. The only issue I had was that we had to pay for internet. This should have been free considering the price of the hotel. If you have a higher than average budget for a hotel then I would highly recommend this particular hotel, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Room in Venice”
Reviews.Author: nevets_83
Reviews.Content: Knowing how easy it is to get lost in Venice I e-mailed the hotel for directions and found the hotel in no time from the San Marco waterbus stop using their directions. The hotel is in a great location and once you find the place it is easy to remember how to get to and from the hotel to other attractions around Venice. Check-in was friendly and quick, while check-out was cold so some inconsistencies with front desk. Also inconsistencies with the morning breakfast staff some hustled while others took it upon themselves to make fun of the hotel guest in a pretty obvious way. Asked a staff member how much internet was to be told "very expensive" in a condesending way. When asked for recommendations were directed to expensive places listed on the free map the hotels gives. The hotel was so nice and the location was great , we were able to overlook the unprofessionalism from only a handful of the staff. The breakfast however was probably one of the better hotel breakfasts Iâ€™ve had with a great variety of hot and cold choices. Our room had an amazing view we could see gondolas passing by underneath, our window was always open and had a ledge large enough to sit off. The washroom was our favourite feature it was well designed, luxurious, and fully stocked. The lobby/bar area was beautiful and had great big windows overlooking a canal. Overall, I got a great rate for the room so it was a great value, would stay again if in Venice, and would consider the Starhotel chain while travelling throughout Italy

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wedged between Rialto & St Marks, rude front desk.”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler57
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel - about what you'd expect from a Hilton/Marriott perspective. Room was clean, breakfast was great, and rates were very expensive. If you're looking for a Venice charmer, with interaction and friendliness with the guests and staff, this is not your hotel. Concierge was nice and helpful but pointed you in the direction of restaurants that paid to be on their map. Good location halfway between Rialto and St Marks. If you are in Venice to shop, this hotel is in the middle of all the action. We checked in at 3.15 PM with a generally rude front desk attendant. We were given a room with two beds. We had booked a room with one bed. Overall very inconsiderate front desk staff trying to get this issue resolved. One of the two mattresses was really worn.

Reviews.Title: “STOP LOOKING, YOU'VE FOUND THE PERFECT PLACE!"”
Reviews.Author: DIZZYDOLLYDAYDREAM
Reviews.Content: Like you probably, I trawled the tripadviser & lastminute.com websites looking for that perfect hotel. This one will not disappoint. It has been fully renovated very recently, and our room was lovely & spotlessly clean, with fab toiletries. I am very picky too. We booked a luxury double with canal view. The room was no bigger than a standard modern hotel room in England, but the decor had a luxury feel, small but perfectly formed, with lots of lovely mirrors giving a airy feel. We were above the hotel private docking station(room 411), and it was great fun watching the Gondolers, private taxis and general boats going up and down. I didn't find it noisy at all, just fascinating. The breakfast was fine, fresh fruit, cereals, ham, cheese bread, pastries, cakes & yogurts. The public spaces are wonderful (check out the loos near the reading area/restaurant) The staff were very polite, and helpful. WE used the luggage room on our last day, as we didn't need to leave until 5pm, very easy, and all free. We flew into Marco Polo Airport, then took the water bus, (all sign posted, turn left as you leave the baggage hall, and the ticket office is just there inside) NOT water taxi, to st marks square (San Marco) we arrived at 11.30pm. It took 1hr 20, but felt much shorter, and it was very magical & relaxing arriving at that time . It cost 13 Euro per person. They go every hour at night. The private water taxis are about 100 Euro i think, but they look fantastic, very james bond, if you can afford it, i should think its brilliant. The hotel is 5 mins from there. How to find it? Easy when you know how! I got very anxious about all this before i went, i did my research and asked the questions and it was so simple in the end, so let me share it with you. When you get off the water bus (alilaguna lines is the official operator) take a left over the bridges, here you can take in 'The Bridge of Sighs' then you can't miss st marks square (san Marco) as you walk in you will see the campomile on your left (huge bell tower) and St Marks Basillaca on your right, walk straight ahead to the end, can you see 'American Snack bar'? (the water should be behind you) take that street, walk right to the top (2 mins), see the farrari shop? take the street to the right of it, this is technically an alley i suppose, but most importantly, it is flat, with no steps or bridges and if you have your luggage, thats important. You will come to the canal at the end, and either side is the hotel . On the right should be reception. Easy! Ask for a map when you check in too (there free). I found Venice very safe at night, and we walked all over. San marco is heaving with day trippers, so doing the sights there is best at around 4.30 when the q's have eased. Does it smell????? NO! it was 80 degrees when we were there, and it didn't smell or flood. You get the odd smell of a drain, but no more than any other hot country. We went for my 40th birthday without our children, and it was just the most amazing place. It was full of really nice people just like you and me, adoring the the spendour and uniqueness of the place. We were there for 3 full days. Yes, the food is expensive, and on balance, you probably wont go far wrong eating in the hotel, we didn't. Bottles of wine are probably a better bet than a glass, as the measures are very small and are about 4 euro a glass. Oh, i forgo to say, the location is excellent, its the kind of place you would walk past and say, "oh, i wish we had stayed there". Also, when we booked it with lastminute.com, on check out, it said they were painting the facade this summer, they are not, it was all done last year, so don't panic.! If you don't book this place, be carefull about booking on the Grande Canal, especially around rialto or san marco as these places are very noisy day & night. Rialto is good and buzzy on a night for bars etc. though. Enjoy, if you want to ask any questions please email me at lisa@thechapman.plus.com. I'm more than happy help if i can.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie04
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a jewel in the middle of Venice~ loved every part of it~ was very modern & clean. Rooms were perfect & the restroom very luxurious~ the morning staff for breakfast were so accomodating. One worker (female) hustled so much to make sure nothing was sitting out for to long and would refresh platters every couple of minutes. Wish I had gotten her name to thank her~ The hotel was in between Rialto Bridge & St.Marks Square~ was a bit hard to find in the beginning, but once we realized that the Cartier store was our focal point. It was smooth sailing going to and from our hotel daily~ If we were to return to Venice, we would stay here once again~ our stay in Venice was amazing and having stayed at the Splendid Hotel topped off a great holiday~

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: SteveCE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really ideally situated at a short distance from the piazza San Marco and next to a cute canal and bridge. The rooms are not very big but still very charming. The restaurant is also nice in a patio with a glass roof. While you can get easily lost in Venice, the hotel is quite easy to find (get off the metro-boat at Rialto, continue straight down on Mazzinini and you'll get there.). A bit expensive for my taste but then again that can be expected in a city like Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: diane2000
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, that doesn't have the hefty price tag. The rooms were well lit, very clean, bed was very comfortable, bathroom was big and the furnishings luxurious. The reception was not very grand but the rooms more than made up for it. Fantastic location just around the corner from St Mark's Square. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location comfortable beds and pillows.”
Reviews.Author: SSTripsNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The beds very comfortable, and included a pillow menu. The location is very close to San Marco, with water taxi access. The breakfast, which was included, is a full breakfast, including Eggs, bacon etc, definitely more that what I would expect in Venice. The price we paid was also extremely reasonable for this exceptional hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: happybagger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the hotel at 5.30pm to be told that our room was not ready and we would have to wait 10 minutes. My protests at the delay fell on deaf ears, the two reception staff were not at all concerned that we would have to wait and just kept shrugging their shoulders. After a 30 minute wait and having watched other guests book in at the reception and shown to their rooms I again voiced my dissatisfaction at the delay. This time we were shown to our room. We were not given any information at the reception, ie, breakfast time, location of dining room ect this was left to porter who showed us to our room. I felt that the reception staff were toatlly unhelpful and rude. Our room was small but clean and suited our needs. The breakfast at the hotel was at best mediocre. The best thing about this hotel is the location, exactly halfway between the Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. Getting around Vemnice is simple, walk or get the Waterbus. We spent a lot of time exploring all the streets of Venice and thoughly ejoyed it. I would recommend spending a day in Verona, home of Romeo and Juliet ( a 2 hour train ride away , at 6.15 euros, a bargain), leave early and make a full day of it. Overall a great long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TarioShimachan
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two other families with young children for two nights. We chose this hotel over Daniel and confirmed we did a right selection --- tidy, good hospitality, great interior (the lamp shade and curtain they use were famous for bags and accessories sold in Venice and Milan), and good location. We also enjoyed breakfast with good coffee, a variety of pastries & cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Rest”
Reviews.Author: Radio105
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an incredible 2 weeks in Italy. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in hot, crowded, stuffy and awesome Venice. The hotel is perfectly located close to the vaporetto, Rialto Bridge and St. Marco. The reception staff was very helpful and helped us find great restaurants every night. The hotel is elegant, bright and modern. The rooms were large, crisp and a great oasis in the middle of Venice's hectic pace. A perfect choice. Breakfast was the closest we saw to what we are used to in North America. All and all the perfect choice. CON. The hotel charges every 15 or 30 minutes of Internet access. There is only 1 PC that is shared by all. I had to continually buy additional credits. Each time, you have to go to the front desk, wait in line and get a new password. The only positive was that the receptionist actually delivered new minutes to me at the workstation, so I would not lose my place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: KWhis
Reviews.Content: The pluses for this hotel are: great breakfast, it has A/C, it's modern, and has a great location. The minuses are: our room was so tiny the queen size bed filled the whole room and the bathroom, although big, smelled of sewage. Don't trust the front desk for restaurant recommendations. They send you to restaurants that help pay for the map they provide, so they are totally biased.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, immaculate, professional and extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Bitabix
Reviews.Content: Not five minutes from the Piazza San Marco, the Splendid is internally modern and an excellent base for exploring the island. We tended to have breakfast, explore, back for siesta, then out and about again. The hotel gives pure relaxation. My wife had stayed here before, but the hotel has since refurbished. The rooms were immaculate, with ours overlooking the canal at the front of the hotel. Breakfast is hardly continental...there was so much choice, and my word, did the staff work hard! The restaurant menu was excellent and the head waiter was all too willing to suggest othe restaurants for evening meals guaranteed not to issue any frozen products if not in season or unavailable from the market! Would certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very comfortable, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: modelshop
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beyond our expectations, fantastic value for money. Rooms are very stylish and clean.The bed was really comfortable and there was a menu for the type of pillows you wanted! Staff are very helpful, the position is great very close to St marks square. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Jadam1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really beautiful. T Even with our cases, it took only 5 minutes to walk from St Mark's Square, and probably about 3 minutes to Rialto Bridge, so it is about as central a location as one could hope for. The rooms were beautifully decorated and immaculately clean. Our room was a little smaller than one might anticipate looking at the hotel's own photos, but not a surprise due to other reviews on here. The room was still fine. Our room had only one window, but that looked along the length of a quiet canal, which we preferred to looking directly over a building opposite. The bar was very plush (and expensive) and the dining rooms were lovely and bright for breakfast, and twinkly in the evening. The main entrance to the hotel can be reached by foot at the side, or by boat on the canal. In the evenings it is lovely to linger outside, overlooking the canal, which is still and silent apart from the occasional passing gondola, though there is no seating area, despite there being a small veranda. I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, great service”
Reviews.Author: kwaCanada
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. The location couldn't have been better...easy to find. Had used the directional tips of other reviews to find the hotel, much better than following street signs. Took vaparetto to San Marco stop. Walk through/under clock tower and keep going straight until you reach the Ferrari store. Turn right. Turn left at Cartier store. Go straight. You will see Timberland store straight ahead, the hotel is on the left just before it. Much closer than I thought to both the square and Rialto Bridge. Room was spacious, we asked for a canal room and were upgraded. Staff in breakfast room were extremely attentive. Really nice public areas in the hotel. Took advantage of the free trip over to Murano that they offered. They take you over in water taxi, and you come back on your own...was worth the visit to see the glass, no pressure to buy anything... If I ever return to Venice, this is where I'll stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - value for money, excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: theoracle28
Reviews.Content: First trip to Venice with wife and young daughter. We booked this hotel based on the good reviews listed on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located within a couple of minutes walk from the square. On checking-in, we were upgraded to a much bigger room. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Although the breakfast spread was simple (bacon, eggs, cakes, cereals, croissants, fruits), they were sufficient to keep you filled up till lunch. If we were to travel to Venice again, we will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right of the Mark! Location & Value!”
Reviews.Author: rnava1030
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 21-day vacation in Europe. In Italy I stayed at hotels in Rome, Sorento, Florence and Venice, and this was by fat the best hotel we stayed! The rooms are big by European standards. The bathrooms new and clean, which I value most. I booked rooms 214-215 which are only of the teo connectings rooms in the hotel (most European hotels donÂ´t cater to families so if youÂ´re traveling with family check this in advance!)., The hotel location is a gem! CLose enough to St MarkÂ´s but also away enough so the noise and hustle doesnÂ´t bother you. Around the hotels there are many little shops and restaurants so you never tire of window shpping and never go hungry! EVen a McDonaldÂ´s is a few steps away, in case your kids press too much! The hotel has a private dock so the water taxi drop you there without having to drag the baggage through VeniceÂ´s hideous streets! You expect to pay over 60 Euros, but itÂ´s worth it! Breakfast buffet is good and plentiful, just about average for European hotels. Service could be better, especially conciergeÂ´s services, but this is not a 5 star hotel, so I understand. However, at checkin I encounter a grumpy italian guy that was so annoying that I almost call the manager. The ladies in the morning shift werea different story: all smiles and friendliness! An advice for the hotelÂ´s management: stick with the ladies! Regards, R. Nava Venezuela

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: airzeke
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in mid-June. Great central location between Rialto Bridge and San Marco. Staff was exceptional, with special kudos to Marina and Marco. Room was very clean and modern. Large bathroom. Just a wonderful property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: curlymin00
Reviews.Content: I have big expectations from hotels when i travel: spacious, newly renovated, and centrally located. Splendid Venice met all those and more. This hotel was newly renovated- modern decor, and clean with air conditioning. they provided guests with bathrobe and fluffy slippers. The view from outside the window was very nice too. Breakfast was included- a nice variety of foods. The hotel also had a nice restaurant inside, and a nice lounge/ bar. internet was available at the lobby for a fee. walking distance from everything. I highly recommend it here.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the thick of things! Cute rooms, clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: oneluckyperson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, clean and beautifully decorated. It is also right in the thick of things, so there's always plenty of people outside and lots of things explore. It's also very close to the water taxi station and you can definitely walk to the hotel from Rialto. Our room was so pleasant, clean and refreshing. We got the smallest room--and it was small! There's hardly any room for your luggage and we had the hand-carry type luggage. This did not bother us that much because the room was still nice and cute. The bed was so comfortable and the sheets were very soft. The bathroom is also modern and nice. The breakfast was awesome. I would totally recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanineH55
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights in room 111, it was a fantastic room overlooking the canal, we had a window and a balcony which was great for watching the gondaliers passing by. The bedroom was beautifully decorated and the bathroom was in grey marble. I am very, very picky about where I stay and this hotel met all my expectations and more. In fact my only complaint was that there was no toast available for breakfast...yes I know I am being picky!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: damien
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my friend from June 30 -July 4. We had no problem finding the hotel from the Railway station to the Rialto Bridge. Had stayed in Maestre last October but wanted something within walking distance of St. Mark's Square. It was less than 5 minutes away and a little bit longer to the Rialto Bridge. Booked through Expedia.ca and got a very good price of approximately $230 Canadian per night. When we arrived in the morning the room that I had requested was not ready but we were offered another room which was ready. As we had come by overnight train from Paris we were quite tired. This room 370 was a large corner room with 2 big beds .It overlookined the alleyway to the hotel from one window and looked down into the restaurant from the other. it was very clean and peaceful. The bathroom was outstanding all done in Marble. We enjoyed the breakfast as there were 3 cereals, scrambled eggs and ham. Great yogurt, juice, bowels of freshly cut fruit , cold meats, cheese, assorted rolls and cake. The cappucino was great as was the coffee which was brought to you in 2 silver jugs. One with coffee and one with hot milk. Never left hungry. Claudia at the Guest services desk was so helpful. Booked us a Vavaldi concert in a small church in St. Marks square. Also gave us lots of other information. The unexpected highlite of our stay was the Andrea Bocelli concert which was on the night after we arrived. Loved walking around St. Marks square during the day and the evening listening to the music. Took a day trip to Murano and Burano which was a very pleasant boat ride. Lovely litle places to walk around . We had not visited the Doges Palace on our last trip. Do not miss it if you have time. One room is more fantastic that the other.

Reviews.Title: “A truly Splendid Hotel! Excellent service and Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leechino
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for 2 nights after a 12 days cruise to Europe. I'm glad we stayed at this hotel. It is modern and clean. The size of this hotel is considered quite big for Venice standard. The bed was big enough for 2 adults and a small kid. The rooms are exactly the same as shown on their website. Besides the beautiful property, we also loved all the staff there. Claudia at guest service was very attentive and friendly. She helped me with booking taxi and making restaurant reservations. She was very helpful and she always had a smile on her face. We also missed all the staff at the restaurant, especially Emilio. He was excellent with the kids and he made sure we had everything we needed. We had dinner at the restaurant and it was fantastic and price was reasonable. In the morning of our departure, we had to leave at 7:15am. Their breakfast buffet starts at 7am but they let us in at 6:50am so that we can eat before we leave. By the way, breakfast buffet had everything from eggs, bacon to cereal and juices. We also loved their cafe with latte. It was perfect! It's truly a gem and I would definitely recommend this hotel for everyone. Location was excellent as well. Short walk either way to San Marco or Rialto Bridge. I want to go back to Venice just to stay at this wonderful hotel. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “the absolute anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: stavySalonika
Reviews.Content: Although this was not our first time in Venice this hotel made our 20 year wedding anniversary a life time experience.The room the staff the wonderful location just 300 metres from St.Marks square and especially Emilio and his team in the hotel's restaurant made sure we will never forget this really honeymoon like anniversary. Definately book here if you want to celebrate a very special occasion in your life and be sure you will not regret it. Thank you splendid, we will come again.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here, great location, beautiful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Bradie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and could not have chosen better. This being our 2nd time in Venice we wanted something with a great location and not overpriced as many of the hotels are for what you get. The rooms were excellent and looked newly decorated with excellent taste in decor. They are small rooms but ample for the time you spend in them. We were were bag in the middle of everything with 5 min walk to Rialto or St Marks. I would for sure return back to this hotel and reccommend for any length of stay that you give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: quorny
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great 3 night stay at this hotel.We went for the Andrea Bocelli concert in Saint Marks Square.This was our first trip to Venice and in the past our Europe experiences have not been good but this was much better. We arrived very late at night but the receptionist as with all the staff were excellent,I had a few issues with the room and the next morning they were dealt with efficently and quickly.The hotel is in a superb location and our room had a great view of a canal,The room had everything you needed and was very clean ,not massive but big enough,very comfortable bed and quite a spacious bathroom. The only downside that we found was breakfast,it was buffet continental which is fine but the fruit ,cereal and croissants etc..etc.. were really poor so we just ate the rolls and some ham,sufficient but not what you expect for 200 euros a night. Again though the staff were brilliant and really helpful . We normally stay in 5 star hotels around the world and have been very disappointed with european hotels in the past but this one is a real find.I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel was truly a splendid experience”
Reviews.Author: JoanGCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a week and found the experience wonderful. The rooms are small but very comfortable and have all the conveniences in addition to being immaculately clean. The service everywhere was accommodating and immediate. The location is perfect between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square--we took the bus to Venice and the Vaporetto from there to the Rialto stop with our luggage--no problem if one travels reasonably light. We had dinner at the hotel the last night and it was wonderful--delicious! I would love to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, romantic and great location”
Reviews.Author: AlexCLondon1
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for a second anniversary (and subsequently were engaged here!) and found the location to be fantastic for walking around all the sites of Venice, and after trawling through about 50 centrally located hotels, this was the best value for the service and standard offered. Stylish rooms, with canal views...we had all the church bells ringing in through our open windows! nice polished wood floors, smart bathrooms, very very comfortable beds and funky breakfast room with wicker chairs, atrium, copper piping and great food. Smart little cocktail bar downstairs and staff very accommodating with bottle openers, champagne flutes etc. Great location to wander out to St Marks and further afield. We enjoyed our stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PortugalElsa
Reviews.Content: I have been in Veneza for my husband birthday , and we stayed at this wonderfull hotel .. good location excelente rooms i will defnatly return ..

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice!”
Reviews.Author: selhor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect position in Venice, half way between the Rialto and San Marco. It was excellent in every way, Superbly appointed and decorated rooms, comfortable public rooms excellent breakfast and obliging and friendly service from all staff. The hotel is excellent value The only problem in Venice is the cost of transport. 95 euro from the airport is ludicrously expensive. I would recommend taking the water bus to the Rialto but if you have heavy bags, phone the hotel from the airport and they will arrange a porter to meet you off the bus as every bridge has steps up and down.

Reviews.Title: “perfect anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: gonegrey
Reviews.Content: Great location between San Marco and Rialto. Superior room was first class, good size with great fittings. Very nice en suite wetroom. Front desk offered excellent suggestions for places to visit - and when. Very helpful staff. Breakfast was good, in sunny restaurant with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Ciao bella Venezia”
Reviews.Author: mangamgusa
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to our expectations. On arrival by water taxi from Marco Polo (expensive but the only way for first timers!), we asked for a room upgrade and immediately got canal view rooms with marble bathrooms. Staff were polite and attentive and the only picky reason reception get 4 stars rather than 5 is because they 'confirmed' a restaurant booking which was non existent when we got there. Irritating but nothing a bottle of prosecco couldn't fix! The hotel's position is just off the main drag between St Marks and the Rialto so there is a payoff between convenience and crowds. However it was so easy to find quieter routes to and from the hotel. The breakfast buffet was all you needed to start the day, served in the glassed over hotel courtyard. Venice is so amazing if you venture away form the crowds. Get a book of walks and go to Castello/Arsenale, Dorsoduro (student quarter) and Cannaregio (old Jewish ghetto area). Eating in these parts is so much cheaper and more relaxed. Personally, I'd give Murano a miss with its heaving masses of tourist parties and endless pile it high rip-off shops - you can get better glass bargains in Venice anyway. I'd rather spend more time exploring Burano and Torcello. Yes Venice is expensive and it's hard to find a bargain but if you are going there for cheap you are missing the point. We agreed not to keep converting to Â£s and enjoyed ourselves far more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MiriamLisa
Reviews.Content: From before I even booked this hotel the customer service was outstanding. I needed to add an additional night to our stay after booking and the hotel was booked solid for the additional night I needed. The manager assured me that everything would work out, he just needed a week to handle it. True to his word we were able to book the additional night and for the same price of our other nights. When we arrived we were immediately told of our upgraded room. The hotel is in a perfect location and is very luxurious inside. Everything was spotless and truly an outstanding stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: Yolcular
Reviews.Content: LOVED IT! It was in the perfect location between the Rialto and San Marco. We arrived in Venice late and were a little worried about if we would be able to find the hotel. We took the Vaporetto to the Rialto stop and start walking down the most lit path and there it was! The lobby was very pretty and seemed to be a popular place for guests to hang out at night. Breakfast was served in a covered courtyard with a spread of pastries, rolls, cereal, fruit, and hot items like eggs and bacon. The room was beautiful (see pictures) complete with a huge bathroom and big walk in shower. We fell in love in Venice with everything including the hotel and will always stay there if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - you'll won't find better for the price”
Reviews.Author: MPB_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely Hotel, great position (about 5 minutes from San Marco) and very picturesque frontage. Very nice decor and the interior of the room is very nice. Spotlessly clean and very quiet. The breakfast is adequate (cereals, fruit, pastries, bread) if not quite what we are used to in the UK. I loved the place and will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel like it's name is truly splendid”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy08
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel, we stayed in room 202, which overlooked the small street below, we did'nt find it noisy at all, we did'nt book a canal view room as we would be seeing canals all day. The room was lovely, clean linen and toiltries replaced everyday, the breakfasts were excellent (hot & cold food) as much as you wanted. The location is less than 5 mins. walking distance between St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge, we were there for 4 days and used the waterbuses for 2 days, it was really good weather, we did'nt bother using a map, just wandered around, got lost a few times but discovered some wonderful places. Take plenty of money as food, drink and travel are expensive, but well worth it, also if you'r prone to mosquito bites make sure to take some repellant.

Reviews.Title: “Simply great”
Reviews.Author: katbuzio
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain: great location, great confy and new remodeled room, great staff, very good breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Suezq01
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, but most of the rooms are tiny. Our first room was so small that we could not walk between the foot of the bed and the vanity. After we complained we were moved to a much larger room. The hotel staff were very friendly, but the resturant service was lacking from the waiters to the food were both under par. The location was perfect and made it easy for us to find our way through the streets and alleys of Venice. While we were there the hotel was being renovated, but that did not interfere with our stay. The pictures displayed are accurate, but somewhat deceiving as to room size. All in all the stay was average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean bright rooms - but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Myff
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in mid April 2009. The location was great, the rooms clean and well presented. Staff considerate and friendly. Unfortunately sleep was not possible until quite late on all of the nights we were there. The windows of our room overlooked the restaurant which has a perspex roof to give an outdoor feel. And every night there is a very bad piano player who "plays" through until after midnight so loudly and badly that hearing the television was impossible and sleep not an option until after the piano stopped. Would recommend this one only with a very careful choice of room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Fantastic Break”
Reviews.Author: RachelAndSim0n
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked us a stay at this hotel as my birthday gift (my birthday was in February) and we were looking forward to it since then. It was certainly worth looking forward to - the hotel was really lovely and we had a fantastic stay in Venice. We found the hotel easily after printing off directions from kind people on here and then once we found it the first time, it was very easy from there. The location was perfect and only minutes from everywhere we wanted to visit. On arrival check in was very efficient and staff very friendly. We were shown to our room which was lovely and couldn't be faulted. The bathroom was really nice and the products they supply smelt gorgeous! The first night we came back to the hotel bar after dinner and the service was great and we enjoyed a couple of Bellini's looking out to the water. The hotel is almost fully surrounded by waterways and boats pull up right outside. Watch out for the luggage delivery by boat - quite surreal to see! Breakfast each morning was good - we always got shown to a table and the selection of food was varied and drinks service to the table was very efficient. We really enjoyed our stay here and if we were to return to Venice we would definately consider staying here again. We were very sad to leave. Would definately recommend a visit to the Doge's Palace, a trip up the tower in St Marks Square (the views are great) and a Bellini in Harrys Bar (quite expensive but worth it for the experience and to taste the original Bellini which is yummy!) Enjoy your trip - we certainly did. x

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, Horrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: paulc22
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite for 3 nights and for 3 nights we got hardly any sleep due to the noise from the street below our room which is on the main thoroughfare from the Rialto bridge to St Marks square. Total bedlam until after 2am On two evenings in succession we sat in the bar for a long time, probably 15 mts with no one serving, no bar staff and no waiters. When a barman eventually appeared he totally ignored us and the others who were waiting, and instead served someone else. This happened the next night and I complained to him and the reception but was treated with total distain. The breakfast on all 3 mornings was awful. Tea was brought, eventually, as a metal jug with hot water and we had to ask twice for english breakfast teabags. They did not seem to understand that tea requires milk and there were no milk jugs so we had to pour milk into a separate tea cup to take to our table. There was a poor choice of cereals with only full fat milk available. The pastries were dry and rubbery and the scrambled egg and streaky bacon looked and tasted like nothing I have ever been served before, and appeared to have been under the domed heated container for an eternity. We had issues with the TV service where we paid 9.90 daily for news channels, but sky news would not work and the feature film we wanted to watch, one evening, cost 15.50 euros but the sound would not work properly. When I complained at checkout they refused to cancel these charges, kept me waiting while they consulted someone in the back office and said I should have stopped watching before 3 minutes had expired otherwise the charges stood. I got the distinct impression they were being akward due to the complaint I had made about the no one being in the bar the previous evening. For 1,650 euros for 3 nights we had expected a much better service and some decent food at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Anniversary Break”
Reviews.Author: rolo50
Reviews.Content: This was our very first time in Venice. We had talked about visiting for a long time. It is our 30th Wedding Anniversary, so we decided to splash out and treat ourselves. We were certainly not disappointed! Everything was wonderful. When we finally found the hotel (yes it's tricky), we had been upgraded to a superior room with canal view and small balcony. We could hear people talking in the gondalas as they passed by our room... We both slept really well, the pillows were amazing. Breakfast was served in a very light airy room with a glass roof, giving you a sense of eating al fresco. It was excellent, and the staff were very attentive. On our last evening (we stayed for 3 nights), we decided to eat in the restaurant. It was delicious, costing around 100 euros for 2 courses with an excellent bottle of rose! (Worth every penny) A perfect end to a perfect break.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: koberecker
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location between Piazza San Marco and Rialto Bridge. That naturally means that if you have a room towards the main street it's very loud - but ok. Generally the decoration and the design of the hotel is nice, only the breakfast room feels like a trainstation (and the breakfast itself is not great). A lot of the staff at the lobby bar did not speak English at all.

Reviews.Title: “A island in an storming sea”
Reviews.Author: HolidayTriptester2
Reviews.Content: The Starhotels Splendid Venice, is an island in a storming sea. This hotel gives value for money, in Venice. I thought I would never say them words about something in Venice but this is true. I have paid more for hotels in London but I have never paid more for a can of coke than in Venice. A place to return to at the end of the day, and feel relaxed and comfortable. This hotel makes the whole experience of Venice palatable and renews your faith in value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,”
Reviews.Author: Viajero076
Reviews.Content: Minutes walk from Rialto, San Marcos and the Venice airport boat. Rooms are small but comfortable. Nice big window in the restaurant over a small waterway, you have breakfast watching gondolas.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid was average.”
Reviews.Author: FLNOLE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon while in Venice. The room was as pictured on the website, they did not misrepresent themselves in that aspect. Although it is quite a bit smaller that I had imagined based on the photos. It was clean and appointed in an appealing fashion. We had a canal view room which I will never book again! It was unseasonably warm for this time of year and evidently hotels in Venice are not permitted to use the air conditioning in April? Naturally, we opened the window and had a nice breeze coming thru for the evening BUT it was so loud that it was not possible to leave the window open for the duration of the night. I realize this is not the hotels fault, I just wish we had known it would be so noisy on the canal (gandalas, water taxis, foot traffic across the little bridges..). My husband had an issue with the air conditioning not being permitted and the hotel promptly sent up a complimentary bottle of prosecco on ice and a very kind card apologizing for the inconvenience. We thought that was a really classy thing to do. The bed was quite firm and not to our taste. The breakfast was average and felt quite rushed, it was obvious that the manager was trying to "turn" the table as quickly as possible. It was not a horrible experience but on our trip back to Venice we will choose an alternative hotel. It just didn't leave a great impression, although I think the staff did try.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! U must stay here.”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in early april. The room was amazingly clean and very nice. We had just come from Rome and stayed at their starhotel there. The experience in Rome was 1 star compared to this 5 star. The photos that you see on the website are of this Venice hotel. What you see on the site is what you get. The only downside was that the air condition did not work in all the starhotels we stayed in italy. It got very hot at night. In Venice it was nice to open the windows at night and let the breeze in.
