The bad thing about Venice is that everything shuts down about 9pm. There arent any shops open. Most restaurants are closed. We arrived at 11:30pm and it was tough to find the hotel. Luckily, there was a nice guy strolling around who led us in the right direction. There isnt much to do in Venice but we were happy that we had a chance to ride on the gondola and experience that. 1 or 2 days in Venice is enough. We found a great Irish Pub very close to the hotel. Served the best food for lunch and really cheap. We went back for dinner but they dont serve dinner. The Peggy Guggenheim museum is closed on Tuesdays which is the day we were there. They have a great exhibit going on that we didnt get to see. Directions: The only way I know how to get to the hotel. From San marco Square. Find the huge clock. Walk right underneath the clock. This street is full of shops and nothing else. You will get to the Cartier jewelry shop. Stand right in front of it facing it. Take a 5 second break. Then walk to the left of the shop. There will be more shops. Just keep going on this street. You will see in some tops corners that it says per Rialto. Follow it until you get to the steps. At the top of the steps is the hotel to the left. There is a revolving door. Go through it. When you get to the top of the steps you should see a Timberland store directly across from the hotel. The name of the hotel is on the side parallel to the river. It is not above the revolving door as you would think it is. Good luck finding it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: hgry
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Splendid in Venice, this hotel is excellent. We were upgraded upon our arrival to a suite which was fantastic (501). The bedroom was large with a huge bathroom with seperate shower cubicle, a walk in wardrobe/dressing area, then a lounge/office area with sofa and arm chair. The decor is very neuteral and the crisp white linen was changed every day. We had a balcony with a fantastic view of the bell tower in St Marks square. (see pics). We arrived from the airport by water taxi which has to be the best way to arrive in Venice, the taxi dropped us direct to the hotel's landing stage. I think we may have had difficulty finding the hotel with suitcases etc on our first day if we had taken the public vaporetto. (See if you can share a taxi with another couple from the airport as it is around 100 euros for 4 people with cases one way and it would be the same for 2 people) It takes a while to get your bearings in Venice, but this hotel was right in the middle of San Marco. Five minutes to St Marks square and 5 minutes from Rialto bridge. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The waiting staff were very pleasant at breakfast and we ate one evening meal in the restaurant which was good. Everywhere in Venice is expensive though. To sit in St Marks squre at one of the cafes it will cost you 5.70 euros just for the seat before 8.50 euros for a coffee. Mind you it just has to be done!!! listen to the band and watch the world go by. Venice is a one off trip and we loved it but 4-5 days is enough - wear good walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the perfect location of Venice -- This one is a winner.”
Reviews.Author: iluvt0travel08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid Venice for 4 nights in March '09. The hotel has a dock which is perfect for the water taxi. The hotel is very, very nice. I am sure the location is enviable by other hotels. The hotel breakfast buffet is excellent, although not much choice, the essentials are there. Hotel staff very attentive. If I go back to Venice, I am definitely staying here again. Our room was really big for Venice standards and super clean, marble bath, etc. We were actually upgraded without even asking. All in all, this hotel is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of Venice”
Reviews.Author: welltravelledDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on the 20th March for 2 nights. We were a party of 4. All the good reviews we read on your site beforehand lived up to their expectations. The hotel is in an excellent location, the staff were helpful and friendly, the rooms were immaculate and comfortable and the buffet breakfast had a great selection. We would recommend this hotel to all our friends and hope to be back again.

Reviews.Title: “More than we even expected”
Reviews.Author: khalvonik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Splendid for our one year anniversary. The hotel is truly in an excellent location. You can walk anywhere you would want to go in Venice. The room was very spacious and clean, especially for a European hotel. The breakfast was wonderful!! Completely different from any other European breakfasts we have experienced. Everything was so fresh and the staff is constantly moving and working. The bonus of the hotel is the wonderful staff. We were treated exceptionally well by the concierge Claudia. She was there to answer any question we had, and always did it with a smile. The restaurant is excellent and not as overpriced as others have said on tripadvisor. You cannot go wrong selecting this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: CrazyGosling
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I spent 5 days and 4 nights exploring Venice and decided to stay at the Starhotel Splendid based on its central location between the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. We discovered lots of other plus points aside from the location...Firstly, the staff were very friendly, polite and attentive throughout our stay. Our room was luxurious, spotlessly clean and quiet. There was a modern bar and lounge area and a bright spacious dining area. There was a choice of cereals, pastries, breads, bacon, eggs, salami, cheese, fruit and yoghurt for breakfast (a tip for opening the super tight lids on the mini jam jars is to give them a sharp tap on the side of the table first!). Check out on the final day wasn't until midday so there was no rush to pack up. Overall this hotel exceeded my expectations and had a welcoming charm about it. Excellent pillow menu too!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PontefractTrekker
Reviews.Content: My wife & I found this hotel via TripAdvisor and booked it including flights via a third party. We therefore wondered whether it would live up to our expectations. We shouldn't have worried. Our room and bathroom were immaculate. Polished wood effect floor in bedroom & the whole of the bathroom including bath basin were in marble. All public rooms, breakfast room and restaurant were superbly and comfortably furnished. Our room was serviced with fresh towels and it appeared that the bed linen was also changed, whilst we were at breakfast. All reception staff and others were helpful, friendly and most professional. In particular the waitresses & waiters were most attentive. Breakfast was a combination of cereals, fresh and baked fruit, cold meats, croissants, scrambled eggs and bacon. Our birthdays are on the same day and we celebrated them by dining in the hotel restaurant that evening with a super although expensive meal. Otherwise, having listed restaurants recommended in TripAdvisor we found them difficult to find and some disappointing. On arrival at the hotel we were supplied with a map which included information about restaurant - A La Vecia Cavana. We enjoyed an excellent lunch there in traditional surroundings. It was a toss-up whether to return in the evening or eat in the hotel. A good tip is to "Google" Venice to find web sites which provide information of transport arrangements from the airport. We used the ATVO web site for the Airport Express blue bus, printed off their time table and spent 3 euros each for the 20 mins journey to Piazzale Roma terminous. From there we spent 6.5 euros each on the Vaparetto water bus to the Rialto Bridge and walked 5 mins to the hotel. There are alternative ways of doing the journey, depending on your pocket. We would have no hesitation in returning to this fabulous hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, spotless rooms and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: odaglas
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel ideal. It is located half way between the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks and is on an attractive small canal. Reception was efficient and friendly, the room immaculate with an excellent bathroom and clean cotton sheets daily. The room was perhaps overwarm, despite opening windows with outside temperatures of 0-4degrees. The whole hotel was spotless and well decorated. We were too tired from sightseeing to go out in the evening but found the restaurant very good, with friendly and efficient service and appetising food. The restaurant prices were comparable to some of the trattorias we looked at, that is to say quite pricey with a poor exchange rate for the pound sterling, however as the food was of a high standard we did not feel hard done by. Overall we would rate this hotel highly and would stay there again if we returned to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: victory4nelson
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a Birthday surprise weekend for my partner (21st-23rd Feb 09) being in such a fantastic magical city with the added bonus of the Carnival ,The stay at Hotel was the icing on the cake. Although I had read other peoples reviews before going about the location and how to get to the Hotel ,once standing in St Marks square and taking in everything the instructions how to get there went straight over my head however after asking a local policeman he pointed us in the right direction. (take the lane just to the right under the main clock go to the end hang a right you will then have the church St Zulian right in front of you walk a few more steps and you come to a Cartier Jewelery shop on the corner go down the lane and you come to the first little bridge and there is the hotel on your left with a revolving door. The Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and fresh. we were only booked in for Bed and Breakfast which was a buffett and had everything you could want for. We never sampled the Restaurant food in the evening. The lounge/ bar areas were really snug especially the furthur lounge which had two cumfy chairs right by the window and can just sit there watching Gondeliers coming past the window priceless. would definately go back again. Nick in the UK

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: semesterigen
Reviews.Content: We just come back from an extended weekend at the Starhotels Splendid. When you have a good map, and study it carefully before, finding the way is no problem. But you really need a good and detailed map. The situation of the hotel is really right between San Marco and Rialto ...when you walk from Rialto to San Marco ...just following the signs (the signs "per San Marco" , it is the pink hotel on the right side after the first bridge (if you come via San Marco you follow the signs "Per Rialto" (starting by the tower Orologico...) . I calculated the steps from San Marco (starting by the tower "Torre del Orologico" ) it was around 250 steps ...really not far and not even taking 5 minutes when you walk in normal speed. We found the hotel directly and are normally good in getting lost ... The hotel itself is a fresh contrast to everything old (and sometimes very shabby) outside. It is utterly clean, rooms were not big, but also not very small (we had a standardroom on the 5th floor (room 518). Bathroom also nice with the white marble. The beds are comfortable and you can serve yourself coffee or tea if you like. The breakfast was okey although I was missing some type of cheese - there were only one type of ham and a type of salami. Otherwise it was sufficient and service was okey, staff friendly. The staff in general was really friendly and we had no bad experiences. The location is perfect right between San Marco and Rialto. With all the signs showing to these places it is almost impossible really to get lost. You just have to follow either one of the signs and you are never really very far away from the target. Venice is not all that big. Additionally I can really recommend that you buy a card from the local transport-system, which covers all the wterbuses (the vaporettos), which takes you anywhere in Venice in a nice way. YOu can also go to all the nearby islands like Murano, Burano, Lido, Torcello etc., Travelling in Februar you get a sence of the real Venice ...and although even at this time of the year much frequented by tourists, it is nothing in comparizon to the summertime and the overcrowded Venice. At this time you also sence the peace of the city...and get a little bit of a feeling for the venecian life and their people. We would absolutely stay at the Star Hotels Splendid again ... and also going in Februar although we had "agua alta" every day ...we really had a wonderful weekend and our stay at Starhotels Splendid was contributing to this as well ...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - if you can find it!!!”
Reviews.Author: MartandSteph
Reviews.Content: All of the hotels in Venice look the same when you search for them on the internet ,however there was something nicer about this one. It is a wonderful place with beautiful rooms and excellent facilities. It is difficult to find - especially when you are dragging a case around in 37 degree heat. You should stay here when you go to Venice but do your homework on how to find it! One other thing - dont order fruit salad in the restaurant - they had a mix up and brought up a bowl of fruit and a knife complete with creepy crawlies!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: anchmer
Reviews.Content: I agree with a few other reviewers - the location is a bit tricky to find, although the fact that we didn't have a map with street names didn't help! The hotel itself is nice - very clean and nicely decorated. The room was a decent size, although if we didn't close the outside shutters we got a lot of street noise throughout the night. They offer you a menu of special pillows to chose from too, which meant I had a nice firm foam pillow. The breakfast was very nice, as is the hotel bar. The only thing I would really change is that the housekeeping staff were a bit eager - on the first morning of our two night stay they tried to clean the room while we were at breakfast at 9am, so when we returned to the room to gather our things it was a bit of a mess because the housekeeper had to stop halfway through the process to return later. And on the second morning the guests in the room next store checked out early, so they were running the vacuum and moving furniture around by 8:15am cleaning the room. (Which we could hear.)

Reviews.Title: “A Seemingly Lesser Known Gem”
Reviews.Author: Waban_Jane
Reviews.Content: When I was researching hotels in Venice, I was concerned that we wouldn't be pleased with the selection once we got there. So many hotels were extraordinarily expensive, had uneven reviews, really small rooms and all kinds of other negative comments, so I was worried. For this particular hotel it seemed that it had been acquired recently and (we hoped) that the negative reviews were for the old establishment before the Starhotels acquisition. It turned out that we really enjoyed staying there! Not ultra luxury, but very luxurious. Great, comfy beds. Our rooms were surprisingly spacious and nicely decorated, sort of a contemporary urban chic. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean. Location was excellent, a short walk to everywhere but yet not noisy. Breakfast was included and was good quality. Not a huge selection but good food and service. The rooms filled at peak time but we never had a problem getting a table. The lobby is tiny tiny and sort of cut in two but there is a neat sitting area that is like a living room where we hung out occasionally. All in all we really enjoyed our stay there and have no negative comments!

Reviews.Title: “Room 511 is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: jgpenny26
Reviews.Content: We traveled through Globus for a tour of Italy and stayed in several hotels within the Starhotel chain - this one was by far the best! The location is perfect(along a canal, a 5 min walk to St.Mark's square or to the Rialto Bridge), the hotel decor was very nice, and the rooms were tastefully decorated! We stayed in Room 511(top floor), and had a balcony! I think there are only a few rooms with balconies...the room was spacious, they had an in-room coffee maker, a tv in the BATHROOM(we didn't use it though), and did I mention there was a balcony? Our balcony overlooked a part of the canal, and we could see the tower in the Square. All in all a great hotel. The breakfast wasn't bad either(ours was included in the tour)...they served scrambled eggs, different meats and cheeses, fresh fruit and pastries, yogurt, or cereal...and the coffee was great! I would definitely recommend this hotel, my sister stayed in Room 504 which was HUGE but no balcony. Room 514 was tiny(parents stayed in there), wouldn't recommend that one.

Reviews.Title: “Had to write!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbigjim
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice and had to write. I used Tripadvisor prior to booking rooms in Italy and was rewarded with great rooms. The best of 5 cities was the Hotel Splendid Venice. Everyone from the front desk staff to the bellhops were friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and well decorated. Our room included a sofa and chair. I was impressed that the internet point included a 110 volt outlet, no converter needed. The bathroom was complete with marble and a small TV. We did look over a canal, but it was too small to include a gondolier. The included buffet breakfast was pretty much standard fare for Italy, including eggs, bacon,salami,yogurt and pastries. The staff again were excellent. The location is perfect for tourists, located betwenn St Marks and Rialto Bridge. It is an easy 10 min walk from the waterbus with no bridges. We will return to Venice and to the Hotel Splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KenBarry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Splendid for three nights, 09 Sept - 13 Sept, couldn't have had a better room overlooking the canal. The wait staff at breakfast was exceptional, anything you could have wanted they were willing to get for you. Excellent coffee also!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_p81
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i stayed here for 2 nights last weekend and has a wonderful time. The relaxed atmosphere makes you feel at ease, our room was very nice, clean and modern. The food was excellent we had loved the restaurant so much we ate in there for both nights of our stay. Th staff are fantastic and could not have been more helpful. Th hotel is halfway between st marks square and thr rialto bridge and so is perfectlu located for sight seeing. I could not recommend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Venice it is!!”
Reviews.Author: grannyCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Venice - hopefully not our last! My husband and I loved the Splendid Venice. The ambience, food, decor all wonderful. Our room - large and beautifully appointed, as was the marble bathroom - overlooked the canal and it was magical to look out and see gondalas slipping past!! Situation of the hotel perfect. Would unhesitatingly recommend this hotel and hope to revisit. We are fussy travellers and this hotel more than met our expectations! On check in we mentioned we were celebrating a wedding anniversary; sparkling Prosecco was delivered to our room within minutes - that's service!! Alison, Cape Town, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KKL1
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in a great location. Five minutes walk from both St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. Wonderful to be able to arrive right at the front door in a water taxi. Stayed in a deluxe room which was very spacious. Very nice marble bathroom. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our rate included breakfast which was very nice - selection of fruit, cereals, pastries and eggs and bacon. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel by name, splendid by experience”
Reviews.Author: holidayqueenadelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the splendid hotel for 3 nights. The rooms are very modern and clean and spacious (we booked a deluxe canal view) the view was a pretty canal. The staff spoke english and went over and above to make our stay a pleasant one they booked us into restaurants and made tour reservations. The location is 5 mins from San Marco Square and 5 mins to Rialto, with lots of places to eat just steps away from the hotel. I would stay here again if I came back to Venice and wouldnt hesitate in recommending it to my friends. The breakfast was good and had the usual things you would find at a buffet. Great hotel and great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Splendid”
Reviews.Author: krislecl
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked a different hotel in Venice for our short two night stay on the last leg of our honeymoon but after reading all the great things on Trip Advisor about the Splendid I decided to switch hotels. We ended up paying a lot less money and had a wonderful experience. The location of the hotel is perfect for a first time visit to Venice. It was located between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco square. There were tons of restaurants, shops, etc right where the hotel was. Check in was fast and easy. We were pleasantly surprised when we were shown to our room that they had given us a room with a balcony over one of the canals. The room was modern but beautiful. Hardwood floors, nice color combinations and clean. The bed was the most comfortable we slept in while in Italy. The bathroom was small but all marble and clean. There was a flat screen television and plenty of space, which I was surprised about (I figured Venice would have very small hotel rooms). Everything in the room seemed new. The service was great. They sent us a bottle of prosecco and a nice card our first night to congratulate us on our honeymoon. Breakfast was included in our rate and was very good. The croissants were SO delicious! We ate dinner one night at the hotel and it was pretty good. Overall we had a great experience at the Splendid. I would not hesitate to book here again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: ChloeAthens
Reviews.Content: Starhotels Splendid is an exquisitely decorated hotel throughout, where a lot of attention has been paid to every single little detail. It is just behind St Marks square, making it close to everything. We stayed in a 'deluxe room, canal view'. The room and bathroom were luxurious, although small and low ceilinged, it so beautifully designed and thought out, you barely notice. The hotel restaurant is excellent, and affordable, and probably one of the best places in the city to eat. The breakfast room was very elegant, although more could have been on offer at breakfast. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KB24Cambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother on a recent trip to Venice, and overall we were very pleased with the hotel. The room was immaculate, and amazingly, looked quite like the pictures on the hotel website. Beautiful crisp, clean decor, stylish and modern if the typical Venetian OTT style isn't really your thing. We had booked a superior twin room, which had a view of a canal. The only downside was that this happened to be near where the bottles and crates were loaded outside the hotel between 7-8am each morning. This didn't bother us too much as we were up around that time anyway, but might be a problem if you really want to sleep in. Not that you'd get much chance with all the church bells ringing, but hey, it's Venice. We caught a glance at what we assume was a standard room which had the same style, but was smaller and looked onto the courtyard in the middle of the hotel. Breakfast offered a good selection of cereals, pastries and more continental cold meats/cheeses. Very tasty. The hotel is a little tucked away, and about halfway between St Mark's square and the Rialto bridge. We found it easiest to head from the passage to the left of St Mark's (if you're facing it) under the clock and keep walking until you see the Ferrari shop and there's a little passage way down to the hotel (it's marked by a little sign on the floor), or there's a street that runs parallel to the passage a bit further down. It was a little tricky to find at first, but we managed fine. The lobby, somewhat confusingly, is in a separate building to the right of the main hotel if you're facing the canal. Overall we really liked this hotel, and if you're prepared to pay the extra to stay on the main island, it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah005
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a holiday in Venice where we stayed at the Starhotel Splendid Hotel and we thought this hotel was wonderful. It was my 2nd time to Venice so I knew I wanted to be in a good location and this was perfect. A short distance to the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square and a lovely area to wander around in the evenings. The hotel was modern and clean and the facilities and staff were all excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. The rooms are not enormous, but I dont think any are in Venice, however the rooms offer a little bit of luxury at a very affordable price. Only thing to remember is if you are taking the Alilaguna from the airport, you will need to disembark at St Marks Square and walk for about 5-10 minutes. Although the walk is short it is extremely busy - but that cant be helped. Great hotel bar too!

Reviews.Title: “Starhotels Splendid - Welcoming and Professional”
Reviews.Author: Blougram
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid for a long weekend in July with our two teenage sons. Our rooms were spacious (especially their twin, which had a canal view) and very well equipped. The beds were especially comfortable. Everything was spotlessly clean and fresh towels were provided daily. Breakfasts were a huge buffet - a choice that included cooked meats, eggs, rolls, croissants, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, pies and tarts. All the staff were professional, friendly and welcoming, and all spoke English. The whole place had the feel of being well run, with attention to detail. We chose it for the central location - between St Mark's and the Rialto - but even so, it was beautifully quiet at night. The air conditioning was silent and effective as well. We'd recommend it unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: missmissypie
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I spent three nights at Starhotels Splendid Venice the beginning of July 2008 and highly recommend it. First of all, pre-communication with Angelica was very helpful. She made our stay special with an upgraded room with a canal view. It was our anniversary and we were greeted with snacks and a cold bottle of Champagne. Perfect! The location could not be more perfect. You're located very close to St Mark's Square in one direction and the Rialto Bridge in the other direction. Our room was modern; linens were high quality with a selection of pillows; breakfast was good; etc. We didn't use the hotel to book any tours like the gondola because their rates were high. We loved the little restaurant right next to the hotel (even though the hotel doesn't "work" with them or recommend them). I had the best calamari here with a lovely canal window table. The wait staff borders on being rude at times, so don't expect to be greeted warmly, but do expect a good meal at a decent price with what may be the most quaint canal view in all of Venice. I believe the name of the restaurant is La Sempiore. You can't miss it.....go outside the main lobby to the bridge and it's right there with the flower boxes. You can sit and watch the gondolas float by. We did ride a gondola from this location, but I wouldn't do that again. It was overpriced compared to other locations/times we've taken gondola rides. But, you're in a gondola in Venice......hard to top that! To arrive to the hotel we took the Alilaguna from Marco Polo airport to San Marco square. We made our way through the masses of tourists under the clock tower. When you run into the Ferrari store, you turn right, then an immediate left. You'll think you're lost, but you're not. You go down an alley that turns left then right. You'll see no signs down the alley, but at the end of the alley if you enter the doors in the building on the right side, that is the check-in area. Then, the doors across the alley in the other building are where you enter the hotel lobby. You'll soon learn other ways around the alley's and discover great shopping on the next street over (just walk thru the hotel check-in area and out the other door) and turn right for everything from Cartier to Perle my fave shop to string your own Murano jewlery. If you turn left and go over the bridge you'll find more shopping along the way to the Rialto. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. We've stayed on the Grand Canal, but I much preferred this more intimate setting in the heart of Venice. I've read old reviews about renovations and I didn't see anything going on and believe the entire hotel has now been renovated and it's lovely. Perfecto!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Alison014
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! We stayed for one night on June 13th, and really enjoyed our stay. The location is fantastic, 5 minutes one way to the Rialto Bridge and 5 minutes the other way to San Marco Square. Previous reviews have mentioned that it was hard to find, so I had the hotel email me directions, and we found it straight away, so here they are, hopefully it helps: "Take the number 2 boat from the train station to Rialto Bridge. From here follow the main street called Mercerie which leads to San Marco Square. When you come to the first bridge (called Batteri), the hotel entrance is to your right." The room was not quite ready when we arrived, so we left our luggage there and the front desk suggested a good restaurant for lunch. They had the best lasagna! Not sure what it was called, but if you keep walking past the hotel, when you get the the Cartier, turn left, and between the Cartier store and the church is the restaurant. We would highly recommend it! When we returned to the hotel, our room was ready. The room was lovely. It was spacious, with a kIng size bed, a desk, two sitting chairs and a kettle to make coffee. There was also a minibar. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and had a small television. The breakfast at the hotel was great, the best hotel breakfast of our entire trip. There was cereal, pastries, fruit, juice, yogurt, meats, and the best coffee! We were very pleased. All in all, we loved this hotel. The value was incredibly good compared to other Venice hotels. I think the rates were lower because they were under renovation, but this did not impact our trip at all. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but caters to tour groups”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyj
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms. My negative comments would be that I felt that the hotel could have been a little more efficient. One of our rooms had a taped broken mirror in the entry. My suite's hair dryer and coffee pot didn't work, nor was there bedding on our pull out sofa. Rooms here run rather expensive, so I expected a little more attention to detail. We had several tour groups staying there when we arrived. However, I loved the location and enjoyed my room and free breakfast even with these minor inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: jeffeardley
Reviews.Content: Internal renovations seem to be complete at the Splendid and although the exterior is being re-furbished, this doesn't spoil anything. We booked a de-luxe canal view room which was spacious and spotlessly clean, overlooking a small canal popular with gondoliers (sometimes singing!) Decor is modern and bright with laminated flooring, bathroom was white marble and lovely. Tea and coffee making inclusive as is the safe and the white fluffy slippers. Normal rip-off mini-bar. Hotel is situated on a busy thoroughfare between San Marco and Rialto but is an oasis of calm inside. Staff friendly, breakfast adequate once you've found everything. (Staff will make you a cappucino if you ask them nicely!) Best places for survival items (bottled water, cheap sparkling wine etc.) are beyond the Coin department store heading for the station (Ferrovia) There is a supermarket up here about 10 mins from the hotel. No need to use water taxis from the airport as the Alilaguna Arancio (Orange line) will, for 12 euros, deposit you at Rialto. Off boat, turn left, over canal, first right, follow signs for San marco (If both ways go right) , at next canal crossing, hotel is on the right. The Splendid is a wonderful, clean hotel in an excellent location to explore this lovely city. Book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: warwick7404
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled through Italy from top to bottom. We did not find another hotel that equalled the Splendid. Everything about the hotel was perfect. The staff are very friendly and helpfull. The room we stayed in (369) had a great veiw of the canal and of the roof top of St Marks. If you throw a stone across the roof tops you would probably hit St Marks. Thats how close you are. The room itself was perfect.. the bed and pillows the most comfortable in Italy. Each day the staff would place a chocolate (Baci) on the bedside table which was a nice surprise. Breakfast to was the best experianced in Italy. Not only do you have the normal "continental breakfast" but also ham, cheese, eggs, salami, bacon and the quality of food was the best experianced. The location to was perfect. 5 min walk even through the crowds to St Marks and 8 mins to Rialto. I would reccommend this hotel to everybody

Reviews.Title: “Fab, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wimbledongirl
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip to Italy, where we stayed at Starhotels Splendid for a few nights in Venice. For us the location was key -- as I have a bad knee and this place was perfect. Really, really close to St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge (which was the closest vaparetto stop). I booked our stay thru one of the hotel websites associated with Tripadvisor, and at 180 Euros per night it was a bargain for Venice (especially taking into account the location and quality of the hotel). The inside of the hotel is very beautiful, with an air that exudes elegance and flair. Nice seating areas on the ground floor, with cushy areas to be seated. Our room was perfect -- graciously appointed -- fabulous bed with very good sheets and a selection of several different types of pillows (if you didn't like the ones on the bed you could order a different type). Marble bathroom, which also had a small TV !! My daughter loved it !! I am still giving the hotel an excellent rating -- but the only downside was that the poor people at the front desk had to deal with absolutely all enquires. This meant that when we were checking in ,during the afternoon and there were at least 15 other people checking in at the same time, the front desk would get a call from someone in a room requesting how to hook up their internet and they would have to take time out to deal with this. I think they are slightly understaffed in this area. But to be fair, I requested a different type of pillow (calling the front desk of course) and it was delivered to my room within 10 minutes. Also, there is plenty of wait staff in the breakfast room during the breakfast (which is included with your room price). As others have mentioned -- great breakfast. Always remember in Italy that when you have an included breakfast you can also get a cappacino. I'm always used to England where only reg coffee or tea is available. In Italy, it seems that all the various Italian coffees are available in the included breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ruch08
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for 2 days so location was key... This hotel is literally 2 blocks away from St. Mark's Square, the various vaporetto stops, and the street shopping. Once we had dragged our luggage from the vaporetto stop to the hotel, which was a trek given the amount of luggage we had (Ladies, please pack light for Venice), the hotel was just sweet!!!! Our check-in time was 2 PM but we arrived at 10.30AM and our room was ready for us (at no extra cost or hassle). The staff was very very helpful, they guided us towards good restaurants, although one ended up being out of our range - good nonetheless. The room was just right for the 2 of us and the bathroom was modern and very well equipped. Those of you staying here please don't pull on the string hanging next to the shower head in the bathroom - that is only to be used in case of an emergency - I learnt the wrong way =) Oh and the complimentary breakfast in their restaurant - was AWESOME!!! Make sure to have the eggs and their Capuccino - just delicious - even the bacon tasted better. So I say even though it's a wee bit of a splurge - it's worth it... Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel in Italy - Excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: fulya1313
Reviews.Content: Most clean hotel I have seen in Italy .. From bedroom to bathroom , every inch of our room was spotless , very impressed by this after seeing many old hotels in Italy , this hotel makes you feel like at home. Perfect Location ! 5 mins to everywhere .. Very close to Rialto Vaporette stop if you will take the train to other cities. Personel is very friendly and did everything they could to help . Will only stay at this hotel if I go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dolly26
Reviews.Content: My new Husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights whilst on our honeymoon, and it was fantastic! Very central and reasonably easy to find and was walking distance from the airport waterbus stop. The Basilica and Dogge's Palace is only a street away and it's only a short walk to the Rialto Bridge. The hotel was getting refurbished whilst we were there and it looked incredible! We stayed in a Suite which was gorgeous, very clean and spacious with a canal view so we could see the gondolas going past! The only snag was the TV only had 2 English speaking channels, one being CNN and the other sky sports! Not that we went on honeymoon to watch TV however its fine to have on! Breakfast was great with a selection of cereals, eggs and ham, cheese, fruit, croissants etc, however no tea! When I asked the waiter for a cup of tea he looked at me like I'd just landed! Venice is an amazing city and I will question anyone who has been and not fell in love with it! It's amazing sights, food and wine totally captured me and I will most definitely be going back to this romantic city!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: bookwormisrael
Reviews.Content: Location, location and location made booking this hotel seem prudent. When we arrived we were very pleasantly surprised to find a 4 star hotel which seems to be reaching for its fifth star. We stayed in 4 different rooms and 3 of the 4 were lovely and while not large were well thought out and had all the amenities we needed. The fourth room on the 4th floor was narrow and as the furniture was not altered to the size of the room, it was less comfortable. It didn't matter as it was used for a single. Overall good service, a full breakfast ( if a bit boring ). The water taxi ordered arrived on time and all our needs were taken care of promptly. I too look forward to seeing this hotel after the renovation work is done.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Judy912
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Excellent location between St. Marks and the Rialto Bridge. If arriving by waterbus from the airport, get off at the Rialto stop, turn left, cross over first bridge and turn first right. Follow signs towards St Marks and hotel is on the right at the first canal crossing. Stayed in a huge corner room on the first floor. Beautiful bathroom with bath/shower and even a pair of slippers. Delighted to also see tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The breakfast buffet was fine - fruit, rolls,croissants, ham cheese etc. The eggs and bacon didn't look too appetising. Didn't have any trouble getting a table - all run very efficiently. Didn't have dinner in the hotel as there are so many other places to eat. As to be expected, very expensive in the St Marks area but for a casual meal by the Grand Canal would recommend Al Carbon which is at the Rilato stop. Very friendly, helpful, english speaking staff and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: JanetRob
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Splendid. Can only repeat previous reviews. Excellent location, a bit difficult to find after being dropped at Rialto Bridge by water taxi, don't forget to take copy of hotel's directions with you (unlike me). Staff were very pleasant, booked superior king room, excellent bed, spotlessly clean, newly decorated with lovely marble bathroom. Aircon in the room didn't work, only blew normal air hence room a bit hot at nights. Breakfast was ok, nothing special, no variation from day to day and a bit boring. Eggs and bacon cold all 3 days. If you only like coffee and a croisant for breakfast don't bother booking breakfast inclusive, eat in nearby cafes. Some renovation work going on at present but doesn't interfere with guests or running of hotel. Gondola mooring point right outside hotel entrance. Water taxi refused to bring us to the entrance, said they couldn't get down that way but did see other taxis 'parked' outside. Would definately recommend this hotel for romantic weekend break!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLD64
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, fabulous location. Staff were wonderful and helpful (I believe it always helps if one makes a bit of an effort to speak their language when in their country). I would definitely go back. Rooms were excellent - newly decorated, very clean and well laid out.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tedolita
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the splendid in early april 08, and for our experience we can only praise the hotel. The location is ideal for sightseeing, very close to both San Marco and Rialto, with all its shopping and restaurants and also with the vaporetto conexions from Rialto just a small distance from the hotel. If you travel more expensibly the hotel is right on a small sweet canal and has its own taxi mooring so you can be taken door to door to most places in Venice. We had Deluxe canal view rooms, on the 4th floor, and while I will say they are not the largest rooms I have seen (it is venice after all) I must say it is probably the cleanest and most beautifully appointed I have stayed at, specially when you consider it is only a 4 star hotel. The elegant decor extends to the communal areas and the restaurant, which doubles up as the breakfast area. You can see the design touches everywhere, and the attention to detail is outstanding. The only small negative is the fact that the bar is closed as it seems to be the last area being refurbished, but I really feel once the works are completely finished this hotel will be as perfect as it can be. In Our experience we found the staff to be polite and professional, and very efficient. As a little example, I made a request for some extra toiletries (as invited to do with their excellent starhotels beauty policy) but I forgot to request it when I arrived and I asked reception after we came back from a night out very late, and within 10 minutes someone turned up with a large tray full of toiletries for me to choose what I needed. All in all we had a great time and when we go back to Venice we will definitely stay at the hotel as for us it truly is Splendid in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous suite”
Reviews.Author: STBufflaoGrove
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise! Booked two rooms with double beds and received two suites with living rooms. Suites were immaculately furnished and maintained. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We traveled for two weeks throughout Italy and Germany and nothing could compare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnonHerts
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! We were on the 5th floor of what I guess must be the refurbished bit and had a fantastic room. It was spotlessly clean, modern and well equipped. Breakfast was nice if you stick to the pastries (as good as any youâ€™ll find in France) but the cooked breakfast was a bit strange â€“ orange eggs and fried ham. Having had bad experiences in Italy I was worried about how friendly the staff would be but everyone we encountered was extremely friendly and went out of their way to help us. Check out was Mid-day which we appreciated and they happily stored our bags for us. The location of the hotel canâ€™t be beaten but as itâ€™s on the main route between Saint Marks Square and Rialto it was noisy. We didnâ€™t find this a problem but light sleepers beware.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: rigby07
Reviews.Content: Excellent! everything about this hotel was lovely. it was a nice surprise as so many people had slated the hotel. We were very nicely surprised. Service was excellent, rooms were very clean, breakfast was of a good standard. we were upgraded to a canal view which was very nice. The bathrooms are marble white and beautiful. Everything is catered for, and the rooms are decorated to a very high standard. This hotel is verging on a 5*. The location is perfect, you could not stay more local to the main sights. A truly lovely stay in a beautiful place. The holiday was 1st class. I would 100% pick this hotel again! Feel free to ask any questions! claire

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: beakaldo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with breakfast #180 GB Pounds on medhotels. It was an absoloute steal, for what was a luxury hotel. The room was small and had no view but for the money paid, I was more than satisfied. The staff were all top professionals and the hotel had a very posh feel to it. On the last night a pipe burst in the bathroom. Within two minutes of calling there were two handymen at the door. The handymen were unable to do a quick repair and called reception for us to change rooms. Without even asking we were upgraded to a room three times the size with a canal view and all the mod cons you could expect. That night we sipped wine in bed having had it poured in our room by a waiter. I don't think I will ever experience a hotel room like that again unless I win the lottery! Truly class and anyone who has booked the hotel can look forward to a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzi_j
Reviews.Content: Perfect directions to this hotel are a must but it was well worth pulling our suitcases up and down streets when we found this hotel. Don't worry though, once you have been there once, you won't loose it again. Everything about the hotel was perfect. We booked there for our anniversary and this hotel made it so special. From the fully stocked mini bar, to the complimentary slipper, the view of the canal and the amazing staff I have no complaints about this hotel at all. And I had the best nights sleep in years as the bed was so fantastic. I didn't have dinner in the hotel but I made sure I was up for breakfast and was not dissappointed. A wide variety of breads, cakes and filled croissant were available, along with egg and bacon, fruit and yoghurt. Also, the waiter brought as much coffee and warm milk to the table as you needed. With the excellent location, this hotel could afford to let standards drop, but they haven't in any way. Even though there was some work going on in the hotel while we were there, it did not disturb us at all. I can't praise this hotel enough, it is central to San Marco and the Rialto and is right next to shops such as Hermes and Gucci so there's something for everyone here.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: mompy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at this amazing hotel. It is perfectly located midway between the Rialto and Piazza San Marco. Literally 5 minutes walk to both. We have stayed in hotels in most continents and spend most of our time travelling but never felt so strongly about a hotel before. Room 510 is gorgeous. Large terrace over the canal. Beautifully, yes beautifully decorated room with all amenities, flat screen TV, coffee and tea facility, lovely toiletries, choice of pillows!!, hardwood floor, large lit wardrobe, light feather down quilts and so on and so forth. Great breakfast in the beautiful restaurant. We're sad that we didn't stay in for dinner but will definitely do so next time. We're not returning to Venice unless we can stay at the Splendid and we so want to return to Venice to do all the stuff we didn't manage this time. Prospective visitors are welcome to get in touch for advice or comments.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good !”
Reviews.Author: ACC66
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel during Carnival. Very good location , fee minutes walking for all main tourist atractions. The room we staid was very good, big and the new furnish is a sucess. It was a enjoable stay. However, they need to upgrade the breakfast (more diversified). Next time in Venetie I will book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Barganax
Reviews.Content: I sayed here for two nights with my wife. the hotel was great! We had never been to Venice so were a tad unsure of distances etc. but we walked with luggage from the Rialto bridge water ferry stop in a few minutes. The hotel was spotless, the rooms immaculate and the service friendly. it was not the greatest breakfast I ever ate, but about ok. I found the location wonderful, minutes from St Marks square and seconds from the shops. The area was quiet and the canal side location romantic. (Maybe Venice is quiet in February?) A great location, a great base. Tips? Watch out for the restaurants, they are very, very expensive. The closer to St Marks the worse it is. Drink your St Marks coffee in the Doges Palace coffee shop, cheap and great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: mykpilliod
Reviews.Content: We started every day with a wonderful breakfast that was included in the price of the hotel. We were welcomed every day by a wonderful gentleman that was there with a smile everyday. Our favorite waiter, although they were all wonderful, was Giovanni. I am a large man and I was lovingly referred to as "Gigante". Giovanni would bring my wife and I a few cappuccinos and some friendly words. He was the highlight of the hotel for us. The breakfast was great and we were good to go until the afternoon. Our room was immaculate and very comfortable. The price was very reasonable especially during Carnivale. GREAT SHOWER! I never got the hang of the Bidet. Comfortable bed with your choice of six different types of pillows, we kept the standard. The location was within walking distance of everything. Dining, drinks, and shopping all around. Great central location to all of Venice. Then front desk was nice and friendly upon check in and out. We did not have a need for their assistance at any other times. 3 minute walk from San Marco. 5+ minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. Water taxi at the hotel door if you wish. My wife and I have traveled many parts of the world and we would both highly reccomend this hotel for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: ladyvette2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected by the tour group. The hotel was recently refurbished and they did an excellent job. The rooms, though small was extremely well done and VERY clean. The bed was the most confortable bed I have ever slept in, with oversized quilts. Exceptionall!! The hotel is close to everything and we were able to walk confortably to everywhere. The restaurants were very nice and the food and service was excellent. The hotel was very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: lrnyn
Reviews.Content: Overall very pleased with the hotel. Had a renovated canal view room. The room was modern, comfortable, and the beds were great. Rooms are small but this is europe of course. The hotel website is useless and doesn't give any directions to the hotel. The location, however, is unbeatable between Rialto and San Marco square. I've stayed at more "prestigious" hotels in Venice but I would definitely return here for the modern rooms and location. Breakfast was average with coldcuts, breads, and fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MDAdvisor
Reviews.Content: We were on a Perillo Tour and this was the hotel that they selected for Venice. The hotel was well located, the rooms were lovely, newly renovated and had terrific bedding and bathrooms. This was the best hotel we had on the Perillo Tour. The food was fine. We had breakfast there and one dinner. Excellent choice! Try it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackRussellTerrier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour package, but we were a bit concerned when I read some negative reviews on TripAdvisor. We were, therefore, especially pleased that our stay in this hotel was so pleasant. First, our room had been recently renovated and was lovely with a really comfortable bed and a large, also renovated bathroom. Second, the breakfasts which were included in our package were delicious and much more than the continental breakfast we were expecting. The staff was pleasant and helpful and the location couldn't be beat. I will add that some of the people on the tour said that their bathrooms were much smaller or didn't have bathtubs as ours did. They all liked their rooms, however.

Reviews.Title: “starhotels terrific”
Reviews.Author: beachbum2174
Reviews.Content: The hotel is still renovating, but the new rooms are well worth stepping over construction in the hallways. The furnishings are beautiful, all marble baths, everything you would expect in a four star hotel. Best of all was the location -- on a canal halfway between the Rialto bridge and the Plaza San Marco, with the best shopping in Venice in both directions. This hotel will be perfect when it is finished. I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, modern hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KCS728
Reviews.Content: If you want a modern, renovated hotel in the heart of the tourist district, this hotel is wonderful. You will not find antique furniture and old-world charm here. This hotel has been renovated in modern Italian style. I'm not sure what room the last reviewer stayed in, but my Junior Suite looked exactly like the picture--down to the leather and velvet headboard and lavender pillows. There was no dingy carpet here--only beautiful new wood floors. The bathroom was all new white carrera marble and chrome. The towels could have been fluffier, but the Frette robe and slippers were very comfortable. The location really couldn't be beat. It is right between St. Mark's Square and the Rialto bridge, so we were only steps away from the major tourist sites (and an easy walk or vaporetto ride away from everything). It is also on a very nice shopping street. The hotel is directly on a canal (not the Grand Canal), and a water taxi should be able to take you right to the door, so don't let a water taxi driver tell you otherwise (we learned this the hard way and lugged our bags through St. Mark's on our first day). The breakfast that is included was also better than we expected. They serve delicious, freshly-baked croissants and other breads, along with cereals, fruits, meats, and yogurts. You can also get eggs and bacon, too. My son loved the hot chocolate. The staff was very helpful with directions, recommendations, and arranging transportation back to the airport. When I booked the reservation, I requested an early check-in (we were getting off a cruise ship at 9am), and our room was ready when we got there around 10:30am. There must be some rooms in the hotel that are not renovated (hence the mixed reviews), so make sure you specify a renovated room and you should not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe the pictures! SCAM ALERT!”
Reviews.Author: globetrekker01
Reviews.Content: Based on the good reviews and photos, we booked a triple room for three nights. Got to the room and were SEVERELY DISAPPOINTED! The hallways were dark dingy and the room was shabby with gross carpet and uncomfortable beds with old sheets. The other rooms down the hall were gorgeous but we did not know there were two sides of the hotel. We paid top dollar for a motel like room. BE SURE TO ASK FOR A RENNOVATED ROOM WHEN YOU BOOK BECAUSE THEY WON'T SWITCH YOU WHEN YOU GET THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TheKKKtookMyBabyAway
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Splendide Suisse for three nights in June with my sister and parents. Highly recommended. We had two suites, double and twin, which were spacious, elegant and comfortable.The furnishings etc were of a high standard. Excellent sized bathroom, good sized bath with powerful shower, separate lounge area and extremely comfortable beds with a choice of pillows. Robes and slippers provided, good sized wardrobe and drawers. Decent full sized mirrors and lighting in bathroom and lounge for preparing for the evening out. Lighting arrangements well thought out, night light provided for reading without disturbing your sleeping partner. T.V. in bedroom and CD player/radio in lounge, which was furnished with a sofa, table and chairs. The rooms were very quiet the suite was recently renovated and furnishings etc were of a high standard. The air conditioning was very efficient for those afternoon naps. Spacious, attractive lobby area with helpful staff. Absolutely superb location, very close to San Marco and the Rialto. The restaurant and bar were closed for renovations which was a shame, but a reasonable breakfast was offered at a nearby hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spendid Suisse was Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Murray100
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay: 4/25 - 4/27 2007 Newly renovated; when we were there work was still being done. Breakfast buffet could not be served in hotel as the venue was not available. One of the entrances was still closed. The lobby area was extremely small. Rooms were clean with modern furniture. Unfortunately our room had no drawers whatsoever, we had to live out of our suitcases. The safe was in an inaccessibe location and the instructions for its use were too low to be legible. A sign was provided that stated the in-room safe was not to be used for valuables! The bathroom, as were most bathrooms in Europe, was small and uncomfortable with no real shower. The major feature of this hotel is its location. It is 200 feet away from St. Marks Square and the center of activity. Marvelous restaurants, sightseeing and shopping virtually at your feet.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: amylouUtah
Reviews.Content: This was a horrible, dirty hotel. When we booked our room the picture was lovely. We asked the front desk what the picture on the internet was from and they told us they only had one room that actually looked like that. It was stinky, dirty, and had bed bugs. I would never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: revtraveler
Reviews.Content: I led a group cruisetour that began in Rome and ended in Venice at the Splendid Suisse. The two nights spent at this property provided us with a wonderful location for experiencing the magic that is the unique city of canals. a mere five minute stroll to Piazza St. Marco and the Grande Canal, and about the same to the Rialto Bridge made this a fine choice by our travel agent. The rooms were well appointed and very comfortable, the staff was very helpful in answering any questions and even helping to track down misplaced cruise luggage. Theer are wonderful restaurants just steps away, and the rabbit-warren of walkways make for great afternoon adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Suisse not so splendid!”
Reviews.Author: Mhouses
Reviews.Content: We were part of a choral singing group touring Italy in July '06. Venice was our first stop and we spent 4 days there. We were very unimpressed with this hotel. The staff was unpleasant and unhelpful and the rooms sub-par. I guess we were stuck in the un-refurbished part of the hotel, because none of our rooms matched any of the reference photos given to us. The air conditioning was non-existant. Bathroom fixtures broke off in your hand. Elevators were commonly not working. The restaurant was outrageously overpriced for the quality of its food. Venice was wonderfulâ€¦magical! We hope to go back again soon, but certainly not to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Shel2
Reviews.Content: Renovations are still going on at this hotel but do'nt let it put you off. We had a lovely room( I e-mailed ahead to check that we had a room in the renovated area) It is true that the unrenovated parts of the hotel are tired looking but that is the reason for the on going facelift. Work is slow in Venice because all rubble has to go out of the window down a shute into a small canal boat, and all materials have to be bought in this way, they are not taken through the hotel. We saw and heard nothing inside the hotel. We found all the staff from the front desk, porters, waiters, bar staff to the cleaners to be friendly, helpful and a good sense of humour. Breakfast although not exciting was substantional with a reasonable enough mix, cereal, eggs, bacon,cold meats, cheese, rolls and fruit. We had a lovely meal in the restuarant in the evening the steak was cooked to perfection and the waiters were friendly and amusing.All in all we enjoyed our stay here, and would go back, after all the decor can only improve and the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: FELICIAFELICE
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. The deal is that it is undergoing renovation and when you book you are not advised whether you are going to get one of the renovated or non-renovated rooms. There is a major difference. The non-renovated rooms appear not to have been decorated since the sevenites. Our room was dark, with carpeted walls, badly stained carpet and out-dated bathroom fixtures. After speaking to the management we were moved on the final night to a junior suite at no extra cost in the renovated section. These rooms are fab. Breakfast was quite good but the public areas in the hotel are severly lacking. Again filthy carpets, outdated furniture/decoration, nothing happening. The location is excellent, stones throw from St. Mark Square. Bottom line - do not stay here unless you are guaranteed a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daisy333
Reviews.Content: We had read mixed reviews about this hotel but have to say that it was wonderful. Our room was in the newly refurbished area of the hotel and whilst I cannot speak for the areas that have not been refurbished, this room was excellent. No rooms in Venice are overlarge and this was no exception - however it was richly decorated, sumptuously comfortable and made excellent use of the space available. The staff were courteous, helpful and friendly. The only small issue we had was that the breakfast menu was limited and the restaurant is yet to be refurbished. On the whole an excellent hotel where we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Artie_Stevens
Reviews.Content: We got a room at the Splendid Suisse after we discovered an error in our original booking plans. I agree with some of the earlier reviews that the reception staff were not particularly friendly, but that was evened out by the location. Our room was pretty standard hotel fare but certainly comfortable and a perfect haven from the stress of the booking error. Breakfast in the morning was terrific, and the restaurant staff were very helpful and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a 14 day guided tour of Italy. There were many other tour groups staying with us. I learned that this hotel is a combination of 5 homes that were linked together so the rooms do vary. Even the hallways and corridors are different. We stayed in the white hallway and had a lovely newly renovated room on the 3rd floor overlooking the canal. We had 2 windows not a balcony. The Red hallway had a few rooms with balconies overlooking a narrow walkway. Our room was light and bright with a blonde hardwood floor. Good Ac lots of of storage space, dresser, desk, double closet. It was very contemporary with very comfortable bedding, blackout draperies and windows that open. The bathroom was large , white marble, excellent water pressure including typical toiletries. There is a coffee maker in the room and packets of coffee, tea and hot chocolate available. Rooms numbers ending in 1-50 used a separate elevator and that was our section. Rooms 51 and above used the back elevator and were in the red corridor. The location is absolutely wonderful and allows easy access to all of Venice. One note: we were there when St Marks did have ankle deep water one morning near and in the church so we had to walk on scaffolding. It was removed at 11 am when the tide lowered. It was not a problem and they deal with it quickly. Did not see any water in the hotel or nearby.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: marsob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights,found the location was very good but the room was very small. Was with a tour group some had spacious rooms others had the same as us. A bit of a lucky dip required.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Splendid Suisse!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyFL
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Splendid 3 nights post cruise (Aug. 30-Sept.2). Arriving in Venice by cruise ship, we walked around for a good hour or more (probably in circles) trying to find the hotel -- until a wonderful couple from Miami took it upon themselves to help us find it. The hotel was quite a surprise. We had heard that some of it was undergoing renovations, but our travel agent made sure we got into a modern room. It was nicely appointed, not huge, but certainly big enough. The bathroom was beautiful and had every possible amenity, including a small tv. We found the front desk staff very helpful. A complimentary breakfast buffet was a welcome plus every morning. All in all, I would say this hotel is a find. You can't beat the location, the price is reasonable too. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and modern room”
Reviews.Author: kepet
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Spendid-Suisse. We were impressed with the location. The location is in the heart of good shopping and restuarants not to mention just minutes from San Marco square. The rooms were relatively spacious and appeared to be very clean. The restaurant in the hotel offered great service and the hotel staff provided good service as well. (A staff member actually came up to our room to open a bottle us as we did not have a bottle-opener). Overall - above average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Comfortable Rooms - Good Food”
Reviews.Author: WillThompson
Reviews.Content: When initially booking the hotel, I was concerned about the several reviews noting some ongoing construction. Our room was in the building with the restaurant across the alley from check-in, and we saw no signs of ongoing renovations. Our room was modernly appointed, clean, and comfortable. The air-conditioning was like a dream on the hot July days. We had no complaints whatsoever during our 2 night stay. The breakfasts were good, but not fantastic. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The location was absolutely perfect as it right between Rialto and St Marc's; however, it was a little hard to find at first as first time visitors. I would call ahead and take a very detailed map as the "roads" are small and somewhat disorienting. Nevertheless, you can't go wrong with this hotel once situated.

Reviews.Title: “functional”
Reviews.Author: anxst
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be a mis-mash of parts some of which are in process of renovation. My room was fine, bright and airy. It is a functional hotel in the centre that for me, lacked a certain charm. Hotel could have been anywhere and didn't necessarily reflect it's situation in one of the most beautiful cities of the world. On checking out, bill had some 'added' items which were taken off after some discussion. For a short stay, this is a quiet, functional hotel. I would stay here again, if only for the central location and the likelihood of a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Anna M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from April 1st -10th 2006. Not sure why we got a suite, maybe because we indicated it was our anniversary. We were very happy! The suite was beautiful, huge, with walking closet, receiving room, living room, big bedroom and huge bathroom with whirpool, most be the most expensive room in the hotel! No view, but we didnt need it. Our keyroom was heavy, not as the others in the tour. Nobody talk about having a great room so we didnt talk a lot with them about it :) You can tell if you are in the new isle of the hotel, because some halls are dark, others redecorated. We walked and suddenly we saw a completely lighted hall with a great decoration. Lobby is so, so, nice staff, breakfast buffet ok, with variety of things. Very close to everything, 5min St MArks. We ate a lot of gelato!, you cant get lost here.

Reviews.Title: “OLD SECTION WAS HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of my tour with my 4 year old son & parents. Let me start by saying that I travel often. We arrived at 9pm & were given room 262 & 279. We went up to the 2nd floor only to find out we were in the wrong section of the hotel. It would have been nice if they had told us before lugging up 4 suitcases. We then went to what is obviously the old section of the hotel. Very old burgandy carpet on the walls was a giveaway of what the rooms were like. Yes the rooms are small but most European hotel rooms are. The ashtray on my night table still had ashes in it. I would not step foot in the shower as it was dirty - the ceiling above the tub was mirrored and disgusting. My mother told me she wouldn't take a show as did one other female (there were only 4 females in our tour). The breakfast and restaurant were great. The location is great. Just ask to stay in the new section!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice clean hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: ronadebra
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nites on floor 4- Room was small but clean- bathroom was very modern and new. Furnishings were new and stylish. THey are doing renovations in the hotel so the lobby is a little disruptive. Great location- easy walk to S Marco and Rialto Bridge Service at Breakfast was good-

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OCtraveler18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in July. The rooms were nice- we had a two room suite. The hotel was in a perfect location. The breakfast was not very good and the front desk was not too friendly, but I would still stay here again if it was a good price.
